commentBody: Identity politics brings out the worst in people. Whether it is Amy Cooper, Jussie Smollett, riots where people attacks innocents to prove another point, all it shows is that the accusers are flawed, that victimhood is a very problematic position, fraught with unfair aggression. How quickly victims turn to perpetrators today is probably due to how the position is celebrated in media. No wonder. Victimhood allows you to spit in the face of others without consequences - it is the most entitled and privileged position there is today. What happens to a society when it only celebrates weakness? It is the beginning of the end. The downfall of true morality and individual happiness and trust. Because you cannot trust the person who solves life by accusing, not through overcoming and giving. People of color are becoming incredibly racist in the USA. I have read books about race presented with such bias that they made me imagine that this is how Mein Kampf was written, Hitler’s statement of victimhood and moral superiority. The racist always feels morally superior. When the thesis of much of this literature and its reachers are based on the premise that their skin color makes them morally superior, then we must take heed. History has taught us this is racism.
Not so "peaceful" in the Bronx last night.
I was awaiting a huge bolt of lightening to explode over Trump while he was mishandling the Bible.
Trump has never read a book in his life, let alone the Bible.
We are proud of you...fight the tyranny ! We will help you

Dangerous superficial one liners is what this Reality President loves because that is what his brain can understand. “The only good Democrat is a Dead Democrat”,  a few weeks ago, now “when the looting starts, the shooting starts” two days ago. These are the phrases which guide his world view. He ties to brand everything and everybody, “Lyin’ Ted” and uses one liners as his personal mission statements. 

He is a danger to our country and to the world.

He must be removed. Prosecute him. Remove him now, not November, as November may never come.
The caption under the photo of Trump in front of St. John church should have been the Sinclair Lewis quote "When fascism comes to America it will be wrapped in the flag and carrying a cross."

userDisplayName: There for the grace of A.I. goes I
commentBody: The Quiet Citizens ....see an Empty display of aggression in support of the resisting of arrest when being taken in for a Crime/ Yes Excessive Force is a Crime as well and the Cop will have his day in court/ Where is the presumed Innocent?  The fact that it's being played up as a Race statement is going to be looked back on as the Card that took away more Freedom's than it gave / Just look at China and how they dye their Water cannons with blue dye so they can Arrest those who protest/ The only difference between Biden's / Sanders Socialism and Communism is Communist point a Gun at your head!

That loud, grinding sound you are now hearing coming from California is the sound of Ronald Reagan spinning in his grave. I am sure he is as embarrassed and disturbed by the actions of the thugs and criminals who hide behind the mantle of “protesters” while stealing everything they can grab as we all are.  

Ronnie, we sorely miss you.
What’s the point of the NYOD arresting rioters and looters when Cuomo’s “bail reform” law lets them out a few hours later...to go back on the street to riot and looting?

"Peaceful Protesters Defy Curfew"?

A curfew is mandatory.  Violating curfew isn't a "peaceful" act.  The Times continues its efforts to defend protestors.  It clearly doesn't realize they are no friend to Black Americans.

So the "Peaceful Protester" narrative continues.  Try telling that to the shop owners who saw their livelihoods destroyed last night by looters and arsonists.  When they make a curfew, it is illegal to be out, protesting or otherwise.

This is coming to a crisis. America will have to choose. Trump's way or a new way. You have to choose, each of you. I don't know which it'll be. But I do know that if its Trump's way, America is finished.

America is in desperate need of enlightened leadership in Washington and we need it now. Our cities are burning and there is enormous pressure for Joe to pick a “woman of color” as his Veep. However, his selection should not be based upon political expediency, but on color-blind preconditions of basic competence and relevant experience. Yet, we must demonstrably reconcile the brutal reality of slavery and the silent hypocrisy of Jim Crow with the high-sounding principles of our founding Constitution and established institutions. This contradiction is, and remains, the “Original Sin” that continues to taint our aspirational beginnings.

Elizabeth Warren is still the most qualified candidate to help Biden structurally transform the “Last Mile” of our broken economic system where most of our people struggle to survive (and to be prepared to step into Joe’s shoes on “Day One” if necessary). Concurrently, our country needs more than a politically expedient figurehead to implement systemic change in the administration of justice in our corridors of power. Thus, to show that he has the wisdom to be a “transformative President” as he proclaims, Joe Biden should immediately hold a news conference with Betsy Warren as his selected VP and Barack Obama as his nominated Attorney General to lead the Department of Justice. The Biden/Warren/Obama Trifecta of Decency/Fairness/and Trust in Government will bring us back from the brink of what is truly an existential crises.

userLocation: The Yay Area Of Northern California
commentBody:
Despite the awful tragedy that has claimed the life of Mr. George Floyd, the individuals who have been organizing peacefully to demonstrate their anger, disappointment, disgust, displeasure, and frustrations with the system should continue to protest in a non-confrontational and non-destructive way. Though most of the coverage by all outlets of news sources(longstanding and social media platforms) have been focusing on the deaths and injuries to the groups of people who have constantly faced discrimination for many generations, and further deaths(including those within law enforcement ranks), the resulting damages to businesses and property; the effect that it has is only feeding Trump and his supporters flame.

The news and social media outlets should utilize more space and time on their platforms to cover and highlight the positive experiences and outcomes of the protests and demonstrations, than show what embarrassing and shameful act Trump does next-and the resulting carnage that ensues. That way the possibility of those actors(whoever's side they are on) inciting theft and violence may ease up. The US Military's purpose is to protect this country against all enemies, foreign and domestic. Never to disperse a crowd of peaceful demonstrators so that a would be Commander-In-Chief can stroll to a place of worship for a "dishonorable" photo-op.

I am quite concerned come this November... I am in the same car with Prime Minister Trudeau. Watching with consternation and horror.

Why are we supposed to care what W Bush has to say?  He sits and does paintings of young men he sent to an illegal war which has basically never ended.   He is mindless violence personified and one of the major reasons for the decline of this country in the last twenty years.  He is utterly immoral.
I'm ready to be 60 year old peaceful protester. If this is what it takes to send a message to our law enforcement communnity that it is not ok to put a knee on a guys neck, so be it.

commentBody: We need to take the anger,determination, need for big change on the streets to the polls in November. I hope the thousands of young people protesting the ongoing racism and police brutality will vote. Donald Trump does not deserve to be President or anything else. Racism, pandemic and Trump makes America sick, not great. Vote for a better country for everyone. Trump, worst President in the history of our country!

Waiting for the inevitable Tiananmen Square moment with rolling tanks down Pennsylvania Avenue...this time the tanks will not stop, very sad indeed. Peace IS the only answer & remember,  There is only one race. The human race.
People of Scotland and the whole of the UK are protesting and standing with good people of the USA against racism.  Protest events are being held across the UK.

NPR
@NPR
Dozens of public health and disease experts have signed an open letter in support of the nationwide anti-racism protests.

"White supremacy is a lethal public health issue that predates and contributes to COVID-19," they wrote.

Retired St. Louis Police Chief David Dorn, murdered by looters in St. Louis.

Downtown Sacramento, CA small businesses decimated by these protesters. Windows smashed. Buildings defaced. And now, curfews.

I am African American and the descendant of slaves on both my parents' sides. This nightmare has absolutely nothing to do with civil rights or civil liberties. Quite the opposite. These people are destroying small businesses, neighborhoods, livelihoods, individual freedoms (curfews), and futures.

There will be a reckoning, only not with Trump. Trump was self-destructing all by himself by virtue of his sorry character until these people and the willfully blind media coverage of them decided to try and save him.

Well done.
So...among the active brainstorming sessions at the White House on how to look tough, were there any on how to address the underlying cause of the protests?

Don't play the odds you will be safe demonstrating with Trump as President. He desires sadistic control of the nation. Don't satisfy him.

Before the demonstrations, I termed Trump an Anarchist. Now his people are calling everyone else the same thing. It's a propaganda battle now.

I took issue with the photo of all the troops standing guard at the Lincoln Memorial, the tribute to a man who ended slavery by law, but we are all slaves of the troops.

Why would a leader, choose to go stand in front of a church with a Bible? With no rational reason whatsoever.. it calls to mind a strange picture of some prominent people gathered around him , laying hands on him in prayer...
why are the press who hitherto only faced verbal assault, are now facing physical assault?
Why is the national guard ready to strike?
I won't say anything more...!

commentBody:
"Protests have largely been peaceful"??? This has 'largely' not been the case, certainly not in my hometown.

Does the Times not think there is any relation between "the arrival of dozens of military vehicles on Washington's streets" on Tuesday, and the "slowing of violent clashes" with police? 

The ongoing failure of many mayors to order a graduated police response to incidents of violence seems to have emboldened the small percentage of protesters who are violent. In the Lafayette Park incident, the USPP reported that protesters attacked them with bricks and bottles as the USPP was setting up a security fence. It was then that the USPP dispersed protesters.
When will the police department determine if George Floyd and Derek Chauvin had a personal relationship ?

This juxtaposition can’t be overemphasized:

1) white heavily ARMED protestors inside the Michigan Capitol building yelling at law officers without any pushback.

2) peaceful protestors and media coverage exercising their FIRST AMENDMENT right to free speech and assembly being shot at with rubber bullets and tear gas, sprayed in the face with pepper spray, and hit with night sticks.

This is a big part of what this is all about. Unchecked and overuse of force against Americans exercising constitutional rights.

There is an unspoken caste system in America. It’s a major problem that needs to be addressed.

Mayor Steinberg of Sacramento, California called in the National Guard.  Not that Sacramento, its suburbs or the neighboring cities such as Fairfield, or farther even, San Jose, California, matter much, but the National Guard has helped quell the very intense vandalism and whole sale looting which has accompanied the protests.  Sac Chief of Police Hahn needed them. 

There was an early curfew and it was enforced an hour after its expiration time.  

These are youth anywhere from fourteen years of age, to twenty-five in the streets of major US cities.  This is their first protest, it seems, without leadership.  They have no codified demands. They shout and have the stamina to stay up all night days at a time.  But there is a spark of a beginning of something, of which they have no idea what it is or what to do with it. 

They aren't even taking the opportunity to register to vote, or perform the census online.  

I think they are protesting 

the lack of a job
the lack of a future with a job
the lack of secure housing
the lack of a future with happiness
having to return to parents

Police misconduct is NOT all racial - it is aimed at anyone who is not wealthy.  The worst color to be in this country is green, that is to be disabled.  

There are no disabled protesters in wheelchairs or with oxygen tanks in any of the George Floyd protests. There is an entire continuum of people adversely treated by Police Sheriff.  The dialogue about police I want transcends race.

Unfortunately, peaceful protesting has very low impact on the people in power; in the end, it appears that only violence, with occasional exceptions, can lead to profound change. Let current events be a lesson to our lawmakers: don't push citizens to their limits.

commentBody: The conditions of lack of universal healthcare, housing, justice, a living wage, and on and on, are not peaceful. People living under these conditions with varying levels of severity and stress are not living in peaceful times. Being denied basic rights is not living under peaceful times. Take back the narrative my fellow Americans.
Was Joe Biden's photo op of him on his knee in a Black Church any more authentic than Trump's photo op?

commentBody: Is there no bottom to the depravity of Barr? He needs to go!

Why should protesters -- whether or not "peaceful" --
be given any greater right to "defy curfews" --
than any one else?

Likewise, why should people
be allowed to congregate without "social distancing"
to protest
any more than anyone else congregating without social distancing for any other reason?

The right of "free speech" is a right to speak without government interference with the content of the speech.

If someone can defy curfews --
or defy regulations about "social distancing" --
to speak about George Floyd,
then anyone else ought to be able to defy curfews
or defy regulations about social distancing --
to speak about any other topic whatsoever.

If the narrative belongs to the citizens of this country, we should then be allowed to share our voice if we are grateful that only peaceful protests are tolerated. Harvard research has indicated that peaceful protests are significantly more successful than violent ones and it was the inspiration of Martin Luther King and his narrative of non-violence which brought us the Fair Housing Act of 1968.

Peaceful protests in the streets and presence at the ballot box are the only means of real change.

I for one am grateful that my city has honored the curfew imposed by our governor, and that organization and purpose won here, over chaos and violence.

I wish I was brave enough to protest out the front of the headquarters of Fox News. The sign would be something like "Blood on your hands" I wouldn't be violent but gees it would be tempting. Then there is all the donors to the Republican/Democrat parties who have made sure that no policy change affects them except for the better.  The inequality in the USA is remarkable because of the overwhelming belief of American exceptionalism.  So disheartening.

commentBody:
While I can't afford my subscription .. your article, "How trump's idea for a photo OP led to havoc in park." is, perhaps, the finest I have ever seen in journalism, graphics, and photos  ... I find, no reason not to keep my subscription going.  It's a stunning report that makes me, as trump does, claim it as mine. 
(For background, I grew up watching Linotype operators at work.)
And to keep it on target, I enjoy live updates ...
(If I have to live in a 24-hour world then I want, up-to-the-minute, 24-hour news.  Print vs. TV ... Print give me a chance to mull over a thought while TV entertains the eyes. ) 

The world doesn't sleep and you would know this if you listen to the rocks.
The president must resign now for the good of our Country. Our Country cannot take another five months of all this hatred.

commentBody: Things may be slowing down a tad because there's not much left to loot, or at least the choicest large-screen TVs and Rolexes are already gone. There have been few tuly peaceful protests, just covers for looting and vandalism. The constitution guarantees the right to peaceably assemble, but the government has the duty to maintain order. Few of those protesting even try to maintain the fiction of there being peaceful protests, but rather seek to excuse the vandalism and looting that are part and parcel of the program.

commentBody: So now you have peaceful protestors in LA (many of whom will be taxpayers) being arrested by cops (whose wages are paid by those taxes) for exercising their democratic rights, while three cops in Minneapolis still haven't been arrested for their part of the killing of George Floyd.

From the website Statista, # of people shot to death by US police:   In 2017, it was 457 whites, 223 blacks, 117 hispanic, 44 other.  In 2018, 339 whites, 209 blacks, 148 hispanic, 36 other. In 2019, 370 whites, 235 blacks, 158 hispanic, 39 other.  In 2020 (so far), 42 whites, 31 blacks, 13 hispanic, 3 other.  There is also another column labeled unknown, which has 84 white, 204 black, 202 hispanic, 139 other but not sure what that is about.
Don't blame him for holding the Bible upside down and backwards......it was burning his fingers!
Inspired by his buddy in North Korea? Or, his buddy in the Kremlin? Or, is he aspiring for his own Tiananmen square? So many awful choices...
Barr is laughable…..

Hundreds of black businesses and neighborhoods are being torched. Multiple black people have been killed in these riots. 
We would all do well to remember the name of every celebrity that is offering bail to the criminals that are destroying black lives.

A small man with immense power. 
That’s what we have here.
If the vice-president and cabinet members truly love this country, they should invoke the 25th amendment. Only the removal of Trump can save this country.

commentBody:
As horrific a death as his was, this is bigger than George Floyd. Much bigger. 

It’s been said many times now and in the past that a riot is the language of the unheard. Nothing could be more true—particularly now. 

For the most part, the places burning are symbols of insidious corporate culture and overarching police power. The unheard are sending a very clear and very present message that they will no longer tolerate dehumanizing treatment at the hands those who are supposed to defend and protect them. 

As a former resident of 15-years in a working class neighborhood in New York City, I have seen my share of the damage the police can inflict—many do so without compunction in the community they proudly claim to serve. 

Let me be clear here: this kind of “policing” is not about making cities safer. It is about controlling the poor—plain and simple. Because the greatest crime in America is to be poor—plain and simple. 

And if you don’t know that, then you should. This isn’t that difficult to understand. Just don’t act like you don’t. 

By setting it off and letting it burn, it’ll send a message to all the non-believers: those who simply can’t understand why this is happening.

commentBody:
If the protesters would limit their gatherings to the daytime hours, they could set themselves apart, physically and morally, from the looters and criminals who have been using the protests as cover for mayhem.

And everyone who believes both in justice and in dignity would benefit.

And one more benefit that arises from guaranteeing that protests remain intense but peaceful:  Violent actions such as the disgraceful attack upon the peaceful protesters in Lafayette Park -- merely for Bunker Boy to get his photo op -- would serve as a stark contrast to the behavior of citizens who have gathered to express their First Amendment rights freely and civilly.

[{'commentID': 107399857, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107399857, 'userID': 65473398, 'userDisplayName': 'ms', 'userLocation': 'ca', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "@Daniel I've been to other protests in the past and other than your idea of limiting the hours to daylight or specific hours (which I also thought about), the protests I went to also 

- Requested attendees register for the event - this was more for the organizers' logistics but could also distinguish the non-violent from the potentially violent

-- Asked us to carry clear bags - decrease chances of guns/ bombs/ other weapons 

-- Limited the size of signs and how they were constructed - i.e. no wood sticks 

These don't have to be the rules organizers follow exactly but they should consider them. commentBody: I'm amazed that our President didn't immediately burst into flames when he held the Bible aloft.  The Old Testament come to life...

“Each day, our officers leave their own families and homes to protect yours, while being shot at, having Molotov cocktails thrown into their vehicles and getting intentionally struck by cars,” NYPD Commissioner Dermot Shea tweeted Tuesday. “They put their very lives on the line to fulfill the oath they took to ensure public safety.”

Big disappointment to Trump supporters the military hasn't opened fire on peaceful Americans for the capital offense of defying curfew. Keep holding out, Trump supporters. Maybe you'll get another Charlottesville. We know you loved that.

Dear 82nd Airborne,

You have about 24 hours, and one confrontation before the American people will look on you forever as traitors.  Make your decision. Obeying a manifestly unlawful order, like to go to war against your own people, is a crime.  You are going to be criminals or traitors come weekend if you do not withdraw.  The American people are watching and we do not need to thank anyone for their service if it was service to a dictator.

commentBody: It saddened me to see a heavily armed invasion of the National Guard at the Lincoln Memorial today.  Was this necessary?  I doubt anyone will try to steal Lincoln's hands.  The Memorial is or was a place of respite away from all of the tourists on the Mall during the day and a space of quiet calm at night.

Houston had a peaceful, 60,000 person demonstration today, in which the Chief of Police knelt with others out of respect for Floyd, and organizers, local representatives, Mayor Turner, a rap star, and a respected 90 year old pastor spoke.   Bricks left around the city by those hoping to inspire people to throw them were reported to 311 and disposed of by citizens.  More headlines for this type of powerful gathering, please.
At a psychological level, the drama and titillation of protesting creates a sense of excitement, potency and significance that is missing from most people's daily lives.
Most likely Barr was lying about intending to clear the park before Trump did his little routine. They lie. That's what they do.

The Obama/Biden DOJ investigated the local governments and police departments of Ferguson and Baltimore after police brutality set off mass riots. Systemic racism was discovered and sweeping changes were made in those two cities to further equal rights and justice. That was just 4 years ago.

During mass riots now, the Trump/Pence DOJ just unleashed police brutality to clear the way for a macho photo op in front of a church with Trump wielding a Bible like a bludgeon. There is nothing sincere about this attempt to look tough after hiding in a White House bunker with the lights out.

See the difference?

Trump is paranoid and afraid to go out in public right now because he knows how many people hate him.

Biden is out mingling with the public and listening to what they have to say. He does not feel threatened by the American people.

The difference between the two is obvious. Trump is a cowardly fraud and Biden is a real leader.

A riot is the voice of the unheard? Really? In NYC? "Of all the records shattered by Mr. de Blasio’s landslide victory, perhaps the most remarkable is that virtually every vote cast by black New Yorkers — 96 percent — went his way. He captured a bigger portion of the black vote than David N. Dinkins in 1989 when he was elected New York City’s first black mayor with 91 percent of the black vote, according to exit polls." Many Black New Yorkers Are Seeing de Blasio’s Victory as Their Own https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/11/nyregion/many-black-new-yorkers-are-seeing-de-blasios-victory-as-their-own.html And remember when DeBlasio said this: "My message to the Jewish community, and all communities, is this simple: the time for warnings has passed. I have instructed the NYPD to proceed immediately to summons or even arrest those who gather in large groups. This is about stopping this disease and saving lives. Period." Then this week DeBlasio's own daughter is arrested in a violent protest. Someone will have to explain to me what exactly is gained from protesting anonymously when you could just sit down with your own father the Mayor for five minutes to state your case directly to the most powerful politician in NYC?

commentBody:
The disgusting depths to which this administration will stoop have no limits, like a cesspit whose bottom is only reached in Hades itself.

And speaking of religious symbolism ... the holding of the bible aloft as if it were a trophy for Strongman of the Year was the most cynical thing I've seen yet from this person who's been redefining cynicism since 2015. If I were a Christian, this sight would have struck me as the defiling of the holiest of books and one of the most cherished of symbols within the faith. It was a gross assault, a molestation.

I saw this today. 

“Here’s an example of how white privilege sounds: ‘You keep saying lIts horrible that an innocent black man was killed but destroying property has to stop.’ Try saying ‘it’s horrible that property is being destroyed but killing innocent black men has to stop’.

You’re prioritizing the wrong part.

commentBody:
I do not care what Barr did or did not do
I do not care if all Conservatives believe Trump and the GOP is not responsible for anything at all.  They are just displaying Conservative Christian Family Values.
I go with the first president of my lifetime, Harry Truman.  
The buck stops at the president, regardless of what the GOP says.

Barr had no business supervising police operations.  By doing so, he has made himself a fact witness. All State Bars in this country have rules and an ethical prohibition:   A lawyer and his firm cannot represent a party when he becomes a witness to disputed factual events.  

While I hope there is no prosecutions out of this stunt, should there ever be a need to prosecute, the defense would be entitled to call Barr as a witness to establish the absence of the need to initiate force.  Thus, the Justice Department would have to recuse itself and we know how much Trump cries and soils his diapers when that happens.

No thank you for your service, "senator" Cotton, and if any otherwise well meaning young 19 year-old in our military is corrupted by your words, may you pay dearly for them.

If you were a real "soldier's soldier" you would remember that orders of no quarter have been banned as a grave breach, an atrocity, and a war crime since before 1900.  You are nothing but a criminal speaking in service to a would-be dictator.

commentBody:
To a man and woman, the cadre of this administration are, in fact and deed, traitors to the U.S. Constitution.  Their enablers in Congress and the Senate are accomplices.

Disgusting.  Nauseating.  Genuinely un-American.  Now I actually do want to throw my awards and decorations for 30 years in uniform and service over that White House fence.  This is not the country or the principles I swore to defend and serve.
Waiting for six months of fascism to pass in order to reach an election is insanity. Figure it out Washington. Act now.

I just went through headlines of some high quality Western European news media. 

- Human rights: Protests in the US -  Trump threatens unlimited military power -- Der Standard, Austria
- "Anger increasing about Trump hiding" -- De Standaard, Belgium
- "Instead of reuniting his country, Trump is upping the war rhetoric" -- NRC Handelsblad, Netherlands
- "Trump [...] doesn't want to contribute to healing this old wound of the US, but he wants to play the full authority of the state." Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, Germany
- "Is Trump allowed to do that?" -- Südddeutsche Zeitung, Germany
- "Death of George Floyd: Donald Trump, president of divisiveness", Le Monde, France
- "Trump: "I've done more for the black people than any other leader after Lincoln" -- La Repubblica, Italy
- "US police stand in solidarity with the protest: "If I kneel with you, are you leaving peacefully?"" -- El Pais, Spain
- "Trump wants to send troops – but is he allowed to?" -- NZS, Switzerland
- "Protesters tear-gassed so Trump can walk to church" --BBC, UK

No further comment needed I guess...

commentBody:
Trump has shown his true fascist tendencies and attitude. 

He has used the police in Washington DC to disperse a legal assembly using storm troopers on horses and teargas in order to have a photo op in front of a church. 

This is the action of a fascist. I don’t understand how elected Republican officials continued support this person.

So the Attorney General can give orders to the military??? This is now a thing?? And the military recognized his "authority" and carried out his illegal orders??...????.

Wow.

Maybe we got this all wrong. Maybe it's not that we should be extremely worried about "trump", but rather "trump" should be extremely worried about Barr. Wouldn't that be an amazing twist on all this: Barr runs a military coup and deposes "trump" and installs himself as dictator. Good lord what a mess.
If inflicting violence on peaceful protestors for a photo op isn't enough to get the NYT to call for Trump's resignation, what will be?

America's Attorney General sent explosives and tear gas to stampede legal Americans expressing their First Amendment Rights, so our pagan president could hold a Bible in front of a historical church?

 Mr. Barr is a Catholic zealot attempting to bring about the Apocolypse. He needs to be in monastic robes with a hoodie.

If you really want to know what Donald Trump is all about, read this 1990 article from Vanity Fair. Title: After the Gold Rush. http://www.vanityfair.com/magazine/2015/07/donald-ivana-trump-divorce-prenup-marie-brenner Search for the name "John Walter" and see what you find. Donnie is still the same, a spoiled brat who thinks he can have whatever he wants, BECAUSE ...
"Dominate them!  If you don't know how just watch the numerous tapes of Putin dominating me!  How servile, how obedient, how meek I am to his dominance!  That's the way to do it!"

commentBody: Fun Fact: In 2013, at the Trump Taj Mahal in Atlantic City, instead of finding a Bible in the bedside drawer, there was his book instead “Trump How to Get Rich. Big Deals from the Star of the Apprentice”. https://twitter.com/Jill_Jorgensen/status/1267816231211380738
Barr, listen to a black man in the news: “This is not about black America or white America. This is about justice”.
Of course Barr was behind it! After all, he's the personal lawyer  of America's biggest organized crime family. The Don gets what he wants - or you get hurt. Plain and simple.

Call me cynical, but I do not believe the decision to clear those protestors was Barr's. I think he is taking the heat for Trump. Plus, no matter WHO made the decision, they were incredibly stupid to do that to a peaceful crowd at that particular time just so Trump could hold up a Bible that he has never read and never will. The incompetence is just breathtaking.
Will trump and his administration cronies like Barr ever face justice or we just sing kumbaya when they all finish their term in office ( 1 or 2) and sail into glorious sunset?

When Trump was posing in front of the church and displaying a Bible as if it were a bucket of fried chicken, a reporter asked "Is that your Bible?" and Trump responded, "It’s a Bible" (stressing the "a').

What I can't figure out is why he didn't lie--lying being his default mode--and say the Bible was his.  I guess he thought even his "supporters" wouldn't be so stupid as to believe he owns a Bible.

Would it absolutely kill the NYT to cover the peaceful protest in Houston!  

How can people learn to live in peace and respect if you deliberately exclude positive role models and examples of how to do things right?

You are part of the problem.

The right: there are good people among white supremacists.

The left: there are good people among looters.

commentBody:
Barr, lap dog and sycophant to Trump, and I can't figure out why.

I know he is top AG, but can he order police around, too?

The more looting and wanton destruction I see, the less sympathy I have for the cause that is ostensibly the locus of this mayhem. Yes, that is what certain disruptive organizations want, but it is also how this repetitive violence and anarchy works on human psychology. Reporters and commenters (especially on strident CNN) keep making excuses for this ugly display of greed. They say “it’s organized,” as if that takes away the responsibility we all have for our own choices and actions. No. Each and every person who is doing this has made the decision to be a terrible person. A criminal. You can keep saying this isn’t related to the George Floyd protests, but that doesn’t alter the truth. The protests were an open doorway for this. All I see is racial hatred here.

commentBody: The attorney general is not above the law and clearly is not a scholar of it. Where do we file complaints against his license to practice law?

The moment is nearing where the military will have to decide whether or not to obey an illegal order from this tyrant. In large part, the fate of our country is in its hands. We already know the Republicans will not come to the rescue. Whatever the military decides, the American people will not go down without a fight.

commentBody: His standing in front of the church with a bible in hand...If our cities weren’t burning down it would simply be seen as laughable and over-theatrical. It is such a sad and strange image.  His election is a symptom of our sickness as a nation. May we recover.

Bayonets have been passed out, the "Rachel Maddow Show" has just reported.

Be careful out there, folks.
Trump has lost it and Pence doesn't care.

No 25th Amendment today, evidently.
Maybe tomorrow, 'ay, Pence?

Every single black man I know has a story that could have ended up like George Floyd, or Ahmad Arbery, or Breonna Taylor (even black women).

This must end NOW. I am sick and tired of this.

And it doesn't matter your station in life. If you have black skin, you continue to be subject to racial profiling. One of the people I know with this story is a Dean at a major STEM university. But nobody deserves this, no matter who you are.

If you were fortunate to be born in the United States with white skin, can you even imagine what it is like to live your life being constantly pre-judged by everyone -- from cops down to people who stare at you like "you don't belong here" and people who cross the street to avoid you?

This is just plain sick, and it must end NOW.
I truly have no idea what 43% of the country sees in Trump. I simply can't accept that much racism exist in our country.

commentBody: Attorney General Barr ordered an attack on citizens peacefully expressing their 1st amendment rights. He has betrayed his position and the people he serves. Impeach.

The Court protects free speech rights of abortion protesters where they merely must observe a certain distance from medical facility entrances.  We shall see if it thinks physical attacks on peaceful civil rights protesters is somehow an appropriate means of maintaining order

Bill Barr is an abomination.  Dept of Injustice
Clearing away protesters so that Mr. Trump gets a church photo-op holding the Bible?  You can't make this stuff up....
Is this is what it has come to? The president of the united states ordering the military to attack american citizens on american soil, in america's capital? A horrific and unimaginable thought.

commentBody:
This is not a drill, folks. 

Why is the world so quiet? Help us.
My own dog has more dignity that Barr.

The irony of Trump brandishing the Bible as some sort of self righteous political shield is that if had actually taken the time to read it he would come to the realization that Jesus was not only a religious figure, but in his time a social activist. He championed for the rights of the marginalized in his community. At the very core Jesus was a man who died for justice and the common good. The fact that Trump doesn’t even understand that Jesus was in fact also a protester shows you the level of his ignorance and hypocrisy.

Summer leisure and relaxation in this country while Americans suffer Tragic Triple Trump Crises' & Tyranny?

November 4th couldn't come any sooner, despite if Biden winning, the tyrant Trump still then having close to 20% of a calendar year's worth to mislead and act like a vile bigot and lower as president.

And he stood there...in front of the church posing with a upside down Bible....and did not open the book. Probably would have won the election had he read scripture from the Bible and prayed for peace and strength. Missed opportunity to unite, but he got the photo.

I’m sorry, but what did the GOP expect?  Despite the lowest crime in decades, police have turned into paramilitary units and the glorification of using a gun to defend your rights and freedom is pretty much written into their platform. Did they think this philosophy of violence and death worship would stay contained?  Cloaked in Christianity, they’ve shown themselves to be the servants of satan.

Appropriate late 60s music for our time. . . Thunderclap Newman - Something in the Air - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RTZoJ01FpD8 Tom Petty (excellent cover): - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2OUCpKzMAbQ - Lyrics: Call out the instigators Because there's something in the air We've got to get together sooner or later Because the revolution's here, and you know it's right And you know that it's right We have got to get it together We have got to get it together now Lock up the streets and houses Because there's something in the air We've got to get together sooner or later Because the revolution's here, and you know it's right And you know that it's right We have got to get it together We have got to get it together now Hand out the arms and ammo…
Why can't it be called an 'attack' on protesters? I've feel like I've seen an entire thesaurus entry written around it since last night.

The video of the massive protest for Mr. Floyd in Paris made me cry. 

The world is with equality. The world is with us who want justice for Mr. Floyd and others like him who were murdered. 

It is not just human, but for those who can’t see past that, it is a national security issue on multiple fronts. Equality is critical. 

The regressives have no chance in this fight m. Congress must act immediately.

I've been thoroughly disgusted by Trump's presidency but his ordering Barr to teargas peaceful protestors so Trump could hold up a Bible in front of a church for a photo op takes the cake.

Glad to see some Republicans breaking away from him but in truth that's because they're afraid of being tied to him for their own re-elections.

My 20 year old daughter just found out the hard way that 8 pm means 8 pm. After protesting she tried to get on a train at Grand Central Station to come home to the Bronx just before 8, but police officers were blocking the entrance to the station.

Thank goodness she and her friend could pay for an Uber. I'm worried about all the young people who can't.

How does barring entrance to train stations help to clear the streets of people? I couldn't find information anywhere about the trains being closed down at 8, even in the NYT "What you need to know about the curfew."

Perhaps clearly stating this on the alerts would have been helpful, since this is our first curfew and we didn't know how it works. Lesson learned on her part. Some tense moments on mine.

commentBody: Barr, as in a very low bar ?

American needs to rebuild its intellectual culture. We need more thoughtful people, less celebrities. We need more Jordan Petersons, etc., but they are all relegated to YouTube. One of the mysteries of modern American culture is why there are not more readers and thoughful persons in the middle class. We have built a culture and institutions that do not think but react.

Are the reporters that write these stories uninformed?  When any President wants to go somewhere the Secret Service and other members of the Administration are charged with the responsibility to clear potential threats so the President can go where he wants.  This includes moving back protesters and other potential threats.
replies: [{'commentID': 107396911, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107396911, 'userID': 42051833, 'userDisplayName': 'David S.', 'userLocation': 'Brooklyn', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': 'You may be factually correct. But in law, as in real life, context is everything. And tear gassing peaceful protesters so that the least religious human being to ever occupy the WH can get a photo op with a bible in hand is the context that you will have to work very hard to justify.', 'createDate': '1591147914', 'updateDate': '1591183022', 'approveDate': '1591148400', 'recommendations': 22, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107396132, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jonathan', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107396911', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107396996, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107396996, 'userID': 81345817, 'userDisplayName': 'Midwest', 'userLocation': 'IL', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': 'The difference is that no other president in modern times has cleared a peaceful crowd by using tear gas and rubber bullets - all for the president’s whim to have a photo op in front of the church. This man is completely morally and intellectually unfit to serve as president and shows no capacity to learn and to care for the well-being of ALL citizens. His desire to inflict the military on peaceful protestors is a threat to democracy - one which values the right to peaceful assembly. We shouldn’t be surprised though - he admires the tactics of dictators like Putin and the Saudi prince. Trump doesn’t care if US citizens, including children, are hurt; he simply wants to appear tough, though he lacks the ability to know what real courage is.\n\nAs a Christian whose ancestors (Anabaptists) were persecuted by the authorities of their day (Church was the State), I understand the importance of the separation of Church and Government. I am particularly appalled by the president using the Bible as a prop and am appalled by the complicity of some religious folks who support the president. They don’t seem to realize that this type of man is no Christian and will turn on anyone, even them. commentBody: The targeted brutality against journalists is getting wide coverage overseas, as a troubling sign that press freedom is under threat in the United States. Australia's headlines over the last 24 hours have been footage of 2 Australian journalists being senselessly beaten by military police - while trying to follow their instructions - and even our Prime Minister who usually kisses Trump's feet has lodged an official complaint with the embassy over it. It's obviously nothing compared to the treatment of George Floyd and black Americans in general for generations, but America should be aware that the rest of the world is very troubled by the fact that press freedom (a cornerstone of democracy) is no longer protected in the United States under Trump. In fact, it is being specifically targeted. The footage showed the military police very deliberately charging at the TV camera with intention to break it (after punching the camera man, and before beating the female journalist with a baton while her back was turned as she was following instruction to leave).

When will Atty Gen Barr begin to obey the law ?  The right to peaceful assembly and protest is in the Bill of Rights. President Trump constantly proves that he has NEVER absorbed the message of the Constitution so Barr should be guiding him. Using tear gas to move peaceful demonstrators violates the Constitution and Barr knows it. Will he apologize ?

Will he change his behavior and obey the law he swore to uphold?
Real people paying the price so that Trump's fake-reality show can go on.

So instead of confronting the issues of race that set this conflagration ablaze, a Republican government happily condones the use of police and the military to commit acts of violence against peaceful protesters so the President can get his photo op and deflect attention from his government's failings? 

Reporters are attacked and intimidated, the right to free speech and freedom of assembly is trampled on... the American Constitution made a mockery - and the military, whose duty it is above all to uphold the Constitution, think this is fine, Republicans think it's fine?

Have these people no shame? No principles at all? 

When will these people stand up for what I had always thought America was supposed to stand for? If no one in power is willing to make a stand for decency and principle how can the country ever recover from the depths it has sunk to?

trump and barr take notice:  if you try to mess in any way with free and fair elections taking place on 11/3/20,  with votes accurately counted, what you are seeing now is only a microcosm of the outrage and blowback that will rain down from that.   

The sleeping giant has finally awakened.

Don't even try it.
Barr is the best, bar none.
Ironically, Trump finally got his wall. It’s a chain-link fence to protect him from Americans.
Bar Barr.
Why didn't he open that Bible & read what it says?  With particular attention to "love thy neighbor as thyself" and "do unto others as you would have them do  unto you...."?

Every time you read about a story about the latest Trump outrage, donate to your favorite Democratic candidate. 

My current favorites are running for the Senate: 
- Cunningham (D-NC) 
- Gideon (D-ME) 
- Bullock (D-MT) 

It is like throwing money in the swear jar. It feels good. And it will actually help!

What moral ground this president stands when he is condemning the impoverished looters during the riot when he has probably not paid any taxes thus looting this country for years? He has driven on the public road, received police protection for him and his properties and business. He has no shame!

Breaking from "way up North":

Santa tweeted he will no longer deliver Christmas toys to United States children, in cutting off delivery there for the safety of his reindeer, until the upside down Trump holding an upside down Bible is gone for good from being president for turning the United States upside down as well.

The non White House dog owner Dictator J. Trump replied:
 
Santa, I'm a once in a lifetime religious thing in need of dominating help, ever since the Democrats "nailed me on the cross like Jesus" during my impeachment.
The photo remind me the Pope waiving to the crowds from the balcony of the St. Peter church. We are now as Secular as Vatican, Iran and Saudi Arabia.

commentBody: Under this current unbounded President and with the loyal assistance of his personal Attorney General, it is not entirely unthinkable that to advance their authoritarian interests they would revert to planning and executing a “Reichstag Fire” secret plot, followed by a sweeping decree to arrest their political adversaries. Don’t think that the intentional setting of the Capital ablaze is beyond their diabolical mindset to achieve ultimate Executive power. Both have amply shown previously that a Constitutionally-based rule of law is not an impediment to their personal ambitions and that norms, traditions, and democratic values are expendable.

Wake up America. Of course Barr was behind clearing protestors so the king could get his photo Op. He is the Grand Inquisitor for the crown, King Trump. Barr will do everything and more to propel the authoritarian rule of the absolute president and his religious brand of tribalism. And The Times never seems to know what hit them or US until its too late.
Barr called out all fed law enforcement. U.S Marshals  were called out . But they prob are ignoring any of trumps orders and are hiding

So Trump had a bible in his hand but it is neither in his head nor his heart. That he held it upside down is entirely fitting. It was in his hands an empty symbol divested of meaning. In his hands all that is holy is profaned.

commentBody: I am not a religious person but when I visit a church, and I have visited many beautiful ones, it is not to stand outside but to enter and to feel the presence of those for whom these places are sanctuaries that give moments of peace and some relief from the struggles that so often engage and confuse us.

I am so impressed with these protestors.

Victor Matheson, professor of economics at College of the Holy Cross, looked back at the Rodney King riots, which happened in L.A. in 1992.
“Economic activity in the areas affected didn’t return for at least 10 years,” Matheson said. At least not to previous levels. He said those riots cost almost $5 billion in economic activity measured in lost sales over 10 years. “If people don’t feel safe where their businesses are, then they don’t feel a need to rebuild.”

I would think these current protests could really break records.  We could get to a loss of  20 billion dollars by next week if the protestors keep it up.  
Think of how many people are going to lose their jobs and their livelihoods.  

Congratulations to all for a job well done.

commentBody:
Off topic, I guess, but regarding 'disregarding' curfews, yesterday here I really believe some of the younger of the protesters, who may have come in from suburban areas, walked so far they became disoriented and couldn't figure out where they were. Then close to curfew, they were carried along by the crowd, steered by the police, back into off limits areas out of time.

I've seen it happen here on holidays and celebratory events, also. It's easy to lose one's bearings when you don't know the city. How can we help legitimate protesters develop a strategy to circle back with enough time to beat curfew and regain their original drop-off/meeting points?
Everyone is falling into a trap. Retreat and wait out Trump and his military.  As you continue, Trump will look more justified. Don't let him win by your losing.

What is it going to take for the conversation to change from what Trump -- and Barr or whoever -- just did to removing him from office? He has failed miserably at pretty much everything a president is supposed to be able to do.

American political leaders criticize other nations for using force against their citizen protesters. But when the protests are here, the police are sent out. And this President calls for bashing heads. Just another Putin, Assad, Kim Jung, etc. Trump wants his share of blood.

As now on George Conway's (Kellyanne's husband) feed: What's with the new cadre of soldiers now on the street in DC? No badges, no nametags, hodgepodge gear and uniforms, refuse to say what division of the military they're with. 

Various journalists and former government staffers believe DHS, CBP, etc., while others think the ad hoc show means subcontractors with Erik Prince (i.e., Blackwater in Iraq, brother of Education Secretary Betsy DeVos). Is this even legal? Or is "legal" these days whatever Barr says is legal?

Also as Senator Cotton had threatened, the 82nd Airborne are now within immediate range of downtown DC. Tonight won't be pretty.

commentBody:
What's up with the bible grabbing President? A man who never read it in the first place?

It's all about buttering up to the bible-thumping Evangelicals of his base.

To top it all, one day after his disgusting march to the church, trying to prove that he was a tough man after it became public that he was hiding in the White House bunker, he tried to show his fake piousness when visiting  the Pope Paul II shrine, who must be spinning in his grave.

In addition, we all remember the right-wing uproar about a real First "Lady", Michelle Obama's sleeveless arms.

The current so-called First Lady should at least know that females  cover their arms when visiting a Catholic Churches or shrines.

I learned that at the tender age of 10 from my parents when visiting the Milan Dome when it was brutally hot outside.

No, none of this is a surprise.

Barr is the end-product of John Mitchell, back in the Nixon Days.

Now keep your eye on Mark Meadows.
If the "Attorney General" gave the "order," arrest him! If he simply suggested the idea to his boss -- strip him of his office and shut him up!

Who cares if Barr ordered it.  Trump's a chicken with a big mouth, and Billy Barr is more than happy to do the dirty work.  I'm personally having difficulty deciding which is worse: Trump, Barr, or McConnell.

commentBody: What a small shallow man Trump is.
Why am I not surprised...

Dear Mr. Barr,
There must be some misunderstanding. I have read that the chief law enforcement officer in our country ordered an attack by amongst others, armed members of our military, on our citizens who were expressing their Constitutional rights. With the rest of the country, I look forward to your clarification. 
In addition, do you have the authority to order the military into action? And if so, on American soil? 
Once you take the time to answer the above questions, we will discuss the use of military helicopters. 
Sincerely,
Chris
Barr’s involvement in this debacle speaks volumes about the way in which Barr’s anti-Justice department will involve themselves into the George Floyd case.

commentBody: “The most basic function of government is to provide security for people to live their lives and exercise their rights, and we will meet that responsibility here in the nation’s capital,” Mr. Barr said."  So exactly how was Barr preserving the rights of protesters to Free Speech (1st amendment) and all other US residents?  Did Billy forget he is the head of the Justice Department making him the US AG--not Trump's personal lawyer....Barr should be barred from the practice of law.

Who would have thought that Trump is finally as "popular" as he wanted? He failed to fill the area during his inauguration but he has finally managed to fill the area around White House with protesters. Well done, Mr. President.

commentBody:
The most recent update to the clearing of Lafayette Park for Trump's photo op noted: 
"Mr. Barr is managing the federal law enforcement response to the ongoing protests against police brutality.  ... “The most basic function of government is to provide security for people to live their lives and exercise their rights, and we will meet that responsibility here in the nation’s capital,” Mr. Barr said."

Oddly, I found no comments submited about these two extraordinary statements.
1.)  The AG is managing the response, but has in fact added to the naked brutality by gassing and removing peaceful and lawful protesters.   Did he ask them to leave?
2.) The AG of the USA acknowledges government's function to provide security for people to exercise their rights, but clearly had a memory lapse about the Constitutional right to assembly.  Does his Constitution confer super-rights for POTUS to walk all over everyone else's rights?

This is seriously wrong.   Democracy in the US has never been in such peril.

Yes, of course Black Lives Matter.   So does our Democracy, which has been eroding exponentially since the 2016 election.   Do something for positive change for both!
It appears that Trump only allows right wing protesters.

Barr worries me. He is the real power behind Trump, the puppet, along with Miller and Kushner. They are the trio who will stir the pot when Trump is ousted in November. I can't see Trump going quietly.

This is the Chief Law Enforcement of the United States (except, of course, his puppeteer President Trump).

If he gave this order, he is a danger to us all.
Enough! Disbar Barr. Taking professional action against him is long overdue.

Oh, it all makes sense now. It was Barr's decision to move the protesters, and Barr's decision was made long before Trump even thought of making his speech and walking across the street to St. John's.  The tear gas and flash bombs and horses didn't have anything to do with Trump--he probably didn't even know about these things. It was all Barr..it was all planned long before. It wasn't a weak, futile attempt at a show of force by a weak and catastrophically inept and inhumane president.

Yeah, right.

Fortunately all the gun rights types and NRA members stand firmly behind the Constitution and the rights of ordinary citizens. Clearly they recognize that among other things this assault on peaceful protesters represents an assault on their beloved Constitution.........anybody?........anybody?.......No?

commentBody: The majority of voters didn’t vote for Trump & Co. Period. We The People deserve to be in charge of our own destiny, free of institutionalized racism, free of the ravings of a madman, free of being terrorized by our own government. Get these gasbags our. Tonight if at all possible. They have betrayed their oaths of office and it is time to revolt.

Having peaceful protesters tear gassed to clear the way for a narcissistic, insincere, holding-the-Bible photo op honestly is the most bizarre thing I can recall a U.S. President doing in my memory, which goes back to Eisenhower.  Unfortunately, I wouldn't bet a dime Trump won't find some way to go himself one better.
Troops from the famous 82nd Airborne are being deployed against American citizens; everyone knew his presidency would end badly, but not like that.

We’ve watched this pattern unfold, again and again, over the past 3 1/2 years.
We find ourselves asking one another:
“Can Trump really be this stupid? He’s coming down on the side of racism and police brutality...”
This news article may well mark the 100th successful “negative-distraction” engineered by Trump and his dysfunctional administration.

Consider these questions. What have you read and heard lately about Trump’s mishandling of the covid-19 pandemic? How many video clip montages of Trump’s successive lies related to coronavirus have you watched this week?
Trump played no part in the horrendous murder of George Floyd. But, as he nearly always does, Trump has placed himself near the center of the media coverage of the news story of the day, in this case “Black lives matter.”

This is “TRUMP’S TRICK.”
When he’s botched some situation to an excruciating degree, Trump exerts presidential influence on something else. No matter how outraged his political opponents are made by this, Trump believes he’s winning.
He’s done this again and again.
“At least they’ve stopped talking about ‘separating families and putting kids in cages.”
“They’ve stopped calling me Putin’s lapdog.”
“No one cares about the murder of General Suleimani anymore.”

At some point between now and election day, the American people need to break Trump’s destructive egomaniacal pattern. This must stop.
What all these cities have in common is that they are led by Democrats who seem to have bought into the belief that the police are a bigger problem than rampant disorder.

commentBody: There is a certain perverse symmetry in our nation's highest law enforcement officer, Bill Barr, ordering our military to gas and displace American citizens peacefully protesting systemic law enforcement racism so that Donald Trump could cross the street and be photographed with his all-white crew waving a Bible in front of a church like a carnival barker.

The desire to blame Trump for every grievance has become tiring. I’ve seen too many videos of idiotic voters and college students calling policies racist when they are told they are said or done by “Trump”.

 Each person is either embarrassed or worse, not embarrassed, when they are told it was Biden or Obama who said or implemented said policy.  

I’ve never voted for a republican but the bias and insanity of the left is weighing on me, deeply. I know many close friends have confided the same.

commentBody:
The trump and General Barr are pursuing an undeclared war against the American people.

This popularly-unelected president must first go to Congress to seek authorization to declare war on the American people. No doubt the Republican Senate under Mitch's thumb will give trump the authorization he craves to wage military war on citizens à la Hussein, Assad, Xi, Duterte, Kim, el-Sisi, Bibi, Erdogan and Putin - all his besties. The House will vote against waging war on it's constituency in a strictly partisan vote. This would be the clearest signal and proof as to who the real enemies of the American people are and make voting a simple choice between America and suicide by Barr's storm troopers.

By the way, after Putin egged-on trump to militarily assault and gas American citizens on US soil during their phone call before trump's call to the governors, didn't trump, Barr and the rest of their ilk violate curfew last night when they left the people's white home and onto the street to take selfies of themselves in front of a church none of them attend? Shouldn't they have been gassed and shot at too? Oh right, under trump-Barr different laws and rules for the Alt-Right elites and the rest of us mere citizens.

The majority of voters didn’t vote for Trump & Co. Period. We The People deserve to be in charge of our own destiny, free of institutionalized racism, free of the ravings of a madman, free of being terrorized by our own government.
trump just made things worse.  Calls should be coming in from every newspaper in the US and World calling for his resignation.  Incompetent and Unfit.
Bernie Sanders may get his revolution after all.

commentBody: This may be a return to the civil rights and anti war marches and protests of the 60s. Wealth and power don't change, so of course we tend to repeat history.
Looks to me like there are more protesters in Washington than there were spectators at the inauguration.  Trump finally got his crowd.  Perfect.

I read the article here in the NYT about Barr a few days ago. About his belief that secularism is a threat to society. Barr wants a proper order where some rules and the others obey blindly. Stability. I am sure that is fine and comfortable - if you happen to be one among the rulers. But what happened to "Land of the Free, Home of the Brave"?

Secularism might be a threat to stability, but stability based on faith is a threat to evolution. Science should not have to compete with faith, facts should not have to compete with opinions, and freedom should not be a privilege for the 1%.

Barr is a very intelligent man, I have understood that, but the bible is not the constitution and God, if there is a God, is not American.

After having been described as hiding out in his bunker, Trump believes that he had to be seen as tough, macho, dominant.  It’s not working, but at least he finally found a way to get more people to the mall to see him than Obama had at his inauguration.

"Protests Show No Signs of Fading"
the headline brings me to tears,
In gratitude that people do care, 
in sorrow for the lives lost. 
things can change.

I know a way for the riots to end.  Minneapolis needs to do the right thing and arrest all four of those bad cops.  I can’t believe they did not think of this yet.  Then all the cities that burned need to send their Republican officials the bill since they support beating their citizens like Trump does.

I'm a centrist.  I believe the decision to use force to remove peaceful protestors so he could get a photo holding a Bible in front of the church is one of the biggest political mistakes of his presidency.  That more than offset Biden's "you ain't black" comment.  Right now, Biden is in good shape.  But, I won't call the election, because I never imagined Trump would win in 2016.

I want everyone to know how embarrassed I am to be American. We are spending trillions of dollars to handle a virus that Sweden has in hand; millennials post black profiles and think they are doing something useful; no one can handle themselves as an adult on a sidewalk. There may have once been something like an American character, but today this is the exception and not the norm.

Look at all the new riot gear around the US being used to 'dominate' citizens - then look at all the surgeons and nurses wearing garbage bags to protect them while they try to save citizens' lives. There are your priorities - right there! Being shot for demonstrating is a huge penalty imposed by police on its own citizens. Why are the police shooting their own citizens? What is the supposed justification for it. They are neither serving nor protecting. You guys have lost the plot big time.,
Hong Kong tactics in an ever oppressive regime. No, not China.

Trump is a “populist?”  (From this paper) “what that means is that he and he alone truly represents the people. And anybody who disagrees with them, anybody who criticizes him, by virtue of that fact is an enemy of the people.”
No. Trump is a Facist, and the preceding quote neatly provides the definition.

I read the vitriol and hatred of this country espoused by a goodly number of these comments,  and in some cases the open endorsement of the overthrow of the American gov’t, and  feel a heartbroken sadness for the future of this country.  I know no one, heard no one, read nowhere of anyone who  defends the cop who did it , no one who doesn’t want to listen to the just grievances of black people,   and all people living in poverty  , but if this country is going to be portrayed  in the media and in the protests as so inherently corrupt and racist and oppressive (a perception not at all borne out by actual facts), then how will even an election fix it?   And the biggest heartache is how the media I have trusted my entire life is handling this.

commentBody:
Bring in the National Guard.

Do a repeat of Kent State 1970.

The riots will end.

It's violent, it's ugly, but this kind of violence is only squelched with more violence.

commentBody: We have seen peaceful protesters and those who are using the deplorable murder of a U S citizen as an excuse to steal from and hurt others.  In the White House, we have a horrible president who is doing everything he can to inflame rather than defuse, and his only motivation is his personal self-interest.  Trump is at best no better than the rioters and looters, and he is the president.  Disgraceful.

I was so disgusted when he was inaugurated, can you imagine how I feel now?

Wanna know why? Here are just few select quotes:

“I'm going to be so presidential that you people will be so bored.”

“I can be more Presidential, if I want to be, I can be more Presidential than anybody.”

"Oh are you happy you voted for me? You are so lucky that I gave you that privilege." 

“throughout my life, my two greatest assets have been mental stability and being, like, really smart”

Sigh.....the late, once great, United States of America. Thanks, it was awesome.
Barr has no business being AG, a disgrace to his profession.  History will judge him harshly.

The extent to which Trump and his enablers have debased this country in three short years is almost unimaginable.

He is a sick, deranged man and is manifestly unfit to lead this country.

As the Irish would say, his behavior  is "beyond the beyonds".

We live in a world of images.  The images of peaceful demonstrators being tear gassed and rubber bulleted to clear the way for Trump, followed by his fascistic pose with a Bible in front of a church, will be the images that define his presidency forever.  They will be shown over and over and over, and all the rest of his presidency will blend into them.

If you protest, march, loot, and burn cars and buildings what are the odds of you contracting and dying of Covid-19.

Do we have a model for this yet?

commentBody:
The very last option that should be considered for crowd control us the use of military personnel.  Unless the training regimen has changed (very possible since I was an Infantry soldier 1962-1965) the only crowd control training I received was fix bayonets, form up ranks of two and step-jab into the crowd.  Does anyone in the current administration not remember Kent State?

Even police action across the country has varied greatly in effectiveness and police officers certainly receive much more training in non-lethal tactics.  Soldiers are trained to inflict damage on an enemy and protect themselves from harm, good on the battlefield, not so much in action against citizens of their own country.

We should be concerned with preserving life, protecting property should always be secondary.

The overwhelming majority of the protesters are interested in peaceful demonstration. I have been in a few marches and have witnessed the passion and sorry in these people. I have seen people from all walks of life, of all ages and skin color. 
 
Not only are the looters not representative of the protests, I am increasingly convinced that many of the looters are part of various subversive elements in our society (including right wing extremists), all either taking advantage or sowing chaos to shift the narrative. Looking at many of the comments, it seems that they are succeeding.

This country is tearing itself apart in the middle of an epidemic that has already killed over 108,000 people and Trump's answer is to have soldiers rolling down the streets of American cities in armored personnel carriers? We are far past politics as usual. I'm not even sure the country can even hold itself together until November.

commentBody:
I spent more than two decades as a union member in the CWA. I think unions are essential for workers in private enterprise. 

I say that in advance because this is the follow-up: I do not think government workers – workers paid with tax dollars – should be unionized. There should be a social contract with those workers that provides good wages & benefits. In return, they must meet a standard of quality, efficiency & morality as public servants. 

Bad cops have poisoned the water within law enforcement. Police unions have prevented the cleansing of that water.

This is what should happen: the Minneapolis police force should be shut down, liquidated. And a new enforcement agency – one with no union representation – should be started. Officers can reapply for a job and have their records evaluated. Regular mental health evaluation should be applied. New training should be implemented. Recruit not with fake- tough-guy appeal, but go after those who are engaged in the community. 

Eighty percent of officers should not carry weapons. If weaponized officers are on the scene, you then know something serious is going on.

This should be the test case for new policing in America. It is a failed department, a failed system. Liquidate it and start over, Minneapolis.

It has been clear from the start that the occupant of the White House will do ANYTHING to stay in office. Will reasonable, responsible Americans do whatever is necessary to make sure that doesn't happen?

Protestors have a right to peaceful assembly, but not the right to endanger fellow NYers. Are these young people committing arson,  vandalism, looting and attacks all the while collecting unemployment and coronavirus payments?
I witnessed a kid bash a police van with his skateboard while there were riders onboard. Others joined by throwing debris. This also endangered the oncoming traffic.
Stop giving them the power to ruin our community! They should be prosecuted.

The Government needs to do their job the officer got the sentence of third degree murder it needs to be first degree murder and LIFE in prison with no parole. Then hopefully these random acts of violence and riots will stop. I understand seeking justice but there is a right way and a wrong way to seek justice and be heard. Using a man's wrongful death at the hand of an officer abusing his power to commit acts of violence is NOT the way to do this. All lives matter we are all created equal in the eyes of God. Please give this man's family justice and indite the officer the way you would indite any other murderer.

everyone agrees (consensus) that racism is wrong, but human psychology is fallible, and prone to the easiest solutions. you think that a majority of people can be police officers, but you would be wrong. only a small fraction of people can handle that power without going all stanford prison experiment on you. the whole movement this week ignores the fact that we overestimate human character, it is the ideal, not the norm.

American exceptionalism: Free speech, except for black or brown people. The right to bear arms, except for black or brown people. Redress for grievances, except for black or brown people. The right to vote, except for black or brown people. Protection from unreasonable search and seizure, except for black or brown people.Excessive bail shall not be required, except for black or brown people. Add to these rights access to education and healthcare, except for black or brown people. Until the exceptions are removed we are not real Americans.

Attorney General William Barr is unfit for office and needs to resign.  He desecrated his oath of office  when he ordered federal officers to violently remove peaceful protesters from Lafayette Park, a PUBLIC park near the White House, so President Trump could get a photo op of himself holding--and also desecrating-- a Bible in front of an Episcopal church.   The protesters were there to voice their outrage against police brutality on black men, the most recent being the murder of George Floyd.  Ironically, as they marched peacefully--Barr called for violence to be used against them. The 1st Amendment of The Constitution guarantees "the right of the people...to petition the Government for a redress of grievances".   When Attorney General Barr took his oath of office, he vowed to "support, protect, and defend the Constitution of the United States from all enemies, foreign and domestic."   Sadly, the 2nd greatest threat to our Constitution is a domestic enemy and he is also our country's chief law enforcement officer.    Congress needs to hold Barr accountable for his actions.  And we all need to hold President Trump accountable this November at the ballot box.  Nov. 3rd can't come soon enough.

For those who think AG Barr or the president had the right to remove the protesters because there was a curfew, first there was no curfew in the afternoon; second, if there was a curfew, the president himself violated the curfew by walking to the church and should be arrested like everyone else.

I don't know what else to say. The blatent excessive use of force by authorities is a national disgrace. I'm sickened and appalled by what armed thugs (police) do in our name. It has to stop. Although I don't support violent protest, I admire the brave citizens who are risking their lives to stand up to the powerful and refuse to be cowed. Who do the police think they are? Why do they think they have the right to beat people for simply disobeying? Its so, so sad.
If the authorities don't manage this crisis with a balanced way, America will burn in a total civil unrest.
I don’t want to be great anymore.

They are boarding up stores and businesses in my upper Eastside neighborhood. It all my years of living in the city I have never seen anything like this happen. It is a terrible pity when you have to worry about your business being looted and burned. I have no sympathy for the looters and they need to be arrested and brought to justice.  Lock them up.

commentBody: I wish trump was as concerned about our first amendment rights as he is about our second.

Time to keep up the protest. There is no other way the horror show of racism will be ended.  Double down on demonstrating against Trump in front of the White House.  Photo op indeed!    Under the definition of toady they could use Barr's picture

Barr and Trump are for anti life.  Ready to attack peaceful protesters  just so our profoundly immoral Trump can have photo opt to look strong.  He never wore a Regular Army uniform but is sending everyone’s Democratic sons and daughters into the streets . Typical will start wars but won’t join in the battle.  I saw in one of the fake Fox News headlines Trump is saying the  rioters are  anarchists .  He and the GOP are the anarchists and corrupt to order peaceful protesters to be attacked.

I don’t believe that Barr ordered the gassing of innocent protestors. Trump asked him to take the heat for the bad press.  The only thing you can count on when Barr says anything is that it is a lie.  The man is morally corrupt and trump is worse.

commentBody:
"A Denver police officer was fired after he shared a photo of himself and two other officers in riot gear on Instagram on Monday with the caption “Let’s start a riot.”

Precisely. This cop was fired for being dumb and letting the dirty secret out.  These are police riots. The cops violently and intentionally provoked any rioting. The cops who have unleashed thousands of attacks on protesters, projectiles, gas, beatings. The cops want more blood in the street and are awaiting the green light by the ruling rich to unleash more bullets. Despite and because of this we must continue to protest in non-violent, disciplined ways. However, I will never join the chorus of hypocritical condemnation of so-called petty looters, when the gang of Wall Street Looters steals trillions and sics their brutal cops on us. Justice for George Floyd! Jail All 4 Killer Cops!
The sign says "Abolish Police, Abolish Prisons." Yeah so they can eat us alive! I wonder how gun sales are doing these days...
