commentBody: Still waiting for religious leaders to protest his photo-op.
Barr is an attorney. What does he know about managing civil unrest?  Right...nothing.
The Times repeatedly identifies the couple mistreated by six Atlanta cops as "college students," as if that made their mistreatment more outrageous than it would otherwise be.

Barr is just a stooge for Trump. 

I don't know what is worse, Trump, or his sycophantic enablers. I do know this: Barr is the worst AG we have ever had, and that is saying something considering Ed Meese and his besmirched record.

Barr is endangering the people of the United States. I have no confidence that he has the slightest interest in protecting us, or upholding the rule of law. It is all kowtowing to Trump 24/7. Meese is our own Torquemada. Gorsuch and Kavanaugh our own crooked judges (e.g. Thomas J. Maloney), and McConnell our own Machiavelli. What a stunning rogues gallery at the top of our national administration. 

It's a close race, but for my money Barr is the absolute worst of all, because he knows better, and he is suborning outright crime.

I urge, beseech, beg, implore all the sane media to keep the likes of Barr, Graham, McConnell, Kennedy, etc. ad nauseum in the spotlight.

Though Trump reaches new depths of idiocy it is, and always has been, his criminal abettors allowing this to be perpetuated.

The deal you and I made Mr and Mrs America: is you work, I own. I stay back, you're essential. I take 95%, all the rest you take what's left. Your healthcare is unaffordable, I sell it. The police always escalate up to your death unless you get on your knees if I glance at you, and then it's a question. Corporations over people (to assure you're able to work until you drop). Dirty air and dangerous jobs (to assure you're able to work until you drop). 

The deal we made you now violate with rioting? I am outraged. Unless I "dominate" you, I "look like a jerk".

West Point should be disgusted and ashamed that one of theirs, Mark Esper, was a part of this shenanigan and allowed the military to use these methods on law abiding citizens. The entire “West Point Mafia” as they call themselves, is a disgrace to the institution of which true leaders like Buzz Aldrin, Eisenhower, Haig, Grant, McAuthur, Patton and others, were educated. 

They have assisted Trump while he has torn the country apart, lied to the public repeatedly, extorted allies, and drove the NATO alliance to the brink. Pompeo, Esper and the rest have actively supported obstructing Congressional subpoenas from the State Department which covers up for the president’s malfeasance, defied Congressional orders for weapon sales to Saudi Arabia and abused and misused the office of the Secretary of State and the Department of Defense.   SHAME!

commentBody: Barr is a time traveler from the 16th century.  He misses absolute monarchs and infallible Popes.

American Carnage
Promises Made, Promises Kept

For two dozen years now, newspapers like the NYT and WaPo, and media like CNN and MSNBC, have been sowing the wind with columnists, commentators, and positional news reporting that holds up American society as inherently corrupt -- a uniquely racist social experiment that has failed on every level. Now, in the dark of night from coast to coast, to the tinkle of broken glass and the joyful shouts of thousands of frenzied looters, we are reaping the whirlwind.

If Benedict Barr is not on trial next year at this time, Democracy is done in America.
Trump and Barr are trying to asphyxiate the country.  "I can't breathe!"

The "real" Donald J. Trump is the pathetic charlatan posing in front of St. John's.
He is not an American hero. Far from it.
George W. Bush's statement today named four American heroes -

commentBody:
One of the more discouraging realizations for me is that even as transparently phony and clownish a display as Trump waving a Bible around like a prop from the set of "The Apprentice" -- even that won't open the eyes of his cult followers to what an obscenity the man truly is. 

Is it sheer stupidity or some form of mass-hypnosis that explains their blindness to something so grotesquely obvious? If that doesn't wake them up, what possibly could?

Obeying the curfew rules may not protect you. Just before the walk to the church Trump suddenly. It reminds commanded. The curfew had not commenced. This is what happened to some Australian journos just legally doing their jobs. It looks like a Trump rally suddenly focussing on the media but on steroids. It is an insult to every Australian soldier who died assisting America in Vietnam, Korea and Afghanistan, fighting for democracy https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5GNB_7cQxY

commentBody:
On June 1, 2020, United States citizens witnessed the President of the United States blatantly violate their fellow citizens’ First Amendment rights. Solely for a photo opportunity, the President ordered military police and secret service to remove citizens from a public area who were peacefully assembling in protest and violating no law. The police used tear gas and brute force to injure these citizens. President Trump violated his oath of office to uphold and defend the Constitution of the United States. EVERY American citizen should be outraged by this conduct and should demand the President’s resignation.

Attorney General William Barr participated in this breach of trust.  Instead of following the President meekly and slack-jawed, he should have stood in the President’s face, advised him of his unlawful conduct and resigned if the President persisted. His failure to do so renders him unqualified to hold his office.

Defense Secretary Mark Esper let down the United States military by allowing its members to injure American citizens, to be placed in harm’s way, and to be used in clear violation of the Constitution they swore to defend. He should acknowledge his failure and resign.

The world is watching whether Americans truly believe in their Constitution. Demanding these resignations provides a clear answer that we do.

commentBody: Some are asking how there could have been tear gas if trump was to walk through.  Well,  as you can clearly see, the police and the mounted police forced the crowd back with sheer body presence and a sort of cherry bomb called a “flash bang”. They were forced out of Lafayette Square and a large two blocks, past St. John.  You can google this on Google Earth.  The crowd was quite thin and remarkable white and quiet, they were going to move.  Then some kind of gas emerges, but it is less harmful than the strong stuff.  The answer to you doubters is a big force was unleashed upon a small crowd, but what kind of gas, though visibly irritating on contact with protestors, no one actually knows.

I was perplexed when Barr came out to survey the protestors yesterday, it just seemed odd. Knowing now he was there to work out the logistics to clear them out for the photo-op for Trump, I am beyond infuriated. Using force, tear gas and rubber bullets on non-violent protestors is inexcusable. 

It proves to me that Barr is nothing more than a cheap henchman for his boss.

commentBody:
Are we Americans so unthinking we can’t distinguish among:

1.  The need to reform police-prosecutor cultures that promote and protect bad cops and have long histories of excessive force against African Americans;

2.  The fundamental right of citizens to protest injustices peacefully;and 

3.  The need to arrest and prosecute opportunistic vandals and looters for property crimes - generally not the same people as the protesters?

Trump, Barr, Fox and their GOP enablers are doing their best to to blur these distinctions.  

Their language links property damage to looters to protesters (however peaceful) to liberals/Democrats.  Throw in a Bible for good measure.  Then declare yourself the “law and order” President and threaten a military crackdown.

They are intentionally diverting attention from long histories of police crimes targeting African Americans, including the murder of George Floyd.  No federal intervention is proposed for these crimes.  

The entire GOP campaign, like Nixon’s in 1968, is deeply cynical and racist.  It is transparently directed to the “base” and suburban white Americans. 

The next step in this campaign is harnessing social media to depress the youth and African American vote for Democrats. Putin’s cyberwar team did the equivalent in 2016.

We who want a more sane and just America have our work cut out for us.

commentBody: Trump is guilty of desecrating a sacred object, which under the law is a misdemeanor that carries a maximum of two years in jail.  If Attorney General Barr was his accomplice in this crime, it's time to lock 'em both up.

Oh well, so much for the rule of law.  These curfews seem to have about as much gravitas as the truth.  The truth being that “Rich People’s Lives Matter.”  and therein lies the problem, with racism as the red herring to avoid meaningful change.

Statement from the chief of the Park Police that no tear gas was used while clearing protesters from the Lafayette Park last night.  I remember some very large headlines asserting that tear gas was used.

Will any of the media who ran with those early, false reports issue any sort of correction?

commentBody:
Does anybody believe Bob Barr actually ordered this? 

He's the consummate Republican insider.  He's knows all the do's and dont's.  Does anybody believe he made this sort of colossal error in judgement?

Does anyone else remember the confirmation hearing when Bill Barr’s lawyer filled family was proudly introduced and he had the happy exchanges with his grandson?  I was somewhat reassured because I thought anyone with that much invested in the future of this country could not be a total Trump lackey.  I was very wrong.

Barr is not aware of the First Amendment (his boss isn't) and the Right of the People to peacefully assemble, as was the case in front of the WH?  Or was this just another example of his willfully breaking the law on behalf of the President.

I do wonder if those people who claim their relatives who supported Trump in 2016 were "not racist" and "basically good people" still stand by the statement? And do your relatives still stand by Trump?

To be clear - we all need to stronlgly and loudly oppose looting, violence, and baiting or inciting the law enforcement.  
Peace and love... peace and love.
Attempts to pelt trump and/or barr and/or mitchy with bricks and bottles serves a higher purpose and should be considered protected speech.  Fire at will (I mean at mitch).

Barr is willing to take the fall for Trump because he knows the Dems won't impeach him.

Most Americans don't need the Dems to point out the corruption in the Trump administration.  They need the Dems to hold them accountable or at least try!!

Dems are making a huge mistake betting on the election.  Words are cheap - people want demonstrative action!

commentBody:
The Attorney General of the United States violated the constitution so the president could take pics with a bible. 
There's so many things wrong with this it's hard to know where to start.

Does Donald Trump appear particularly Christian in his outlook to you?  I can't think of a single Christian precept he embodies, although many he absolutely opposes leap to the forefront of the mind, like his inability to turn the other cheek, love his fellow man, or care for the sick and suffering.  Donald Trump posing with a bible is outre and bizarre.  That he did so in the middle of a protest is an insult.  And who would ever have believed that William Barr would attack rioters just to clear a little space so his boss could take selfies?  

I'm outraged out.  I can't take anymore.  And there's still 179 more days before the election.

Let me get this straight:
MORE guns make a society safer?
(I must have missed that lesson from Logic 101!)
I don't understand why they are not marching to the nearest office to register to vote and demand to be registered.

commentBody:
I put Trump and his administration in the same line where other dictators stand. 

We are approaching the anniversary of the protests in Tiananmen square, Beijing 1989. A clique of party officials used the military against their own people.

In 2020, our own military was acting against peaceful protesters in our nations capital - Washington D.C.! A clique of party officials used the military against their own people.

Please, Mr. Trump resign and step down, and allow the nation to heal. It would be your best contribution to this nation.

An interims government should lead our nation to the upcoming election in November 2020.
Party before country, right?  Isn't that how we all got the president that the Repubs deserved?

The Back-to-Africa movement, in the 19th century called took the view that African-Americans of African ancestry should return to Africa—not to the homelands of their ancestors, which in most cases were unknown, but to the continent.

commentBody: Trump is so predictable. Someone in his midst is always required to take the rap for his bone-headed decisions. He doesn't do anything that other people want because he thinks he comes up with the best ideas.

I would have been more impressed if Trump waded into the protestors to hear their concerns, their fears. and their anger and need for change. But no instead he brings his clown show and clown entourage backed up by military support to a church, an institution he has no familiarity with to hold a book he has never read upside down. Such power, such leadership.

Our so-called president campaigned on a slogan of "make America great again". His (heaven help us) re-election slogan is "keep America great". 100,000+ dead and rising, 25% unemployment, civil unrest etc etc etc. Our country can not withstand much more of this greatness.
Bob Barr stating this was not planned is an outright lie. Any operation involving military helicopters over civilians takes advance planning. This is the worse cover story ever.
Golly! If AG Barr had started to expand the perimeter before the 7:00 curfew, this fact would have been mentioned in this article. I wonder who slipped up?

The refusal of the GOP Senators to even answer the press questions should say all there is to know about whether they, the GOP Senators, support the US Military and militarized police force to attack peaceful protesters and to violate our 1st Amendment Rights. This is shameful. Of course they have demonstrated that they have no shame by standing with the con artist and compromised DOJ to use flash bangs, rubber bullets, tear gas, and low flying helicopters to disperse a peaceful protest. Vote Blue and remove them all from office; they more than deserve it.

Is Donald Trump a heretic?

Was Donald Trump blasphemous yesterday?

Is Donald Trump as far away from Jesus as anyone or anything can get?

I believe Trump is trying to become our dictator.  Is Trump trying to go beyond being just a mere dictator?

Will Trump leave office voluntarily if defeated in November's election?

Will America be able to force him out if he refuses to leave after being defeated?

I think that many Americans are afraid of the answers to these questions.

I think that many Americans are too absorbed in their own troubles to think about what might happen after November's election.

We haven't seen the worse yet.

But we will see things get much worse soon.

Much worse.

commentBody: Friday night/Saturday early morning will be the full moon. Also on June 6th will be the anniversary of the military D-Day invasion of Europe during WWII. Please go home and calm down. The Republicans have been waiting for something like this as an excuse for outright military rule for a long time. Go home. I anticipate trouble if you don't. Fight with wits, not weapons.
I live on the Upper East Side of Manhattan at 88th Street and First Avenue. News media helicopters are flying over the area.  All of the protesters in this area are marching peacefully.  Just sayin'.

We are long overdue for a change. This violence has to stop it's an egregious misuse of power. I'm speaking of both this administration and of law enforcement generally. 
Take from THE TORTURE LETTERS by Laurence Ralph at the University of Chicago: 

Between 1972 and 1991, at least 125 black suspects were tortured by Chicago police officers working under former Police Commander Jon Burge. As the more recent revelations from the Homan Square "black site" show, that brutal period is far from a historical anomaly. For more than fifty years, police officers who took an oath to protect and serve have instead beaten, electrocuted, suffocated, and raped hundreds--perhaps thousands--of Chicago residents.
Wow. The Attorney General authorizing tear gas against peaceful protesters. Just when you think "surely William Barr can't sink any lower"...he does.
Me thinks this is the rehearsal for November when Trump loses and refuses to comply with the orderly transition of power in January.
Wow.  I never thought I would see the day American troops, on US soil, would be ordered to use force against their fellow americans, for a Photo-op.

So much for Summer season near its official arrival.

First Coronavirus to avoid through obeying and respecting word of the scientists and the medical world's experts.

Next, the 2020's Greatest Depression in U.S. history.

Now a Trump warned and ordered in revenge for his impeachment, a U.S. Civil War to totally destroy America.

And all simultaneously in his final year in office as Dictator.
If not his final year, it will be America's final one.
Since William Barr is such a good Catholic, when he ordered the teargassing of peaceful protesters, I am confident that he was answering that fundamental question: what would Jesus do?

The Trump campaign is trying desperately to address this issue in a logical, sober and common-sense  manner.  After all, what other choice do they have?  But sadly, the crisis that we're now faced with does not easily lend itself to "reason" or "common sense"...because the issue is being driven politically & emotionally throughout the mainstream media.  

Let’s face it – the media LOVE what's happening now...with all the out-of-control riots, mayhem and destruction in major cities throughout the nation. 

But for some mysterious reason (cough, cough), they make little or no distinction whatsoever between Constitutionally lawful protesting vs. violent, criminal behavior, i.e., smashing into commercial storefronts, looting, burning buildings, setting fires onto public & private property...including houses of worship.  And while all of this is happening, our sanctimonious friends at CNN, NY Times, Washington Post, WSJ, etc., are literally laughing their heads off.    

Constitutionally voicing your opinion through peaceful protest is one thing....it’s another thing entirely to cause mayhem and destruction at the expense of law-abiding citizens and public/private property.  Sadly, these rioters (not “protestors”)…mostly juveniles from outside the targeted areas…are opportunistically using George Floyd’s death as an easy excuse…a false pretense…for mayhem and destruction. This has nothing whatsoever to do with “justice”, but everything to do with emotion and mob hysteria.

commentBody:
This church outing was just Trump's way of showing he's not been reduced to cowering in the White House. Which, of course, he had been.

Deploy heavy handed brutality -  Trump's 'overwhelming force', really - against unarmed, peaceful demonstrators followed by a quick step up to the church, wave an upside-down Bible in trembling hand, trot back home surrounded by a mass of police, security personnel and the military and there you are... as brave as a lion is your President! 

Trump has clearly been terrified about a popular invasion of the White House. That's why he spouted that 'my dad's bigger than your dad' nonsense about vicious dogs and ominous weapons. Not only is he scared, the leak of that story about hiding in the WH panic bunker has badly bruised his fragile ego.
It may be worth noting that the Arab Spring uprising, which began in Tunisia, was triggered by the police homicide of one man, a fruit vendor.

Is this why Trump wanted to bring the troops home? So that he could unleash them on Americans? Those protesters at the Washington church did nothing to deserve being tear gassed. Shame on you, Mr. President.
The mayhem and chaos created by excessive lockdowns and now looting is overwhelming.
Can we make it to November, then January?

So did trump's consigliere (barr) really issue the order to fire teargas on peaceful protesters (including the priests of the church!), or is trump just tossing another minion under the bus?  could be either, or both.

Barr,AG of US is a total failure & uniquely biased person politically not worthy for any position in judicial system. He need to resign ya get fired as he is a political liability for The president & republicans as well come November elections.
Barr is the scapegoat. The buck stops with Trump.
Tiananmen square comes to the US because of a wannabe dictator.  At least this one can be gotten rid of by the vote.  So far.

I wonder how soon until we’ll see journalists being arrested and jailed?  The police is several cities have already gone after the press.

Gas and harass peaceful demonstrators.  Deploy federal troops on American soil.  Police harassment of the media.  

What’s next?  Martial law?  Election cancelled?  Political enemies arrested?

Bring it on Donald.  Let’s see what the Bone Spur, draft dodging coward has to offer.  Be sure and checkin with Vladimir, since he owns you.  

Donald.  What happens if you don’t prevail?  Have you thought about that?  Maybe you should.

White people really, really need to stop saying that people of color are, "not going about this the right way." Really stop saying that. If you had experienced oppression for hundreds of years, the way people of color have, there is no way you would say that, ever.

For those of us who remember 1968, this is true leadership. A nation lost RFK in June and this country would be far different had he lived. Please listen. It is the essence of what we need now, not a an upside down Bible held by a failed despot. https://youtu.be/A2kWIa8wSC0
There should be a march on Washington!

I want Trump gone from office, gone from the public square. I never want to hear his name, hear his voice, or see his face again! He has disgrace his office and all the bleach in America will not remove the stain. Words cannot express my revulsion. 

Nancy Reagan was right: Just Say NO! No more hate; no more incitements to violence; no more insults. Leave office now.  We cannot wait for November.
The only visible violence is coming from law enforcement

unfortunately, this is probably the quickest but most dangerous way to rid so many police forces of the "bad apples" all at the same time. 
Once agitated the bad ones will makes themselves known by raising their deadly tempers and shorting out their immature and broken brains. 
Garbage in garbage out.
If you don't vote in the primary and in the general election then your protest and marching will be for nothing.   We have to elect new leaders.

commentBody: The real story is that the Police and National Guards continue to use military tactics on peaceful protesters.  They used a military tank to shoot rubber bullets into a parade of peaceful protesters marching in my town.  They used tear gas to disperse these same protesters.  They claim they are restoring peace, but they are really silencing protest.  This is the age of Untruths, and Trump and our police units have had years of practice.
Thank you to all the peaceful protesters worldwide. You are the voice of change. Ignore all the critics and continue to make yourself heard for as long as it takes.

Please, people, use some common sense. 

Don't give Trump any excuse to call a national emergency. Who knows what powers he will accrete to himself if that happens. I'm thinking--cancel the election? Why not--he sees the polling. 

You're just playing right into his hands. 

Protest, fine. Peacefully.

In the military we were repeatedly reminded that we were not obligated to follow an "illegal" order.
Were these legal orders?
If an illegal order is given, who's duty is it to advise as much to those giving the order and those executing the order?

Is it possible that the Minneapolis Police Federation president, bob kroll (an avid trump supporter who spoke at trump’s Minneapolis rally last fall) colluded with the trump administration to encourage his officer to murder George Floyd, with a promise of a pardon if charged. It sounds outrageous, but unfortunately something not beyond what this administration would do, as they see his poll numbers declining after failure to lead through the pandemic, and desperate to find a way to win in November.

If this is the best spin they're able to put on this, we're getting close to hitting the point of a post-spin existence.

Should be just another day or two, at the rate things are deteriorating.

Here's a list of solutions:

-Ban for-profit prisons
-Limit use of force
-Independent investigations & prosecution 
-Deescalation training
-Police demilitarization 
-Requirement for body cameras which can't be turned off
-And many others.
-OH! and end the Drug War.

These are popular ideas, and if a GOP politicians goes against it, call them out. I don't hear politicians on TV or Twitter offering solutions. Just blame.

Wait until the statistics are released by the DA offices in NYC about the arrests made in the last week. In all likelihood a lot of people will be getting mandatory jail time for felony offenses. A lot!

commentBody: You should ask Trump if he watched when they cleared the park of peaceful protesters.

Mr. Barr seems to like investigating the legitimacy of actions and investigations of the prior administration.

Something tells me karma is about to visit Mr. Barr.

He can read the polls as well as any of us and recognizes how unpopular Trump is.  My guess is Barr will pull out all of the stops between now and November, including defending our enemy, Russia and attacking good and decent members of the FBI and the prior Administration.

The funny thing-this, for Barr, re-electing Trump may well have gone from helping Trump to saving himself.

He has enemies throughout the Justice Department and may pay a heavy price for his dishonesty.

While Trump alienates other nations, isolating its citizens with walls, bans, insults, broken treaties, fearsome military threats, protesting US citizens are being celebrated and emulated around the world. For that national and global unification and defiance of authoritarianism George Floyd's death rightly deserves great appreciation, grief and humility. It's a beginning, one hopes, of a new, lasting, world of sharing, generosity, equity, kindness, love, social distancing from the old world of exclusivity, privilege, wealth, obnoxiousness, mendacity, hate, evil. That Mr. Floyd died face down, alone in a gutter, pleading for breath, four cops callously arrayed to crucify him, is to never be forgotten or forgiven. One cop to be tried for murder is hardly sufficient, if its only that it would compound the heinous crime and leave in place the prospect of eternal recurrence. What might be done to stop the repetition of exculpation of those guilty of aiding and abetting Mr. Floyd's murder and those all too many like it? Abusive policing does not happen in a vacuum, it happens because there are not penalties for it, rather it is rewarded. Arrest, prosecution, conviction and imprisonment of the heirarchy of responsibility from the gutter to the Oval Office, Congress and Courts might  appear overly audacious but there is noteworthy precedent which occurred in year 0 Anno  Domini when Roman Imperialists made a suicidal mistake.

I understand that police officers need to follow order, but do they need to be so violent? If police officers take a knee the way the protester are, wouldn't that go a very long way to healing the nation?

I am Canadian. Admittedly, the country I live in is, and has always been, a flawed one. When we Canadians compare ourselves to the US, we’re often criticized for our air of smug superiority in relation to our American neighbours. But frankly, given the election of Trump and the goings-on of his presidency—especially the last 24 hours when a lawful, peaceful demonstration is targeted with rubber bullets and tear gas (for a photo op, no less!)—perhaps we can be forgiven for feeling somewhat superior to our friends to the south.

I have just seen the reality of the heinous action taken by the Minneapolis Police, yes we have seen the photos of the murder of George Floyd, we have heard George cry for his dead mother, probably knowing his end was near, we have seen and heard the brother, so there was a bit of family there, but this evening we have seen and heard from George's partner and seen his daughter Gianna, Ms. Washington was tearful and wants justice for George who was a dad to a six year old, this child is overwhelmed and most likely does not understand except for daddy is never coming back, the officers even in prison which they will be sooner rather than later will still see their families, their children, Trump will go on uncaring as usual, his family life questionable, what kind of home life does he really have, that kind of crazy and bitterness comes from loneliness, he may have supposed friends who are using him for profit, Melania, don't underestimate her and quit giving her a pass, most females have seen her game before, we don't buy it, money and status mean an awful lot to women, we know we can turn our heads and have a double life, you get use to it., his older children, users. My heart goes out to this child who as she grows older, will see the horror that happened to her dad, she will see the people who stood up peacefully for him, she will also see those who looted and burnt using her dad, how cold and cruel some are as humans, how warm and tender are those truly looking for peace.

What is missing from these stories is actual factual details like Mr. Barr had a water bottle hurled at him when he walked to Lafayette Park prior to making the order and that others in that park were also practicing acts of violence against Secret Service.

I am so disgusted with this administration, and these mealy mouthed GOP legislators whose panicked protestations can be likened to rats jumping ship as Trump et al brazenly rewrite our Constitution to suit their meglomanic ambitions.
  
 None of them were so moved to defend our rights, protect our economy, and allow us to 'live our lives' by acting decisively to the threat of Covid19.

  We've reached the tipping point and even now Americans exercising their right to peaceful protest are forced to flee,driven by helicopters, armed forces on foot and astride horses. 
I can only liken the horrific scenes to those from the civil rights movement, or revolutions in countries whose populace sought shelter in what was once a bastion of freedom.

  I fear this is just of another level of chaos, a domestic 'shock and awe' as the coming November election is divined.
Are we to wait, hope for a peaceful transition of power? 

I think we have been amply forewarned that our Constitution means nothing to this administration, and if we do not unite towards a common defense of those freedoms, how will we hope to exercise our right to an election unencumbered by such corruption?

I haven't wanted to use the trite phrase take back our country, but the consequences of any acquiescence would be the end of all we hold true.

Looters and those setting buildings and cars on fire need to be brought to justice, and the police who killed Mr Floyd do too as quickly as possible. There is no excuse for destroying businesses, because that means destroying  jobs during a time when the nation is under attack from a foreign virus sent by a totalitarian regime that means us serious harm.  This is a time for swift law and order. Governors need to put aside partisanship, get on board team USA and just do their jobs of restoring order or the 2020 election will be like a 1968 Nixon landslide for president Trump. City majors, mostly too young, naive incompetent progressives need to legally root out any local police with proven records of bias or over the top brutality. Media needs to tone down the hyper identity politics which is fanning the flames of the masses' emotions, but is not going to win national elections for the Democrats anyway.

Adam Schiff warned the senate that if left in office, trump (and his administration) would continue their path to destruction.  

Schiff was right.  And republicans remain republican, accepting the horror in front of them, in front of all of us.

So Barr was already planning to clear out peaceful protesters from the park and just happened to do it right before Trump decided to walk across the park?  Does Barr believe that tear gas is a legitimate way to deal with peaceful protests?

commentBody:
It is within the power of Congress to investigate why peaceful civilians were removed from public property by military force. 

Such action is a particularly awesome power of the executive and its potential abuse is a particularly direct threat to the rule of law, which each branch of government is charged with preserving. 

Mr. Barr must be called to give testimony before Congress and the American people as to why this power was deployed and if its deployment was consistent with the intent of the laws that permit it.

commentBody:
For the second time in three days, I have conversed with educated thoughtful individuals (not Trump supporters by a long shot) about the current crisis in our country, specifically, the execution of Mr. Floyd and the body politic's response. Their respective replies were frightening. Both individuals essentially stated, "I am so confused I do not know what to think."

Resisting the impulse to say, "Let's start with lots less FB, cred-less internet and cable news bloviators, and other polluters..." 

Instead, I suggested that the *only* thing they needed to be crystal clear on is the calendar: 11-03-20.  DJT must be rejected robustly. Reminders to follow.
We have Fascism in the highest levels of government in this country and people are more upset at retail stores being looted.

commentBody:
As a resident of the state now labelled "the laughingstock of the world" by the has-been TV star, nothing could quite compare with the video footage of him in front of the church yesterday. If the footage could have been submitted to "America's Funniest Home Videos," it would have won the grand prize for the year. 

He looked pathetic and totally out of touch. In fact, if Barr hadn't ordered the area cleared and Trump stood in the remnants of the tear gas, it would have at least added a small element of realism. What was broadcast resembled a pitch-man for Bible company. All that was missing was the exhortation to "Call Now!"

commentBody: I've been clamoring for Barr's impeachment for months. He's as a big threat to this country - perhaps bigger because he's intelligent and conniving - as Trump. There's nothing more dangerous than a rogue and lawless Attorney General who is willing and able to wield the full force of the federal government's legal prowess against citizen's rights and civil liberties.

So much for Barr's professed "great respect" for the laws and Constitution of the nation!

If this report is true, he should be removed from office asap.  In what sort of nation does an Attorney General issue orders to a city police force, demanding violent assault on peaceful demonstrators?  

Banana republic, despotism, authoritarian state, totalitarian state?  

It's a wonder that the extremist Barr didn't issue "shoot to kill" orders a la Chicago's Mayor Daley in 1968.

Dear NYTimes,
Why did you fail to mention that some of the people Barr ordered dispersed by teargas and flash bangs were members of the clergy?  Why do you always make the story about this administration's despicable actions instead of reporting about how their actions affect the victims of this administration's brutality?  I really don't understand what your priorities are but it seems that covering Trump is paramount.

Are the NY hospitals overwhelmed with protesters who must be spreading the ten-times-more-deadly-than-the-flu virus which caused you to shut down New York’s economy? 

SURELY the hospitals must be filled to the brim?

commentBody:
“The most basic function of government is to provide security for people to live their lives and exercise their rights, and we will meet that responsibility here in the nation’s capital,” Mr. Barr said.

Just not their First Amendment rights, if they are not the right sort of people and you and your boss don't like what they have to say, right Mr. Barr?  All that "civil rights" stuff is *so* inconvenient when the goon squad is already lined up and loaded for bear and the combat helicopters are on the way!

At the least Attorney "General" Barr needs to be fired, at best prosecuted for civil rights violations.  If people can't exercise their First Amendment rights to fix a problem then Second Amendment solutions are not far behind.  All on the heads of any official at any level who thinks or thought that shutting people up with rubber bullets, flash bangs and tear gas is a good way to avoid a few embarrassing news photos.  You deserve far worse than mere embarrassment.  If you can't back the Constitution you swore to uphold 100% then get the heck out of the way of those who can.

Attorney General Barr should be removed from office.  His actions are a disgrace to the concept of justice.  It can't be said enough at this point that this entire administration should be marched out of their offices and sent packing.  Trump is not being a president.  He is being a dictator.  He is being completely irrational.  Now he is the enemy along with the coronavirus and the economic depression, and the GOP.  

If this isn't unhinged and insane what is?  What will it take for McConnell and company to do what should have been done long ago:  remove Trump and his entire administration.  They are not serving America.  They are serving their own private interests.

Was it really Barr who ordered the assault on the protesters? Who knows, and who believes anything these people say anymore anyway. Maybe it was Jared, or Hope Hicks, or Ivanka. But likely just a cover-up for what Trump insisted on himself in order to be coaxed out of his bunker.

commentBody: The government of The United States has gone rogue. Pure and simple. Is not half way rogue. It’s a threatening and semi legal administration. If I were to say how I really felt here, the Times would rightfully disapprove of my post.
Barr is not acting for justice for the people of the U.S.  he must be removed from the office of AG.  Then, he can act as trump’s toady lawyer. What a shameful man.

Barr is a menace to our society and this attack on American citizens should warrant a criminal assault charge. Impeach Barr and Trump for this violent act against our people. They must be held accountable. If not today, then as soon as they are both removed from office.

I must implore you protesters to retreat and shelter and set up defenses as a deterrent to further retaliation. Call it a draw. The government has powerful penetrating microwave weapons and powerful magnetic equipment that can disarm you. You must retreat. This has gone on for eight days now meaning my original estimates of a calming over time were wrong. You must retreat and defend your homes. Just call it a draw.

commentBody: From what I've seen of young people these past few months, this country's future is in very good hands. During the time of their lives, they sheltered in place. In spite of images of ill-advised socializing, the vast majority stayed home. And now I see them in the streets, putting their lives on the line in ways their "president" never did, threatened with harm and even death by that same president, and I am so proud to see them, these young Americans, who truly are patriots, the proud, the free, and the brave. What can I do but pray for them, for their victory, for the future they are creating for my grandkids. God bless them all.

I have asserted many times in prior comments that sometimes police misconduct is directed by politicians who stretch the bounds of criminal laws to displace segments of society that are deemed undesirable.  Politicians demand police engage in selective prosecution or contact based upon less than probable cause which might later result in ultimate arrest when these individuals are in public places and near businesses relied upon by cities for tourism or tax dollars.

	Yesterday, Barr’s political decision to use police force is a perfect example of getting “undesirables” people away from public places so politicians can enjoy use that property without the presence of the undesirables. 

	Thus, Barr and Trump are part of the root cause of police misconduct and will never be able to objectively oversee law enforcement. 

	Obama is correct, if police reform is to come about, it has to begin by eliminating those in power at all levels  who behave like Barr and Trump.

"Stocks Rise as Investors Shrug Off Unrest: Live Market Updates"

Kind of proves the day time protesters' cause?
It is a shame that we cannot ask federal law enforcement officers to escort William Barr out of the Attorney General's office and in to the dustbin of history.

commentBody: Take a knee, continue wtih protests, use your phones to capture abuse and for heavens sake if you are peace officer act like one.  Stay calm because it is going to be a long summer Thinking men and women in uniform (or in office ) do not beat up peaceful protesters. Thinking peace officers figure out how to isolate bad actors and remove them from the scene.  And, I love the idea of keeping tRump in his cell, um bunker.   Barr can keep him company.
How is this even legal? Shouldn't this add a couple of years to the prison sentence for Trump and his criminal cabinet once he's out of immunity?

Barr? Really? The U.S. Attorney General ordered that a group of Americans be dispersed using military-like force in front of a church that has historical ties to every single US President? 

Didn’t Barr swear to￼ “support, protect, and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic?” 

Peaceful protests are not an enemy of our nation they are the origin and the underlying foundation of our great nation. 

When did that change? Isn’t America and its leadership better than this?￼ There was a time when it was and that is what made us great. Not our GDP not a movie industry not our music or our technology￼. It was our ideals. Those seem to have completely vanished and just another reason people are angry. 

I hope our leaders show the leadership needed. But as we all know HOPE is no longer a strategy￼. People can’t wait for HOPE any longer.￼

The president has ordered violence against US citizens.  Congress should hold him accountable and hold hearings; (one day would be enough) and then move for another impeachment vote.  And they should do it BEFORE he orders the killing of peaceful protesters.

Sadly, I think that gassing people is a dream come true for this monster and his minions. I hope this isn't true, but I read that his staff are ecstatic! Is this the end? The pot is boiling now, but has the slow simmer made us all too exhausted to jump out?

Former General Dempsey stated that the military should not be used as it has against its fellow citizens and he emphasized that only in terms of a Civil War. General Dempsey, we are in a state of war against a rogue government.
I guess we now get to see what it would be like if Mayor Daily were POTUS.
Who was the military guy in camoflage outfit when Trump walked to St. John's church?

commentBody: President Donald Trump & his Government can not be controlled under existing American Constitution & existing Laws. The present day population conditions needs better managing power, as technology has advanced at a Global level but human health needs lot more advanced knowledge.

why do people care so much what Trump does anyway? everyone knows he is satire. People voted him is as a no-vote to satirize the meaninglessness of left-right divisions in the current system. there is only one party: the business party.
trump doesn't care and barr doesn't care and the republicans don't care.  So why do we think talking about it is going to get us anywhere.  Let's focus on  November and loudly support Biden.

Leveraging  time honored entitlements of  Ivy League law school degrees and avoiding Vietnam  Era distractions bill Barr set the foundation for his following in the turbulent wake and inheriting the fertile essence of trail blazing  GOP  Attorney Generals Meese and John Mitchell's wind.  William Barr in 2019 at age 69 became as a second time  Attorney General, a vibrant and passionate hand on the tiller of the GOP 's future.

Louisville Police Chief was relieved from duty because body cameras were not in use either of the 2 worst nights nor for the killing of Brionna Taylor.  It was not because the gentleman was killed for no reason.  I live in Louisville.

I WAS JUST FOLLOWING ORDERS.

is that the excuse we will hear when the officers who led the assault on protesters are tried for their crimes?
So much for the idea of the peoples' attorney. Barr chose his side. It is team Barr and Trump vs. Americans and the Constitution.

The AG of the US ordered a wider perimeter either yesterday morning ( as a justice department official was quoted saying) or in the afternoon and it took several hours for it to be executed: a few minutes before trump decided on a whim to head to church? 

The head of all law enforcement gives an order regarding potus and I’m thinking it should take about, say, ummm, 10 minutes? 

It’s not that they lie, it’s that they’re so bad at it.

Early 21st century there were two very dark characters with ominous agenda appeared in Washington politics.

Dick Cheney and Bill Barr


One day History will remember these two-person with these words.

When protesters peacefully protest, it’s catastrophic for Trump. When protesters riot, it lands victory right at his feet. 

Peacefulness translates into powerlessness for a tyrant who has no political sophistication, aptitude, or even intellect enough to govern without invoking anarchy of some description. “Many fine people” personified white supremacy in Charlottesville. “Second Amendment people” could have dealt with Hillary Clinton. The repugnant list is endless. Peace is kryptonite to a man who maintains authority by exploiting the basest nature of humanity. He peddles his lies as if it’s the enlightened truth that the vast yeomanry of the previously misunderstood and abandoned have been denied. 

When protests are violent, however, they lure in those who would not necessarily support Trump to clamour for action to fettle the chaos. Then, rather than be seen as a lame duck marinated in the bitter sauce of impeachment, he becomes, by default, a law and order president. For him, these riots and deaths become a positive asset to his failed administration.  The worse they get, the less introspection they generate, the stronger Trump feels. In the meantime, his base feel justified and proud.

This is America’s grim legacy of simmering hate to be exploited only by those machiavellian enough to take that fateful step. One wonders where the assault rifles in open carry now await discharge: is this the second Civil War?

commentBody:
'Barr ordered clearing of protesters' - official says.
Really? Isn't that (keeping and maintaining public order) his job?
As for 'Biden assails...' he would have done the exact same thing, had he been the sitting President. 
Endangering the head of state or government leader in ANY country, 'democratic' or'authoritarian' is the ultimate no-no.
Can the Times - for once! - stay away from partisan politics?

St. John's Episcopal Church is a 501(c)(3) institution. It is not government property. Mr. Trump, Hope Hicks, William Barr, et al. trespassed because they neither asked nor received permission from the Bishop for this photo op.

This is America's introduction to the real Bill Barr..., the cruel, oppressive and sadistic Bill Barr. And this is only the beginning. Trump's pathetic and bizarre threat to "activate Bill Barr," as if he's some sort of political, nuclear powered weapon of mass destruction, is his way of letting us know he's directed Bill Barr to hunt down, (in the words of political sociopath Matt Gaetz), perceived enemies with fire in his eyes and vengeance as his guide, storm trooping, beating, abusing and jailing, full throttle. Who do we look to for protection from the ravages of war initiated by the US Government on it's citizens?

While this administration has been a non-stop parade of repulsive corruption, one of the most disgusting things is watching men and women debase themselves and kneel before  a man with nothing to offer but ignorance, racism, prejudice and hate. Barr doing the bidding to curry more favor with Trump is one of the most disgusting things I've seen in my life.
mmm hmmm right.  It was Barr.
Since when is the Attorney General of the United States empowered to call out the DC National Guard and uniformed police to break up crowds by force?
Barr's actions are reminiscent of Darth Vader and the evil empire(my apologies to Darth Vader equating him to Barr).

Is it not a violation of first amendment rights to not allowed persons to peaceably assemble?  Can the citizens file a  lawsuit to remove Ag Barr?  Make them prove to us there were rioters they needed to remove.  They can’t because the people were peaceful.  All except our own government, used as thugs for a despot.

Trump’s dog on a leash strikes again. The truth is I don’t know what to believe anymore. Did Barr really ordered the removal, or is he just the tall guy for his Beloved? Either way it stinks like a can of sardines left out on 100 degree heat of summer afternoon.

If a significant number of your Citizens are marching in the Streets day after day for goodness sakes listen to them. The GOP and the Trump regime have let unchecked power go to their heads and appear to be willing to use any means necessary to keep it despite the will of the people. That includes using the US Military against it's own Citizens as well as rigging elections with voter suppression measures and likely voting machine tampering; why else would they be so distressed by the thought of Nationwide Mail in Ballots.

If a significant number of your Citizens are marching in the Streets day after day for goodness sakes listen to them. The GOP and the Trump regime have let unchecked power go to their heads and appear to be willing to use any means necessary to keep it despite the will of the people. That includes using the US Military against it's own Citizens as well as rigging elections with voter suppression measures and likely voting machine tampering; why else would they be so distressed by the thought of Nationwide Mail in Ballots.

“The most basic function of government is to provide security for people to live their lives and exercise their rights, and we will meet that responsibility here in the nation’s capital,” Mr. Barr said. 

Ain't that right...

George Floyd, Brenna Tyler, Eric Gardner and too many others had that very same right.

I'm as angry with Trump's antagonistic chest-thumping as anyone, but don't these two statements contradict each other?

"Attorney General William P. Barr ordered federal law enforcement officers to clear peaceful protesters out of Washington’s Lafayette Park on Monday so that President Trump could walk to a historic church and have his picture taken there..." 

And...

"The plan to clear the park, which is adjacent to the White House, was devised before Mr. Trump decided he wanted his photo op..."

If it was planned before Trump decided he wanted a picture, how could it have been for the purpose of allowing him to do it?

Days after the killing of George Flyod and the arrest of an entire CNN crew ON CAMERA, I remain gobsmacked by the acts themselves, of course, but also by the apparent cluelessness of the police in terms of established law, symbolism, optics, and media.  Do they really have no concept of how their actions have the potential to reverberate around the world in this age? And as Stephanopoulos said Sunday—if they do this ON CAMERA, what do they do when cameras are off?

Police seem to have no training in media.  They have little training in dealing with the mentally ill, the drug addled and addicted, the disabled—I recall an instance of a deaf man being shot for not obeying orders—for domestic violence.  The only special unit I am aware of is the SWAT team.  Correct me if I err.

We need general training in all these ares, and special teams for each.  We cannot send them out to do work for which they are unprepared any longer.
I don't understand how Federal officers are legally able to assault people who are not committing crimes.

Isn't government clearing of a peaceful assembly or protest actually illegal as defined by the Constitution? Is that what the First Amendment is about? Shouldn't Barr now be sued and/or removed from office? He just broke his vow to uphold the law of the land.

So, here we are. The US Military has been deployed against Americans, and the AG ordered police to fire upon Americans who were exercising their First Amendment rights, all so Trump could get a photo op in front of a church he does not attend while holding a bible the wrong way.

I just... I don’t even know what to say anymore. I can’t come up with any words to describe how I feel right now. Angry, confused, depressed, enraged... none of those words come 1,000 miles close to describing the emotions.

I'm a long-term conservative, albeit one who voted for George McGovern in 1972 (I was an idealist back then).  Despite reservations, I also voted for Carter in 1976, though even by then I was concerned by the breakdown in law and order evidenced by the riots in '67 and '68, especially those close to home here in the DC area.

I voted for Reagan in 1980 after graduating from college and getting a good job, having quickly realized Democrats were primarily interested in picking my pockets, and haven't voted for a Democratic presidential candidate since (though I didn't vote for Trump; I went with Gary Johnson).

I have fairly strong libertarian leanings, and have long voiced my opinion that too many police officers suffer from an authority complex (and enter the profession only to exercise it), and have viewed police killings of certain black men with utter disgust (Philando Castile; George Floyd).  However, when organizations use people like Mike Brown as their poster child, my sympathies wane.

I supported the protests in the immediate aftermath of George Floyd's killing, but the descent of many protests into mere excuses for looting, burning and other wanton destruction, and the apparent unwillingness of state and local leaders to do anything to interdict them have completely reversed my sympathies.  I'd determined to vote Dem this time so long as Sanders wasn't the nominee, but at this point I'm seriously thinking of voting for Trump, something I didn't do last election.

commentBody:
The point has been made with resoluteness. 
We must never go back to the way it's been since the founding of our democratic Republic!
Now, it's time to stop destroying our cities and get to work over the tough job of solving the problems associated with racism in America!

Abuse of power. Using force to clear a legal, peaceful protest in a public park, just so the criminal and treasonous President can stand in front of a church with a bible for a photo op with his racist base. Clear abuse of power.

God willing, soon William Barr will no longer be Attorney General, and he will become a private citizen, a pariah among the circles of attorneys. Barr’s corruption and disrespect for the Rule of Law, our Constitution and Truth will be his legacy. 

A REAL leader would have gone out from the White House, albeit with Secret Service, and address the PEACEFUL protestors. A REAL leader wouldn’t have threatened Americans and bullied our governors! Trump is a disgrace.

I want to tweet the fake news that Archie Bunker twitter tyrant trump wore a mask in his underground accommodation but  I refuse to have an account.

I Imagine he would go nuculear.
Demand he resign!
That criminals are looting does not give the president’s thugs the right to shoot and tear-gas peacefully assembled Americans who are not rioting or looting. Only fascists believe otherwise.
they should be issuing an arrest warrant for BARR.
He “asked” the protesters to leave. I bet. Barr, as ever, the madman’s obedient lap dog. I wonder if he got a treat afterwards.

Somebody please explain that if people "were gassed" so a POTUS could walk to the church, why would the Secret Service/DC Police  allow Trump and his entourage to walk in a  tear gas cloud within minutes of the supposed gassing? 

Anyone?

I read smoke cans were used to disperse a crowd that refused to move, you know, "peaceful" people. 

Don't tell me the Media are lying again!

Barr ordered the goons in to terrorize the peaceful assembly? He calls himself a Christian? (Jesus weeps) 

The fact that Trump didn't do it makes him look weak 
Unless it's William Barr who has agreed to die on that cross
Doesn't really matter anyway s'pose

commentBody:
What are you all thinking?  Have you all forgotten how to respect and live with others? Have you no understanding of how low in the human specie you have become? Are you no longer aware or ... care about how the rest of the world is viewing us?  We know that all our president cares about is reelection, but what is driving you? 

As an American, I am deeply ashamed.

Sounds like Barr violated the civil rights of a whole lot of people.

Hopefully an arrest warrant will be issued for him during the next administration for his crimes.

Many have said it in their posts, including me in response to other articles - Trump is simply a coward. For those of us, imperfect as we are, to have strived to live a good, honest life, the thought of Trump (and Barr) making national policy as false as theirs is anathema. Soon they will be relegated to the dust bin of history - of that I am sure.

The Bible is being desecrated by Trump.
Evangelical Christians should condemn this.
Where is Pat Robertson when we need him most?

Trump can rally every soul in his base and he will still get annihilated in November.  He won't fool our country a second time.

This is your US Reichtag fire moment. Loads of agent provocateurs, looters and arsonists out there to discredit a legitimate protest. https://www.mintpressnews.com/agent-provocateurs-police-caught-destroying-property-protests/268125/ And your abomination in charge is taking advantage dispatching active military units against unarmed non-violent protesters merely for a photo up! Neither the US armed forces nor the National Guard have any legitimate business fighting non-violent US protesters on American soil. And a large part of your military will not fire on their fellow citizens, and those who do, should ask themselves if they have legal grounds to do it? Following orders against your constitution and fundamental citizens rights is no excuse.

commentBody:
William Barr plays Quisling once again to this out of control President intent on fanning the flames of conspiracy and hatred. 

Is it a surprise neither Mr. Trump nor Mr. Barr show even a modicum of humanity for this country's suffering? Instead, Barr orders the path cleared with smoke grenades so that Mr. Trump can pose in front of a church with a bible in hand. 

This Republican administration is sickening to behold, fat on power, and out of control. These two men will be reviled as our country's greatest traitors to justice and democracy.

Yet another impeachable offense by the President.  18 USC § 1385 prohibits the use of Army or Air Force troops to execute the laws of the US except as expressly authorized by the Constitution or an Act of Congress.  I doubt clearing the street for a photo op qualifies.  Violation of the statute is a felony punishable by two years in federal prison.
That buck keeps being passed around... it never stops at Trump, though. It would be comical if it weren't so dangerous and scary.

What do call the nation's chief law enforcement officer when he decides to put a Trump photo-op over every single freedom in the 1st amendment? That amendment guarantees that there should be no state religion, but there's Trump waving a Christian Bible in front of church he hardly ever attends. It says there should be no "abridging the freedom of speech," but those exercising that right are tear-gassed and pushed out of Lafayette Park. It guarantees the "right of the people to peaceably assemble," but Barr denied that as well by dispersing them. And finally, the right "to petition the Government for a redress of grievances" stemming from police brutality in murdering George Floyd was brutally suppressed. This is definitely not "law and order;" it's unlawful disorder by a man who seems to have forgotten that his obligation is to the Constitution and not to Donald Trump. Barr should be impeached.

Thank God for the protesters who were courageous enough to go out into the streets of our cities and our nation's Capitol and stand up and raise their hands and cry to our nation, "where is our democracy?" "Where and how are we finally going to be heard and have our rights and bodies respected by the police and the politicians of our country?" "When will America once and for all respect our dignity and rights as full fledged human beings?" We demand it now. Today. This moment. We will find democracy again, a government of the people, by the people and for the people.
Vote November 2020

Nixon is to Trump as Ed Meese is to Bob Barr.

It is so clear what is going on now.  And how it will end.
If these protester are all nonviolent, why was there so much physical damage, and why did the National Guard have to be called out in several different cities?
replies:

commentBody: Using military force on innocent civilians didn't work for Herbert Hoover and it won't work for Donald Trump.

Congress needs to immediately impeach Barr and ask for his resignation.  He has violated his oath of office.  Trump needs to reassess who actually has his best interests at heart..definitely not Barr, there's an hidden agenda there...who owns the money or who owns Jeffrey Epstein's video tapes he filmed of everyone that visited his residences. Where did those go and all the photos.  Ask those who raided his apts and who raided his others residences.
  Trump needs to be called to resign from his Republican cohorts or those who believe they took public office for a reason.  Florida's Republican representatives and senators just flashed their true racist colors hidden behind 3 piece suits and their own hidden robbery of public coffers to fill their bank accounts or their egos- from medicare, to free bank loans, to health care investigation favors to family and friends and  to corporate prison firms whom make billions of dollars off of federal grants to jail more people..just look at GEO group who owns Florida... 
  Protestors should focus on the two part gambit...police departments get federal monies for certain felony arrests, legislatures approve more felonies for more money to feed Corporate private prisons who need their beds filled. More beds filled, more money they get and more they lobby Congress and State Legislature for more community misdeeds to be labelled felonies or 3 strikes.  Prisons mean poverty, via workforce to community branding...time to reform the 3.

No surprise about the role of Barr in assaulting peaceful protesters with horses, tear gas, flash grenades and rubber bullets. Barr, is the second most dangerous man in the United States.  And just think, the first amendment rights of Americans were stomped on so Trump could have a photo op.
Why is he ingratiating himself to trump like that? I really don’t understand...

"The plan to clear the park, which is adjacent to the White House, was devised before Mr. Trump decided he wanted his photo op, the official said, but was not executed until just before he set out."  You bet. Raise your hand if you believe this.

A bible as a photo op.  Tear gas and rubber bullets for a dose of reality tv drama. Who thinks this way?

Religious leaders should follow Bishop Mariann Budde's example to call out Trump's hypocrisy.  Trump is tearing down democracy, innocents and religion all at once.  Then his tax cuts that help a few, hurt many.

Should have figured it was barr although trump was certainly capable of lowering himself to the level required to take such a despicable action.

Was barr trying to impress trump? I’m sure his gutter-minded decision was appreciated.

It’s like using a tank to kill a mosquito. Oh yeah. The protesters were peaceful and would have been required to disperse a short time later due to the curfew.

The entire episode was staged. 

trump probably had that bible hollowed out to hold a hamburger inside.
The entire rest of the world is watching the downfall of the U.S.

commentBody: Boy I sure am glad to see the police responding to protests against police violence with more police violence.  I am sure that will fix things...
Obviously the copies of the Constitution Trump and Barr have don't contain the first amendment nor hardly anything else except the 2nd.

Having lived through the past couple of months, I am no longer planning to stay in a city to raise children. My peers I have discussed it with feel similarly. When officials finally find a way to make peace with the rioters and looters, I can't help but think that those destroyers of the NYC will be the ones left. And if cities like Baltimore and Detroit which have undergone similar chapters foretell the future, it will be rough. 
I think demographics will shift much more drastically than they did with the "white flight" of the 1960s and 1970s now that many of us have remote work flexibility.
I think demographics will shift much more drastically than they did with the "white flight" of the 1960s and 1970s now that many of us have remote work flexibility.

I think, let's spend an article talking about how our police and even the military police feel about these days.

I understand that some police and military police did, are, and will make mistakes. But in general our police and even military police deserves praise for doing their best 'possible' job to maintain peace and order.

Please ask them how heavy their pressure is, especially when they have been overstretched to respond to Covid. How they feel when their fellows got hurt by their own fellow countrymen. Let them say their frustration, especially when their leaders, who are supposed to make their job easier, 'pour fuel into fire'.

Ask them how they feel when their fellow countrymen were treated unfairly.

And imagine what would happen if the police and the military do not want to do what they are ordered to do?

commentBody:
"The Justice Department has confirmed that Mr. Barr is managing the federal law enforcement response to the ongoing protests against police brutality"

That Bill Barr calls himself a Catholic when he violates every tenet of Jesus's teachings, is heresy.

The Archbishop of Washington has called him out. I hope Pope Francis says something too now that the entire world is looking at the United States in astonishment and wondering how it can so easily destroy its democracy.

It is not the job of the AG to individually manage violence in cities. That's the job of the nation's governors, whom Trump wants to ride roughshod over, so he can be seen as tough. 

It's not toughness. it's abuse of power par excellence, leading one to wonder what nefarious plot he and Barr are cooking up.

I shouldn't even raise the question as I have a pretty good idea of the answer.

Trump conflates protesters and rioters/looters for his own purpose of defying the Constitution, and further divide our country.
This is truly one of the lowest points in American history, far from the MAGA that his supporters envisioned, and closer to the feared scenarios the rest of us envisioned when he was elected.
A vote against Trump in November is a vote for a unified nation.

I have a sincere wish that the protests can also move to voice the message we should all be supporting: Trump must resign. If it gets said enough and loudly enough, the MSM may actually talk about it, even though this is the only immediate action that can be taken that 70%+ can agree would be a positive step.

I also don't understand how these blanket curfews don't violate the First Amendment. What is the national emergency -- keeping people safe from the police? I'm sorry, but looting and property destruction aren't enough to justify these curfews. Where's the late Antonin Scalia when we actually need him?
To hear Trump and his defense secretary Esper talk about the plan to "dominate the battlefield" we are left to conclude that a full-blown civil war is near.

Barr ordered the police action?  Trump did not personally issue the commands?  I am shocked, shocked!  (c.f., Henry II and Becket.)

If there is one skill that Trump has, after decades in the NYC/NJ property development game, it is insulating himself from some of the sharper edges of that business.  He has ported that skill to his current job.

I think it's particularly ironic that so many of these conservative politicians who support the rhetoric coming from the White House and other leaders, that we must "restore order," were vigorously against the removal of the Confederate Flag from state property only a few years ago.

Is there no greater symbol of civil disobedience than that in this country? The only thing I can think of is the 4th of July itself.

I'm not for another revolution or Civil War, the utter destruction and chaos that would follow would shatter the progress we have made as human beings, at a cost that would be far too great.

But to see so many conservative pundits just avoid the point of these riots and protests just further fuels them. They aren't listening, they aren't even trying to feign that they are. Just flat out admonishment, coupled with brutal crackdowns on American citizens.

It's blatantly obvious that there will be no change with this current administration, but it goes far deeper than that. When peaceful protesters are being battered in the streets, clearly that will not get their attention enough. It's hard to support rioters and looters, many with their own selfish agendas, but I can't see how else to get their attention at this point.

I'm young, but I've never seen an uprising like this before. This time, I hope, it will be different. It's happening in front of our eyes, and people are waking up to the realities that we have heard about for many years.

Powerful stuff.

if anything makes the USA the laughingstock of the world, it is military budget spending ourselves into oblivion with deficits as far as the eye can see ... and then unleashing that military might on its own citizens!

Elections have consequences. New Yorkers voted for de Blasio in 2013 and re-elected him four years later. Now they are getting what they voted for. Hopefully for decent citizens of the NYC the governor will take over the security of the city. I'm not sure he could do better, but he couldn't be any worse
     Now back to "elections have consequences". Think about this November. This riots and mayhem may give Trump the boost to pull off a victory after looking like a sure looser for many months. Even in the very left leaning NYT  I have come across some comments from readers who were planning to vote blue this year now considering a switch to red due to the mayhem. Do we really want that?

From the article:  Attorney General William P. Barr ordered federal law enforcement officers to clear peaceful protesters out of Washington’s Lafayette Park on Monday so that President Trump could walk to a historic church and have his picture taken there, a Justice Department official who was not authorized to discuss the matter said on Tuesday.

So.. on top of every other over-reach by Barr... ad to the growing list.. he ordered the national guard and white house security to use non-lethal fire to disperse protesters who were peacefully protesting in a public park across from the white house.. all so Trumpty Dumpty could walk to the church and pose for a fake photo-op.   

THIS.. is the top cop in the US in action.  Need we say any more?   And he is going to keep doing what he has been doing, until Trump is out of office.  

VOTE TRUMP OUT in November.  The free expression of citizens under the bill of rights now depends on this.
I'd be curious to see whether any D.C. National Guard troops took orders from the Attorney General of the United States and what the military might have to say about that.

According to Barr, "“The most basic function of government is to provide security for people to live their lives and exercise their rights, and we will meet that responsibility here in the nation’s capital.”  This is exactly what Trump and his henchmen are NOT doing. They provide no security and prevent people from exercising their rights. Remember two things: 1) peaceful protestors were tear gassed BEFORE  the curfew started so that Trump could hold a Bible in front of a church he was not invited to without having to look them in the eye
2) the pandemic is still killing thousands of people  every day because Trump and his henchmen can't be bothered to even try to do something about it.
Thanks goodness there is universal condemnation from religious leaders (i.e., the real religious leaders, not the fake ones that support Donald Trump).
It is past time to invoke the 25th Amendment.  Why isn't someone stepping up?  Why is there silence from our leaders?

"The Justice Department has confirmed that Mr. Barr is managing the federal law enforcement response to the ongoing protests against police brutality."

Did this send a shiver down your spine? It should!

Add to this frightening development, more incidents -- many with video -- of police assaulting citizens unprovoked is chilling! I want to believe that most cops are "good", however when the "good" ones don't rein in the angry, often racist, cops, then there are no good cops.

Law enforcement needs serious reform. But with Barr running the show, there is tacit (if not explicit) support of cops who commit crimes against citizens.

When those designated to "protect and serve" turn on citizens with assaults and false arrests, we have crossed the rubicon into lawlessness.

As principle authors in the current chapter of the American Nightmare, Barr, Mitchell and Trump deserve to go to the gallows - preferably at the Lincoln Memorial. Sending the right message is important: Sometimes leaders need to listen and then lead. The purpose of the US military is to safeguard US citizens, their interests and their welfare. It is not a private security detail of the powerful.
Thus far, 2020 has turned out to be too surreal for my taste.

Cuomo & DeBlasio have made the politically calculated decision not to call in the National Guard and let New York City burn for another night.

Let's see how this works out for them.
We know how it's working for the average New Yorker.
Barr's ordering of the clearing of peaceful protesters by shocking methods has Trump's hands all over it.
The United States isn't so great anymore.  Since Trump appeared it hasn't been so great.  Too bad.
Barr once again demonstrates that there is no limit to what he will do to satisfy Trump. I wonder if Trump uses him to send out for cheeseburgers.

I'm starting to wonder whether Bill Barr and Steve Bannon were separated at birth. Or maybe they're the same person, they just cleaned up Bannon and put him in a suit. Has anyone ever seen the two of them in the same room?
Wow, it’s like a bunch of supervillains are running the joint. I’m curious: is the Law and Order president reality-based, or a TV Law and Order president? dun dun
So, was tear gas used against peaceful protesters near the White House or not?
