commentBody: Barr and his shameful actions on behalf of President Ignoramus shall henceforth be indexed under the category, "Augean stables, in need of cleaning."

This incident was disgusting and very Un-Christian.

To shoot tear gas and flash bombs at peaceful protesters and clergy members is beyond immoral. 
And, for what ? So Trump could hold the bible up as a prop in a cheap photo op ? So Trump could says he wasn't just cowering in the white house and tweeting insults ?

I just can't believe what Trump and his administration are doing to this country. It is repulsive.
What a hippocrite the President is, standing in front of a church with a bible. He doesn't even go to mass. Hear that, all you evangelists out there. Why do you continue to support him?

The White House immediately turned footage of yesterday's "church walk" into a re-election campaign video at taxpayer expense. And today's desecration of a Catholic site continues the abomination. 

Why the photo op(portunism)? Today is primary day and several GOP toadies are facing decisive races. When all else fails, desperately try to look like a saint instead of the demon that one's actions reveal. Those church walks will be replayed as perp walks before long.

Has the brown wool come in yet for the Secret Service' new uniforms?

Is Barr Trump's attorney now?

I thought he worked for us.
Barr shows one more time he is just a tool for Trump.
Any decent Govt official left inside the White House?

Since when is it the job of the Attorney General of the United States to tear gas a peaceful protest after a public murder to facilitate a trumped up photo op for the president. He is no attorney general, he is a paid lackey on the taxpayers dime to act as Trump's new fixer. This is a disgrace, the attorney general acting to deny civil rights of citizens for a white supremacist fomenting a civil war. Pathetic! 
We have to put Bunker Boy away, far far away.

I served in the Army, 1968-1970. I had it easy. Wash DC assignment. But I remember repeated "marches" on Washington. They were peaceful as I recall. and they swelled with each successive march. 
I think that is what we need now, growing peaceful shows of support for George Floyd.
Granted, the powers-that-be will not bend easily, but violence and destruction won't do it.
If we, democrats are persistent and can mobilize to win the election, that will register.
Then maybe we can begin again, our, and MLK's, great journey toward a more just society.
i do wonder why no one, in whatever state licensed mr. barr, hasn't started a formal investigation into disbarment of him.
Using tear gas and chemical weapons on a crowd of peaceful people exercising their First Amendment rights is the act of a vicious dictator, not a president or attorney general of a democracy.

Shocking, Bill Barr, the man who was photographed staring at the park just prior to the statement of Law and Order delivered by Trump, the good catholic who marched with Trump valiantly for a chance of posing in St.John's the Episcopal Church photo-op, the man whose position it is as Attorney General the Attorney for the people, really that Bill Barr was the voice giving an order to disperse the crowd using force. How shocking and appalled the world is, after all, Barr's relationship to Trump and his wants are a state secret, no, shocking would have been if Barr was unaware and not complicit to such abhorrent behavior, it is unfortunately what is expected of a cowardly Attorney General, one who loves the limelight no matter how poisonous.

commentBody: Oh, so Trump lets Barr take the blame for ordering -- sorry, asking -- federal law enforcement to deploy military force in order to clear a walking path to a church that Trump had no business talking in front of, merely wanting a photo op?

The two primary lessons of the post World War II war crimes trials at Nuremberg and Tokyo was command and subordinate criminal liability. 

Commanders must criminally answer for their subordinates actions whether they approved or knew. Subordinates can't get away with following illegal orders as a defense against criminal liability.

What President Donald Trump, Attorney General Bill Barr, Defense Secretary Mark Esper and General Mark Miley did with men on horses,  flash bangs, tear gas, batons and guns in Lafayette Park against peaceful protesters was a war crime.

It was also an impeachable offense.

commentBody: Kudos to Archbishop Gregory, a man of integrity and courage. I am proud of him, but not so proud of most of the USA Roman Catholic bishops who have shown their cowardice.

I'm a Catholic heart and soul despite not practicing in mass, but at home, because the federal government has destroyed my peace and the sanctity of my mind and soul. So I have a problem understanding why the Catholic Church has not spoken out against the fascist likes of William Barr and Donald Trump. It's more than last night. It's his long history of supporting right wing fascist extremism in government from wars that kill many to serving an obviously evil President. Now I have a problem with the Catholic Church which has drifted from the purity of faith to the worship of men.

commentBody: Barr is Trump's personal attorney, for all intents and purposes. He doesn't act without his client's approval.

The twitter tyrant is dangerously close to pushing men and women who are serving this country voluntarily into the untenable position of “I was just following orders.”

What exactly did the forces who violently pushed the peaceful gathering out of Lafayette Park do before they shot tear gas, flash bangs, etc.?  

Did they use bullhorns to communicate their intentions?

Did they speak to anyone in the crowd directly?

Or was it just an Attorney General approved melee?

"Trump’s actions are condemned on both sides of the aisle."

So, two Republicans criticize Trump's behavior and the NYTimes calls that both sides of the aisle.

Pathetic. Most Republicans said NOTHING. How about this headline: "Trump's actions are condemned by the Democratic party and two Republican Senators".
Well I'm so relived to hear that Susan Collins is disturbed by these Republican actions. Makes everything better...

commentBody: Democratic mayors (DeBlasio) and governors (Cuomo) don't want to call in the National Guard.  They want Trump to call in the troops so they can call him a dictator.  Trump is going to have let New York City burn.

Trump and Republicans who support him are Fascists. They have no respect for you, the USA Constitution or this country.  The fact that Trump is utilizing the military in Washington DC and threatening increasing levels of violence against the American people indicates that we will be lucky if there is an election in November. And if there is an election, Trump will declare election fraud, refuse to accept the results and will not leave power. All Americans who want to keep their  Representative Government and Due Process of Law need to unify together and make sure that Donald Trump's Ideology of hate, anger, lies and racism is repudiated. Then he and members of his Administration need to be prosecuted and sent to jail.

commentBody: The police chiefs of Southern California spoke with the press about their solidarity with peaceful protesters. It was moving and uplifting to hear about protesters holding hands in Santa Monica in solidarity with the police, protecting them from bottles and rocks being thrown at them. We need more stories like these so that we don't all sink into a pit of despair.
It has been said that it cannot happen here. Well, my fellow citizens, it has. We are at the edge of the chasm of dictatorship. I feel sick.

After almost four years of President Trump, and after listening to would-be President Biden's attempts at coherent speech in recent months, I know one thing with certainty: 

Assuming that either two or three presidents will have served between January 20, 2009, and January 20, 2025, only one of the two or three will have been of sound mind. That was President Obama.

commentBody: Barr appears to be falling on the proverbial sword in defense of President Trump. Does anyone seriously think the President did not request the street clearing? Trump surely thought it would counter the "bunkered down" image he had garnered earlier, but it turns out that troops massing on people (even if they were peaceful) would restore his respect. Now Barr must take the blame for the president who never apologizes.

I hope that this moment proves transformational not only in confronting police brutality but also leads to huge acceleration in the movement to end mass incarceration. Mass incarceration has resulted from an entire justice system that has also brutally targeted African Americans, destroying people's lives, separating families and stigmatizing communities. Change needs to be bold and meet the pain of this moment, pain that has gone on for decades.

I also hope that Mr. Biden will strongly consider selecting an African American woman as VP. There are African American candidates who are among the most outstanding period--compassionate, principled, collaborative. In addition, it goes without saying that at this time in which so many in society are finally reckoning with the reality of the depth of racism that has been going on for so, so long, having someone who can best lead in creating needed changes is critical. 

Mr. Floyd's death (and the deaths of so many others) are personal tragedies. As so many have said, he is not a hashtag. But I hope the anguish that we all feel can lead to the systemic change that our country needs.
We need more protesters in Washington. Our government needs to understand they work for us.

Barr says he wanted to do it before trump gave his speech.  There was no reason to disperse peaceful protestors particularly with tear gas, police, police on horseback and deprive demonstrators of their Constitutional right.  Barr should immediately resign since he deprived those demonstrating of their civil constitutional rights.

We now learned it was Attorney General William Barr who personally ordered federal law enforcement, and the military, to clear peaceful protesters from Lafayette Square. 

Barr had the police use tear gas and flash grenades to clear out the crowd so Trump, Barr, and the their despotic clan, could visit the nearby St. John’s Church. Trump then stood in front of the church posing for photographs. No prayer issued from Trump's lips; instead he posed for photos, holding a Bible like it was a brick he was going to toss. The photo-op done; Trump left.

I'm a former prosecutor who fully understood William Barr was always going violate the law while running the DOJ for Trump. It is why Trump wanted Barr. (Look into Barr's work covering up the Iran-Contra Affair).

Trump and Barr constantly use the Justice Department to go after Trump's perceived enemies; it is how an authoritarian state works. In Putin's Russia, Putin's critics and opponents are either assassinated or arrested on trumped up charges by the intelligence services.

President Ulysses S. Grant formed the DOJ by consolidated many federal agencies. The primary purpose of the Attorney General is to uphold the US Constitution and preserve the civil rights of average Americans, specifically under the 1st, 13th, 14th and 15th Amendments, and to prosecute white supremacists.

William Barr is the opposite of what an AG must be; He actively violates the US Constitution while destroying Trump's critics and political opponents.

"Many Republicans in Congress refrained from directly addressing Mr. Trump’s behavior, but at least two Republican senators — Ben Sasse of Nebraska and Tim Scott of South Carolina, joined in the criticism. “If your question is, ‘Should you use tear gas to clear a path so the president can go have a photo op?’ the answer is no.” Mr. Scott, the only black Republican in the Senate, said at an event hosted by Politico."

This is Tyranny.  Trump must be removed from office.

The Posse Comitatus Act of 1878 states that US Troops cannot be used on US soil unless Congress approves it and a President can only order their use in cases of "insurrection" or "invasion."

The Attorney General is not authorized to order Federal troops into action against peaceful demonstrators and no one would claim they were engaged in either "insurrection" or "invasion."

Another example of "unlawful" behavior by an Attorney General, who should know better.

There is going to be a lot less money for social safety nets as the U.S. moves to austerity in the years to come. The official line and press endorsement was for immediate stay-at-home safety in trade for a risk of increased inequality and riots that border on anarchy. 

If we followed the Swedish model as a response to Covid19, the U.S. would not confront a $7.9 trillion cost for the response (as estimated by NYT), and there would likely not be any riots or anarchy remotely at this level. No one disputes the injustice of police forces, but officials and the media need to take responsibility for stay-at-home orders which created a pressure cooker on poor and non-essential workers in the U.S.

I didn't see the video of this altercation, so don't know why tear gas was used.  I will say I've seen many situations where "peaceful" protesters spit in police faces which I think is "assault".  And I've seen when police tell the crowd to back away and they push forward...pushing on the police.  I wonder if this is why police felt compelled to use tear gas, in which case I agree.

commentBody: Trump has now resorted to religion to justify his violent actions. Holding up a Bible last night, upside down actually, and today going to another Catholic church where he was not welcome. The man is losing his mind, the Bible does not justify violence, if Jesus is our Example which He is. Both last night and today he was violating separation of church and state. Easy to see. Anarchy is seeking to sweep away all law, not only divine but human. The centralizing of wealth and power; the vast combinations for the enriching of the few at the expense of the many; the spirit of unrest, of riot, and bloodshed; the world-wide dissemination of the same teachings that led to the French Revolution - all are tending to in our day involve the whole world in a struggle similar to that which convulsed France in the late 1700's. Where is the "man of peace" in all this, the Jesuit pope, silent. During the French Revolution the Jesuits alone flourished in the decaying nation, and ruled with dreadful tyranny.

Yes Mr Barr to keep the peace and let people live their lives.

You are failing in that duty as more and more black men face police brutality for minor offenses and die.

That black men can’t make the higher bail set for them due to nothing more than their race and get thrown in prison to await trial for nonviolent crimes.

If you truly believe in this ideal you would cut funding to any police force that keeps bad cops on the job, that doesn’t have adequate and minimalistic use of force doctrines, and doesn’t institute significant de-escalation and subconscious bias and racism training.  Period.

As a Catholic, I believe Bill Barr should be ex-communicated for his actions during the Trump Administration. I don't think Jesus said, "Tear gas them so the mendacious false prophet can try and cleanse the stain from a trip to the bunker."

Sister Louise used to tell me that "a good Catholic lifts people up when they are down."

Barr just wants to roll over them. For Donald Trump. God help us.
Did Barr "ask" or "order" the clearing?  Did he have the legal authority to do either?

Glad to see Biden be the leader we need.

commentBody: Can a legal complaint be field against Barr?
There is no difference between Barr and Trump, they are two faces of the same evil.
And you the Republican senators, you had a chance to votehim out during the impeachment. Now do you regret it? Is money and fame everything to you?

The core of the problem is not the killing of Mr. Floyd, though that is the catalyst.  Living conditions are awful for countless black Americans, which is nothing new. What is new is the number of racist outrages of all kinds from all sources of late, the indifference of the government, and a Democratic party that has other priorities -- the election, the virus and climate change, in particular.  

Countless whites have been distracted from racial issues and are giving lip service to very serious race problems.  In truth, they think the disturbances are all about police brutality, which is sporadic at best, and is a convenient way to place blame on the police rather than admitting their own offenses. 

Black turnout in November will be low.  The answer to their problems go far beyond Trump.  And Biden is preoccupied with other matters and making his own racial gaffes.  In order to get the black vote out, Democrats need to get behind them now.  But it won't happen.  There are too many swing white votes to worry about.

commentBody: The images of police brutally attacking unarmed, peaceful protesters is the proof that police brutality is real. It is also instructive to note that the encouragement for brutality is coming from the White House that is, in turn, being supported by some GOP senators and the right wing media. As these people have identified themselves as advocates for violence against Americans exercising their Constitutional rights, Americans need to remember their names on election day.

commentBody:
It's easy to denounce the uprising and the vandalism, too easy, and the situation needs context if we're going to think about it rationally rather than respond with kneejerk anger at the destruction and encourage law enforcemen and the virus occupying the White House - he's not really human, he's actually a virus that happens to LOOK human - to keep on their path of violence and division. 

I’m sad that people feel they have to vandalize and destroy businesses that very likely have owners/workers who sympathize with, even share their anger. 

At the same time, the damage they do can’t begin to compare with the damage President Virus has done in so very many ways to this country, its people, its environment, its spirit. 

How many immigrants and would-be immigrants, refugees seeking asylum, have died because of him? 

How many people have died, unnecessarily, from the virus because of his absolute failure of leadership, firing or marginalizing any science leaders? 

Crashing the economy - tens of millions of people have directly suffered because of him, and how many have seen their families break up their families or committed suicide under the stress of their overwhelming losses? 

Sowing discord and division throughout the country - he's accelerated a trend that was already in motion at a time when what we needed was reason and compassion and understanding.

I’d like to see an article making that comparison. The damage done by vandalism pales in comparison.

Police officers have led a charmed life in the United States.  Rarely charged with a crime unless there is a video of the criminal action, they are almost always acquitted by sympathetic juries and judges.

Violence against minorities will not cease until the officers involved are found guilty and put behind bars.  Without accountability, the criminal behavior of the police will continue with profoundly negative consequences for individuals and our nation.
Are videos needed to resolve police rioting? Are police supervisors hiding instead of supervising?

Neil Young - please write a song for these times. I was too young to know of the Kent State shootings at the time, but your ‘Ohio’ has since made it a history I will never forget. Yet, someone has - here come the Tin Soldiers again

commentBody: When are the police going to learn that they will catch more flies with honey? They are accused of brutality and then turn around and show the whole nation how very brutal they can be. How is their behavior advocating for their cause? They are merely proving the protesters’ point, over and over, with their show of brute force. In Austin this weekend police shot a 16-year-old in the head with bean bag ammunition and he is now in critical condition. They shot a 20-year-old young man in the face, shattering his jaw, and they shot a pregnant woman in the belly, and then shot her twice in the back after she fell. All of these incidents have been verified in the Texas Observer. None of these people were doing anything violent at the time they were shot. The kid with the broken jaw said he was just standing there watching. Police shot at medics who were treating the injured. All this, in a so-called liberal city. Shame, shame, shame on people who reflexively defend the police without actually paying any attention to their victims.

When the thin blue line starts to say its no longer worth the sacrifice, our Blue cities will suffer. Anyone going to protest must understand the risks given the criminals and instigators who are there.

commentBody:
Re statements like “this is not indicative of how we treat people in (FILL IN THE BLANK).” 

Look, I get what you mean. 

You want to say, “This offends me, this isn’t how we should treat people, most of us don’t do this,” and even, “we’ve trained them not to do this.” 

But the video plainly shows that this IS how you treat people. 

So stop saying it.

commentBody:
Does anyone see the irony in a bible-waving Donald Trump calling out the military to protect him from the masses? 
We have exactly five months to prepare ourselves for an election that will depose a fake president. Every day until November 3 will be a battle to maintain justice, freedom and fairness in the American system of government. Do no expect any help from the White House, the Republican Party or conservatives who have been co-opted into thinking they have control of the country. They do not!

I’ve watched all seven of the Atlanta police body cam videos and think I’ve heard police shouting he’s got a gun.  The driver of the vehicle drives away when the vehicle is initially stopped after what appears to be an attempt by police to remove him from the vehicle, police then follow the vehicle and when it’s stopped for a second time, the occupants are tasered and forcibly removed. The NYT article states that the prosecutor does not know why the vehicle was initially stopped.  So, why were the cops fired and now face arrest if no one knows the reason for the stop, and/or if the cops believed an occupant of the vehicle had a gun?  How can we know if a police response is proportional without that information?

commentBody: The  EPA values a human life at $9.1 million, the FDA at $7.9 million, and the US Transportation Department at around $6 million. What does the death of  George Floyd over a pack of cigarettes tell you about the value of his life in today's America? Explain it too me please President Law and Order.

Trump is fomenting hate and divisiveness, instigating violence, instilling fear in his constituents as he hides in a bunker.

Unthinkable that the president should be doing these.

But viewed through the lens that Trump is a traitor, what he is doing makes perfect sense.

Remember, the very first thing he did as soon as he was inside the bunker was call Putin to ask him for advice.
Be best!

Where are the far-right militias?  Isn't this what they've been training for?  The federal government threatening to fill the streets with the military creating a police state environment?

Looting and destroying property by a small minority vs. pointing rifles at federal agents (Cliven Bundy anyone?).

Protesters should show the exact same amount of respect that the President has shown to them.
Donald Trump is playing the Limbo Game.  The "this is a new low" bar keeps getting lower and lower.

I can tell you this for sure; this anarchy will put firearm sales through the roof. Any gains made on gun control are probably going to evaporate by popular demand. Out of control looting, burning and violence in our streets has people rightfully scared. 

Until this time I fully supported outlawing military grade weapons with high capacity magazines as I could not imagine what legitimate use anyone would really ever have for the them.  Now I know and it saddens me.

commentBody: Historically this country looked up to its president to lead and to unite the people. In consequence, the administrative branch has been given too much power, which means one person has too much power. And democratic election unfortunately does not guarantee to deliver a sensible leader. It's time a reform the governmental structure that substantially reduces presidential power and the resources that a president can command. This is how a functional and small government means. Make it essentially a service branch.

If he had an ounce of sense Mr. Trump would take a knee for American lives lost to police violence. Instead he threatens protesters -and these are people from every walk of life- with Apache helicopters, smoke bombs and amps up his incendiary rhetoric. Where is this president's sense? He is deranged.

commentBody: If Trump is so afraid that peaceful protesters needed to be gassed and banged to clear his path to a nearby church for a photo-op then he clearly is not fit to be President.  Since Trump needs to be first in all things let him be the first President to be removed under the 25th Amendment.

I have no sympathy whatsoever for the police.  Anything they get, they deserve based on their own behavior. They think it is okay to slowly suffocate a man to death.  Okay to drag innocent college students from their car, throw them to the ground and tase them.  Okay to kill a restaurant owner who had fed them for free.  Okay to manhandle and arrest business owners who were trying to stop people from looting.  Okay to terrorize and beat people who are merely protesting. 
People are not taking it anymore.  They are tired of the police behaving like a gang of outlaws and terrorizing and killing people for fun. Rock and bottle barrages from the public?  Good. Someone drove an SUV into a crowd of police officers and an officer was run over?  DiBlasio said that action was okay when a cop did it.  Just desserts.

And now is the time for all police officers who do their duty the right way to call out those who don't.

You go ahead and keep arresting us cops that protect you. But remember that phrase: 
“But when they came for me, there was nobody to help me.”

We *really* mean it.", 'createDate': '1591125174', 'updateDate': '1591141346', 'approveDate': '1591125518', 'recommendations': 20, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107389054, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jerry Sturdivant', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107389290', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107389377, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107389377, 'userID': 80847355, 'userDisplayName': 'Ignatz', 'userLocation': 'Upper Ruralia', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Jerry Sturdivant

I think we can weed out officers like Chauvin without decimating the ranks so there's no one left.

And hire people who DO want to do this job correctly. With so many out of work, it shouldn't be hard to do.

You can't be supportive of behavior like that, can you?

That is where this outrage started...and like all conflagrations, it has now spread out of control....

I have never had a bad experience with a police officer, but I'm white and wealthy. 

No group is monolithic....and if we all could remember that, we wouldn't be in this mess.

You know what they say about "assume".', 'createDate': '1591125380', 'updateDate': '1591134539', 'approveDate': '1591125520', 'recommendations': 11, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107389054, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jerry Sturdivant', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107389377', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
So Atlanta cops get arrested for assault. Guess they must wish they were NYPD. 

I’ve seen videos of plenty of unprovoked NYPD assaults and not one arrest.

I think the federal government should mandate body cameras for all police departments with at least 100 officers and a mandate for dashcams for all police cruisers regardless of department size and a citizen’s right to a copy of any footage that depicts an interaction they had with police.  If the federal government can mandate that auto manufacturers install backup cameras in all newly manufactured cars, then it’s not unreasonable for them to mandate cameras for cops.

commentBody:
So.

About that 20 seconder photo op which happened only after Trump has his fellow citizen tear gassed and spayed with rubber bullets.

What does Trump want us to think as he held a bible?

• that he can lift the bible above his shoulder?
• that he can hold a bible with one hand?
• that his hands are really small when scaled via a standard bible?

He did not read the bible. Not even a single passage from his favorite book “Two Corinthians.”

So what was the photo op about?

Maybe a distraction from the trending hashtag for the day #bunkerboy.

From the White House to the church. Is this the longest distance he has walked at a stretch during his presidency?

He certainly uses a motorized cart on the golf course.

So this must be it. I fear for his health.

Regarding the arrested Atlanta officers, I watched the horrible video on YouTube. 

It’s not a stretch to say that African Americans are subjected to state sanctioned terror. 

Luckily, the Atlanta terrorist cops didn’t get away with their hate crimes.

This sentence left me in wonderment: "Experts say the limits of the president’s powers is unclear."  How can this be?  After all these years this is an unknown?  Perhaps events in 2020 will provide the test which will make clear what POTUS can and cannot do regarding domestic use of the military.

commentBody:
Military Police from the National Guard in combat uniforms surged in front of law enforcement officers, using shields to push back peaceful protesters from Lafayette Square. Then the police used tear gas and flash grenades to clear out the crowd so Trump, Barr, and the rest of their despotic clan, could visit the nearby St. John’s Church. Trump then stood in front of the church posing for photographs. No prayer issued from Trump's lips; instead he posed for photos, holding a Bible like it was a brick he was about to toss.

In contrast, Joe Biden spent the last days doing nothing but listening in churches to those who have suffered, and he prayed. Trump and the GOP may try to pretend that Biden is weak and demented but it's a lie.

Biden spoke in Philadelphia. Despite a speech impediment, he spoke coherently, deliberately, and with passion and outrage. He spoke about the fight for the soul of our nation; how it was a struggle for social, economic, and racial justice. 

Biden's humility, his willingness to listen, and to see himself as part of a solution was evident. He acknowledging how communities of color have had a boot on their necks, and have long been brutalized. I appreciated that he stated reform must be undertaken by all Americans if it is to succeed. Finally, I appreciated that he said all Americans had to confront what was happening because this did not being with George Floyd, nor will it end with him.

The contrast from Trump could not have been more striking.
Like most people I appalled at the entire situation. However, can someone please explain why is knee-on-neck choke hold still legal in this country in the 21st century ?

Regarding arrests of Atlanta officers, let me say at the outset that I did not see what happened and probably don't know enough to comment on whether the arrests are justified.
 
But I feel comfortable saying this: An unintended consequence of what is happening will be the police failing to respond timely to calls of criminal conduct in areas that are considered high-crime and are at least largely black. The irony is that a direct correlation exists between how poor an urban area is and how badly the residents need police protection. Happened in Baltimore a few years ago. Watch.

commentBody: While the behavior of the police is receiving all the attention now, the criminal defense attorneys, DA’s and politicians are escaping scot free.  No doubt the killing and treatment of blacks has been demonstrably unacceptable.  However, I think people are going overboard now.  The officers have a difficult job balancing the safety of the community and deterring  criminal behavior.  This incessant criticism of every aspect of a police officer’s duties and the chant to defund the police will ensure that in future motivated individuals will not apply to become police officers, which will have catastrophic societal consequences.

commentBody:
Trump and his First Lady of Be Besthood using churches they don’t attend as backdrops for campaign ads is really the height of Trumpian  bad taste.

What am I saying?  It is probably nowhere close to how horrifyingly low he will stoop in order to attempt to claw out an electoral win.
Donald, I don't think this unrest is good for business, nor will a police state be good for business. So maybe fanning the flames will not get you elected since the economy will go down the tubes.
Hopefully, the kneeling is honest and not a political tactic while condoning further abuse.
replies:
[{'commentID': 107390679, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107390679, 'userID': 62661042, 'userDisplayName': 'Mateo', 'userLocation': 'USA', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@R 

Agreed.  Prefer it to deescalate if it is true.

I think the police unions need to take a knee and allow reform that benefits the community.  A police officer should not be above the law.  They are a citizen like you or me.  There should be no intervening force beyond what is allowed for all citizens.  

If they commit a crime they should be arrested.  And outside police from other states may or should investigate based on a rotation of departments capable of doing so.  This would allow no conflicts of interest for chain of command structure.  And the feds can do theirs.  And a citizens grand jury should be formed to investigate all instances and call all records of the officer.  This is for civic accountability to the community.

Also there should be citizen grand jury’s constantly cycling in and out to go through the records of police and conduct investigations.  They should have strong powers to hold officers accountable under oath.  They also need the ability to suggest prosecution of crimes if necessary and make recommendations that bypass the unions for the benefit of the community. 

In order to hold them accountable you need citizens to watch dog them.  Not their own agencies.', 'createDate': '1591128121', 'updateDate': '1591128830', 'approveDate': '1591128830', 'recommendations': 0, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107388114, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'R', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107390679', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: As an African-American progressive activist, I must salute the white Americans who are standing with African-Americans and other vulnerable people of color in these dark days of protest after the George Floyd murder by Minneapolis Police Department Officer Derek Chauvin. These white Americans prove that there are millions of wonderful, morally upstanding whites in this country we Americans of color should be proud to call our unrelated siblings. Given the difficult politics of race, I honestly believe that white Americans who are protesting white-on-black racial discrimination and police misconduct in the wake of the George Floyd murder are heroes.

commentBody:
It seems every other police activity be it arrests, using tasers, applying physical restraint is now seen through a race filter. People esp. the protesters don't want to understand that if every criminal or law-breaker plays the race card then law-enforcement ceases to function effectively.

If every police officer has to think five times before restraining someone for self-defense or because that individual refuses to comply with the law, then why bother having police on the streets. Lets just have everyone do their thing like using counterfeit money to pay for cigarettes and then later blame the police for not responding to a call or blame them anyway for responding and taking action. 

Let's just sit back for a bit and think why was George Floyd treated the way he was? Would things have turned out differently had he been compliant or respected the officers and the law? Did he swear at the officers? If he was innocent of the crime, there are ways to prove his innocence. Not everyone who gets stopped by the police is in the wrong. 

But we conveniently ignore the fact that the suspect is the one who brings the wrath of law-enforcement on themselves because of the way they disregard the law and its enforcers. Its always easy to blame the cops.

Also, point to be noted here, if the police are racist and brutalise minorities, like they say, then howcome only black people face this situation. Wouldn't racist police be targeting other minorities too? But that's not the case.
replies:
[{'commentID': 107389021, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107389021, 'userID': 75728943, 'userDisplayName': 'GS', 'userLocation': 'Brooklyn', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@CitizenX 

"Let's just sit back for a bit and think why was George Floyd treated the way he was? Would things have turned out differently had he been compliant or respected the officers and the law? Did he swear at the officers?"

Are you saying cops should be able to kill people for swearing at them?  I have news for you - you don't get to assault anyone for swearing at you.  You certainly don't get to slowly and deliberately kill a man.

commentBody: Trump is becoming more dangerous by the day. This bible waving stunt shows that his depravity knows no bounds. There is some good news that comes from this incident though. Ask Gandhi and MLK how well nonviolence works.  They both got shot to death.
Violence always trumps nonviolence.
Why can’t I say that?  Is it evil?  
It is the truth.  Machiavelli knew that.  So did Mao.

Is he now a "papist" or "liberal mainstream Protestant(Episcopalian)" to use the language of Evangelicals? Surely his white Evangelical supporters can see through this stunt and hopefully realize they are just props themselves.

commentBody: A police officers job is no doubt difficult — but it is more difficult to be a black man or woman in the face of any law enforcement.

I was shocked that two African American police officers Tasered and dragged two African American young people from their car during a recent encounter in Atlanta. 

If we can't count on even black police officers to render good judgement during police encounters what hope can one have? 

Atlanta's mayor and police chief show how leadership should respond to dubious incidents like this. As black leaders, they show the level headed appropriate engagement and response that can lead us toward healing.
George W. Bush, please come out and endorse Biden, and soon.  Your country needs you and there is no need for loyalty to what used to be the GOP---it doesn't exist anymore.

commentBody:
Joe Biden is such an embarrassment.
Worse, though, are the centrist Dems that foisted the “Nothing will change” candidate upon us.
What degree of better has Trump made America? (Clue: You are lost if you are considering positive numbers.)

Dear Mr. Biden,

Trump's in this for the long haul. You know that. He's not gonna concede if he loses the November election ... if there is a November election. When he unleashes the US military, who will it side with - likely not all one way or the other, and you know what that means, unless Tiananmen Square revisited is America's  future. 

If the pro-Trump faction of the US military needs 'help,' the Trumpet will summon the militia who are waiting in the wings to shoot to kill with their court-sanctioned WMDs, and then there are mercenaries, domestic and foreign (a nod to the Russians).

BTW, the hubris of winning the Cold War and creating a Pax Americana (what a joke) is headed towards the totalitarianization of America ... and ultimate victory by America's one-time Cold War adversary. The rich couldn't care less what flag is flown. Oligarchs do well in Russia, and they pay their guard dogs and apologists well enough to overcome any annoying feelings of warmth towards humanity. America's oligarchs will do ... are doing ...  the same.

So, Joe. Are you up to it? If so, select a VP who is ready NOW to carry forward in your absence ... please.

The reverberations of the Trumpocalypse will be felt throughout the world, so we, outside the USA, desperately want civil war to be AVERTED, electoral democracy to be RESTORED and racial justice to be MADE commensurate with CIVIL society.
Turning the armed forces against protesters peacefully assembled against state violence and white supremacy is a fundamental violation of the US Constitution.
I thought it was unconstitutional to use the military for law enforcement....Oh, wait....Trump doesn't HAVE to abide by the Constitution...Just ask Barr and McConnell.
So Michael pompous will meet survivors of Tiananmen Square, they can compare notes on how the USA is quickly becoming a failed country just like China!

Deploying helicopters and military units to engage people who are...

...frustrated by racist violence, fatigued by months of quarantine, exhausted, jobless...

Makes sense.  Good call.
It's not a coincidence that neo-Nazi groups, the Klan and white supremacist militias are all Trump supporters, and that no other Trump supporter ever criticizes them.
Where are black community leaders in all of this?  One would hope that their voices and support would add some comfort..where are they?
One has to wonder if white college students would be tasered for breaking a curfew in Atlanta.
Tonight, tomorrow or the next night, will we witness Trump’s Tiananmen?  Will the US military fire on American protesters seeking equality and justice. A moment that will shame America.

Protests are useful to bring awareness of issues to the federal/local authorities. But once these issues have been brought out, then the purpose of continuing the protests is questionable, if not unreasonable. Thus, after a few hours of protesting some of the crowd becomes easily susceptible to the manipulative or violent exhortations of those who want to exploit the protesters for nefarious behaviors and illegal activities. And others enter the protests simply as a cover for their intentional acts of violence. Large groups almost always become susceptible to such aggressive behavior; it is not a surprise. What is a surprise is that the government agencies allowed these protests to continue after the first night.
Trump is well aware that this unrest stirs his base, and directs attention from the pandemic and economic nightmare happening around us. Problem is - its just June.

If, as Mr Trump claims, the POTUS is powerless to act against the protests - and his blame is therefore laid at the feet of 'Democrat governers', what on Earth is the point of re-electing him? Wouldn't he remain powerless if returned in November?

If Trump has no Superman powers now, how will millions of votes change that?

AG Barr threatening rioters with prosecution is hardly reassuring. I don’t hold out much hope for the George Floyd case and the shameful police behavior if Barr is involved. There’s doubtless about to be yet again another miscarriage of justice. It will be conceived, planned and executed surreptitiously in accord with trump’s blessings. Just as with the Mueller investigation, there will be audacious intervention, a brazen cover-up, a suppression of  facts, and a broad-based exoneration of actual crime. It will engender the assent of powerful GOP law-makers and all will be enabled and sanctioned by a GOP-controlled senate that just recently brazenly acquitted an impeached president.

I watched Joe Biden. He did read well from a teleprompter, answered no questions, criticized Trump but spoke only platitudes and had no worthwhile suggestions about the twin crises and that was with a teleprompter. God help us when we are given the choice we have before us.

on one side the administration has no idea how to deal with the looters. on the other side, they know quite well how to force peaceful folks. 
It seems 'I don't take responsibility at all' can be applied for any situation and anytime. Let's see what more chaos is coming next

So glad these Atlanta cops have been arrested. We need to abolish ALL public employee unions, whether teachers, DMV workers, sanitation workers, or police, so that bad egg or unproductive employees can be fired quickly and without repercussion. And put them all into the regular Social Security system with the option for a 401(k). No more nest egg pensions to get at age 55 at 90 percent of salary. Make these changes, and I am sure that more BIPOC will want to become public employees. We surely need them.

President Trump just had his Michael Dukakis moment.  The entire orchestrated, contrived charade of standing in front of a church holding up a bible, all done for his narcissistic photo op.  First, he flexes his perceived muscles with a show of force on a peaceful protest (also done for effect), then walking ceremoniously toward the church with his minions ans sycophants in tow.

A man who shows no affinity for religious principles, decides to use symbolic gestures of the church to fool people into thinking he's a leader of some sort.

Given the opportunity to lead, the president continues to disappoint at every turn.

We need someone to step forward and fill the void that exists.

What constitutes peaceful is a question? Screaming and cursing and acting aggressively is NOT peaceful. Just because one puts their hands up and screams profanity and does not follow social distancing rules or leave a position denoted but the police to be off limits is not peaceful. Peaceful is no screaming, no anger, no rioting in anyway. There is no way to peace, peace is the way .

Re: the video of the Buffalo incident: NO American city should EVER see military-style, steel-plated vehicles, with machine guns protruding, rolling down the streets.

And I don’t want to hear about “well, they need it to quell the threat.” It’s the police who ARE the threat, and it’s the citizens that are being forced to deal with the police’s vast errors in both training AND judgement.

Arming them with weapons of war sends a VERY clear message. Those being threatened with such displays will not always turn and run.

WHERE is the leadership??? At ANY level???

commentBody: If the military is sworn to uphold the Constitution against all enemies, they could begin with acting against Trump.

trump is flailing and failing. Empowering AG Barr to strong-arm State governors is a desperation move that won’t work. It will backfire because Barr has lost all credibility the way he deliberately muzzled Mueller investigation. Barr is still sitting on the ‘unredacted’ Mueller report. It’s release is long overdue. What is so far undisclosed will undoubtedly implicate Barr because he was directly involved in what was redacted (ie covered up). He’s hiding something.

I got to admit that I'm a little shocked at how long these protests are lasting.  And it's people from all walks of life, all races and all ages. It's just too bad that the looters and vandals have to ruin it. So America woke up. Better late than never.

commentBody:
Donald Trump is a weak person's idea of what a strong person looks like. 

He is cowardly and weak and so are his supporters--oh, except when they are shooting at or attacking peaceful Americans. Then they have some power.

It is only a matter of time that the military industrial complex paid for by US taxpayers was turned around and used against US citizens.
Our government is threatening to use deadly force against us just like every other tyrannical government...we are not exceptional.

This is more like an actual ‘start’ than the officers performatively taking a knee. All officers abusing their power must be prosecuted and jailed. And what we’ve seen this week contradicts the police chief - violent abuse is exactly what the police are about; they love it. In video after video they gleefully terrorize peaceful protestors. They leave piles of bricks to entice protestors into violence and then break store windows themselves. They all need to be prosecuted and the police chiefs fired. The cops are the criminals.

I saw uplifting pictures of police officers, black and white, "taking a knee" in solidarity with the protesters. Colin's K. eloquent and dignified gesture should become our main form of protest. It will be hard to tear-gas a kneeling crowd.. The more we do it, the stronger we will become. Let's all "take a knee" during George Floyd's funeral -- from coast-to-coast, from sea to shining sea.

commentBody: Trump isn't threatening to use military force. He's using military force. Deploying military helicopters to intimidate American citizen's in our nation's capital is a tactic commonly used overseas to displace insurgents. As Walter Shaub, former director of the Office of Government Ethics noted, "A line was crossed tonight. There will be other lines. This is Trump conditioning them to cross those lines."

commentBody: This is not how you will de escalation the unrest in this country by calling up the active duty. This is a most certain way to escalate it even more. This would be the job of the National Guard and that lies with the Governors of the various states. It is past time for Police reform. This needs to start happening now.  This will be he sixies all over again. I for one would then consider protesting I am a Veteran and I would be sure there would be many more veterans  that would feel the same.

commentBody: Some think Trump could use video of the protests in a bid to be seen as a candidate of law and order. Actually, Biden could do the same thing, for the same reason, to greater effect.

These are the "wages" of shutting down the economy. it takes s tiny push to get the worst people to do the worst things and then, feeling overworked and ignored-the police end by doing little or nothing as they are overwhelmed We knew this was possible-we ought to have been ready and we ought to have never left our main shopping districts abandoned like deserts.  
It is past  time to open up--we may be losing five  90 year olds  every day, but if we don't care for our economy-over 3 centuries old- even    issuing unenforceable "curfews", we will have cut our own throat.
Pandemics will  occur-so does riotous behavior among unemployed and bored people. 
 If adults do not present the right example-it is no wonder the kids think they may  act in what they see as a legal and political vacuum, where authority seems able to act as it pleases, but  authorities are not answerable for their misbehavior.

I've seen this movie before. The military will be called in and  the looters realize the party is at last over. The people protesting are mad with anger and frustration and must calm down. Police reform is primarily the work of of local organizations and will take years of bipartisan effort. To expect overnight change  is childish and will only damage the process.

In a little less than six months, we'll see if the current unrest in response to George Floyd's death increases the margin of Trump's defeat, or leads to his re-election. I wish I was confident that it won't be the latter outcome.

Our president, Mr. Trump, has found new shiny objects to further mesmerize his followers-calling the elected leaders of states and cities as weak and giving the looters free rein and a message that says only he can fix it.  Fix it with the military, our military, confronting the citizenry which will further exacerbate the violence we see.

Those governors and mayors are not and have not shirked their duties.  The restraint in attempting to avoid bloodshed is seen as police officers are shot, are injured and no “tit for tat” has, at least yet, been used that we know of.

Trump, rather than using houses of worship and shrines considered holy, and attempting to invoke the teachings of Christ and others, as his guide is laughable as he, Trump, calls for more violence with the possible introduction of military when Christ and others begged for peace (well, the exception would be the religious wars).

Trump, a person who eschewed military service, is quick to use “his military” to further advance his toxic form of “leadership” and continue to feed fuel to the fires of discontent.

Please, for the sake of this country, will an adult in the administration please muzzle Trump-and take away his tweeter binky.

If this is the leadership Trump promised his supporters, that leadership is wanting.
Trump an "ally of peaceful protesters"?  That's rich.  He was certainly no ally to Colin Kaepernick.

When the president can commandeer an army to perpetrate violence on a group of citizens peacefully engaging in a constitutional right, democracy is finished. 
There are no consequences for his actions so now we know he can do any power play he likes, and there’s no one to stop him.

commentBody: Trump's actions seem to be geared towards ruining America's reputation as a free and open democracy. Who benefits from that most? Russia, yet again!

Republicans are coming to the same realization Democrats have had since the day Trump's presidency began:  he is too weak and too easily distracted to protect any American.  President Trump can bluster all he wants, but he cannot protect us, because he simply does not know how.  Republican pundits first learning this truth, that Trump is weak and growing weaker by the day, must now call on him to resign.

commentBody: Trump needs to respond to the message the protests are communicating, Black lives Matter. He needs to tell the world he hears what the issue is and show empathy for the problem. Any communicator knows showing empathy in an angry situation can diffuse it.

Impeachment for Sedition, right now. This is an emergency. Bypass the endless committees. I have written my congressman. Everybody should, right now.

What will happen in the senate? Supreme embarrassment. Much worse than in December. Some Republicans will now fear their reelection chances, as the nation burns and sickens.

donald still claims he's the "law and order" candidate.
Call me old fashion, cause I am, but I still like to think my "law and order" candidate isn't BUSTED just prior to inauguration conning money from our Veterans.  30+ million stolen and had to be paid back.
Who defined that as "law and order"?
If the "new" America is made up of people who can stomach a person/president/habitual liar they wouldn't let get with in a mile of themselves in the real world then I think there has to be a better place somewhere.

Trump is pretty much threatening the same thing that happened to Floyd.

Object or I'll put my foot on your neck (call in the military forces).

There's no excuse for looting.  But the ones near the White House weren't looting.  They were exercising their right to protest peacefully.  Yet they were tear gassed just so he could go stand in front of the church and hold up a Bible.

If you think voting Trump in for another term is going to restore peace, think again.  This isn't the answer.   More force.  If he really wanted to get the country rolling again how about some gestures of conciliation and willingness to listen.  A few calm words could go a long way, but the only act hes got is the strong man.  Who hides in his bunker of course.

Trump is no leader but neither is Biden. Biden is a Caspar Milquetoast who acts like he doesn't have a clue. An occasional great, empathetic speech containing vague platitudes isn't going to save America from so many simultaneous crises. I wish with every fiber of my being we had another candidate to choose from, someone truly bold, innovative, and moral. Why can't we have that in such a great country?

commentBody: Let the gaslighting begin!  It now appears that key GOP senators are trotting out the talking points of the White House and advancing the narrative of "outside agitators" and "Antifa" in defending the use of force in Lafayette Park. The world saw with its own eyes the attack on peaceful protesters in the park. The only tools the administration have are threats of violence and falsehood. With this pathetic toolbox we can only expect the inevitable disaster that was predicted on Nov 9, 2016

I would have liked to have seen the words "pre-curfew" somewhere in the lede, or the word "legal" modifying the word protest.  

Trump is an unlawful President. The White House figures who were with him are like the uncharged police officers in the George Floyd murder. They are accessories to a crime against the people and the Constitution.

Another missing word was "sacrilege," in that he was mocking the Bible and its meaning in his photo op, and unjustified attack on innocent people.

Proverbs 6: 16-19 tells us who God hates. Trump ticks the boxes.

San Francisco

We’re frequently hearing “riots re-elect Republicans” - specifically referring to suburban white voters who, it’s assumed, will accept the Trump/Barr/Fox News narrative that protesters equal looters equal Democrats.  

Maybe “suburban white voters” deserve more credit than this.

They might well recoil at scenes of vandalism and burning buildings - but recognize the protests were overwhelmingly peaceful. 

They might also agree the far greater horror was a police officer’s public torture and execution of a black man accused of using a $20 bill he might not have known was counterfeit. 

They might further acknowledge these disturbing incidents happen too often not to require systemic reform. 

They might see the right to protest peacefully and try to make a more just country are deeply American.

Let’s hope only true Trumpists accept false narratives and fail to see how Trump is sowing division and unrest to serve himself not the country.

Trump had young protesters gassed before curfew had even begun so he could walk over to a church which he seldoms attends and which he did not enter , and where he did not pray, to hold up a bible that doesn't even belong to him, for a photo .  God help those who are impressed.
When will some people learn the lessons from history that violent suppression never works? Of course Trump is unlettered and thinks he is "a stable genius." Of course! his uncle taught at Harvard!

You know, it might be very interesting if Trump did try to use the military to suppress the protests.   A large proportion -- perhaps a majority -- of the rank and file are from the minority communities which are at the center of the protests.  

In Vietnam, white officers learned that it could be very dangerous to give unpopular orders to black troops.  Now we have a situation where they'll be ordered to fire on their own at the behest of a President who has been publicly supportive of the white supremacist movement.

Like I said ... interesting.  Tragic, but interesting.

Too many police officers didn't know how to deal with stressful situations that come with the job under normal circumstances.  I always question the kind of training they're receiving.  We expect them to know what to do now?  Its pretty obvious they are not prepared in any way for this, specially after such a long time reacting and not being held accountable in most cases when they go over the line.

The police are hijacking the narrative which rightly belongs to citizens, and especially protesters, right now.  If we listen to chiefs like Commissioner Shea in New York, they appear to be doing it intentionally.   Shea has spoken of the NYPD's extensive knowledge at handling crowds and peaceful protest, using a "scalpel" to root out the "bad" protesters, etc.   Yet on the ground, we see none of these supposed skills.  "Good cops" hijack the story by taking a knee in phony allegiances and "Kumbaya moments".  "Bad Cops" self-victimize at thrown water bottles and hysterical protesters who get in their way, claiming justification for tear gas, aiming pistols, ramming SUVs, and beating unarmed protesters.  It all amounts to poor excuses for stunningly incompetent crowd control and a desire by the police to sow more chaos.

But also by our leaders, our governors and mayors, those in charge of handling the way our states and cities handle the protests.  Why present the very object of the debate - heavily padded and helmeted police -  to an angry, anguished, grieving crowd?  The answer is that healing and reconciliation are not the priority.  Not for the leaders.  Not for the police.  What is the priority is to undermine the narrative .  Their aim is to make the protesters look weak if they are peaceful, and violent if they are angry.

commentBody: People in the White House with their own agendas are playing Trump. He's not a smart enough politician to think of these things, some advisors are playing to his ego and innate prejudices to further their own hatreds and hateful policies. You can tell by how tone deaf his actions are, a real dictator is much more polished.

Where are our four ex presidents in this time of national need? Even if jimmy c needs to be pushed down the street in a wheelchair the American people need to see some sort of solidarity about how a potus should lead.

commentBody: All I want is for one politician to say, "We need to de-militarize the police as a baby step."  Just one.
It is time, once for all, to stop police brutality. Punish Bad Cops and Protect Good Cops. God Bless America

I am so relieved arrest warrants have been issued for the six police officers who drug the two college students out of their car to arrest them in Atlanta. I watched this violent arrest take place on the news and could not believe my eyes at the malevolent way they were treated. The police shattered the glass of the driver’s window to get at him. Their only offense was waving their arms out of their car after the curfew. The police were acting like violent madmen, it was crazy. There is no way we are going to calm this country down if the police are going to continue to be violent against black people.

Several sheriffs across the country summoned the courage to meet the protesters and match with them to defuse some of the anger. Trump, a coward, has attacked them, which will only make them more angry.

He stated the new N-word was THUG to NPR in 2017. 

Flash-forward 3 years, President Trump’s tweets with the use of 'THUGS' (capitalized) during civil rights protests against police brutality.

He then changes the world 'THUGS' to 'PROTESTORS' but invokes the civil rights era "when the looting starts, the shooting starts," claims ignorance, then decides to also uses references of vicious dogs -- used during the civil rights era -- to frighten protestors. 

The Trump Party needs to have a "come to Jesus moment," where they need to have a deep retrospection and ask oneself,

"Although voting for Republicans doesn't make me a racist, will continually supporting Trump make me one?".

commentBody: I can only hope that a clear majority of police officers, national guard and military personnel can see the true nature of what is happening in our nation, and that they know when to stop listening to Trump and members of his administration.

Trump ran away from his constituents and cowered inside a bunker — the very first time in US history that a president is afraid of his fellow citizens.

And when he saw on twitter that #bunkerboy is trending, he orchestrated a 20-second photo op — but not before  tear gassing and spraying with rubber bullets his constituents.

Yet another blatant display of Trump’s mental illness.
Finally, America is great again.
Fellow readers, do you think you'll ever be able to forgive Republican voters for what they've inflicted on us?

commentBody: Trump is incapable of anything resembling compassion, empathy or understanding.  He wants to be seen as a strong leader, but his idea of strength is to call in the military.  He has paid minimal lip service to the anger over the death of George Floyd, because he doesn't see systemic racism or police brutality.  He is the worst President for these difficult times because he doesn't listen and hears what he wants to hear.  The photo op yesterday was tone deaf.

Some out-of-control cop in Minneapolis wrongly kills an out-of-control perp and all of a sudden out-of-control renegades figure that its time to violently help themselves to some free stuff.

Pretty sick. 

Perhaps the virus issue has made US crazy.

commentBody:
"Biden Accuses Trump of 'Fanning the Flames of Hate' "

Here's where we're headed (you read it here first, months ago):
There's one solution to the disproportionate impact of the criminal justice system on Black and Brown folks. Take a cue from Obama's policy toward public schools. The number of suspects and arrests for crimes cannot exceed the proportions of the suspect's racial (need a special ethnic rule for the LatinX/Hispanic/Chicano ... etc) demographic group. The demographics would be from a nationwide level. For example, if suspect's racial demographic group makes up 15% of the US population and there are currently suspects from that demographic group either being investigated or under arrest for 15% of open cases for a type of crime then that suspect cannot be arrested or even investigated. This applies to murder, theft, driving with broken taillights, spitting on a sidewalk, you name it. The oppression ends there! This might present a challenge to database access but it can be solved. There are also questions about how wide of a geographical area should be considered but these are questions that can be worked out in the name of racial justice.

commentBody:
Gee GOP...

We never EVER suffered like this under Obama. 

He tried to create a health care plan for people...may not have been perfect, but it was to help people.

Are you happy now GOP?

Our beloved country is being destroyed by Trump, who's lifetime of grifting has reached it's pinnacle.

He will just walk away smiling when it's over.

Thank you for keeping him in office when you had the chance to get rid of him. 

This is on YOU.
There is SO MUCH anger in these comments :( Scary!
In Beverly Hills the curfew starts at 1:00PM.  That’s right, one hour after noon.

If the demonstrators peacefully gathered outside the White House gates were Trump supporters and white supremacists, Donald Trump would have walked out, shaken their hands and declared: "Isn't this GREAT? Isn't this HUGE? These great and honorable people are out supporting freedom in the United States and making America great again. I LOVE them! Aren't they HUGE?"

Since they do not agree with Donald Trump, he has ordered police and National Guard to forcible remove the peaceful protestors, called in the military, tweeted they should be shot, and again accused the news media of lying.

This is fascism. These are the actions of a fascist and racist president some people admire and support. This is NOT a president that Republicans and Democrats who value democracy support.

commentBody:
I remember the '64 uprising, The National Guard riding shotgun with law enforcement. America was on fire.

Johnson was President then; imagine if it were trump that was president then. It would be martial law and kent state all rolled up into one.

trump doesn't like black people. . .(e.g. his full page ad regarding the Central Park 5; lies about Obama's birth; Charlottesville [fine people on both sides]).

trump would like to see nothing more than to see a race war break out in order to consolidate power (his Reichstag moment).

Hey baby boomer . . nice legacy to leave the kids.
The NY Times does the World a disservice by lumping the peaceful protesters, the violent ones, and the looters together.

The cop that killed George Floyd should be prosecuted. Destroying America's streets and attacking random cops is at least foolish and all those who are part of this madness should be harshly prosecuted too.

President Trump says he is "sickened and revolted" by the killing of George Floyd.

Does anybody really believe that?  

Trump is only sickened and revolted by anybody criticizing him.

If you think he feels that way about  the death of a black man by police, well, I have a bridge in Brooklyn I'd like to sell you.

Joe Biden's speech earlier today should give people hope.  

The peaceful protesters should protest and be off the streets at curfew and come back tomorrow, and the next day, and the next day, and keep coming back until serious reform takes hold in Congress and in every police force in the country. 

The rioters and looters need to be arrested because these crimes lead to tragic deaths that are equally as unjust as the killings of minority men by police. 

Justice for all is what we're striving for and it starts with peace and order and then continued peaceful protests that lead to political pressure.

Paraphrasing VP Biden earlier... "it's been a tug of war in our country over 240 years and it's always a close battle that never ends but you keep moving towards a better union." 

If we see the US Military in our capital tonight and further violence and destruction, we as a nation are going in the wrong direction. A blatant division of the Union lead by our Commander and Chief.

In Santa Cruz California the town mayor and police chief are not wearing riot gear and do not see the protesters as adversaries. On the contrary, both men have been photographed taking a knee. 

This is what must happen. Police must side with the protesters, not oppose them. This is the right and honorable thing to do to push the cause of justice for all.

There are 38,000 officers in the NYPD and they were NOT deployed in sufficient numbers last night to stem the indiscriminate mayhem.  Cuomo says that tonight will be different.  Let's see.  The fact that DeBlasio got it wrong is nothing new to me, but the fact is that we must not allow a replay of last night to occur again tonight or ever again.

commentBody:
I remember a few years ago Mark Fuhrman, of OJ trial fame, commenting about a similar situation in Baltimore and Chicago. All the cops were vilified for the deeds of some evil very few.

What he said was that if the good policemen are not given our trust, they will just go, day after day, through the motions. They will go on patrol, but if there is a woman thrown to the ground and her purse snatched, they won't stop.

That seemed odd at the time, but in a few years you had hundreds more killed every year in those cities. I was reminded of his words looking at the looters getting in and out of Macy's, with police nearby.

After there is nothing left to loot, the targets will be New Yorkers who dare to venture through the city.

PS I taught in Paris during a sabbatical, in the 1990's. The government there is much more proactive than in NYC.

After the students threw cobblestones at shops in the 1970's, the Paris mayor got rid of students AND of cobblestones.

All the students were sent to the periphery, with the Sorbonne empty for decades, used only for ceremonies. And all the romantic cobblestones in Paris were replaced by asphalt.

When I was there, the Sorbonne was still empty, but students had come to Jussieu, in central Paris. That university was surrounded by a heavy iron fence, and a push of a button had fence come from the ground to close all the entrances.

These days, a few nice places got cobblestones back, and Sorbonne has students. But that can change any time.

Question: What was the point we stayed at home for now nearly 3 MONTHS and followed the law, while these "protesters" can basically do whatever they want and violate almost every possible rule in fighting this pandemic (deemed as one of the worst in nearly a century)?
Why does law have to be followed selectively in this nation?

commentBody:
This is an historic moment, A Time of Two Plagues; Covid-19 and Trump-45.  

So here we are again, having to relearn Reality's old guidance... the hard way.

"Do unto others as you would have them do unto you." 

"Whatsoever you do to the least of your neighbors 
is the Reality for which you shall answer, in joy or regret." 

The Covid-19  Pandemic with its immediate and consequential damages is revelatory. As that tiny, biologically fragile microbe has exposed the medical vulnerability of the human population, it has also revealed many instances of cultural and political incoherence that have disabled a unified, competent   
response. 

But even as the seats of power seem at a loss, I see the roots of recovery taking hold. I see acts of courage, compassion and kindness, often performed anonymously for the sake of strangers. For the growing greater good, it is also contagious.

In his flagrant illness, Trump is a necessary, cautionary symptom of a culture gone remiss in its obligations to one another. Now the conscience of a nation has been jarred awake by the murder of a man pinned beneath the knee of authority. As many thousands of good, grieving souls gather in protest, Trumps' witless, pathological response is painting him into a corner of no return.   
We will recover, we must recover. 
We owe it to our children.

Biden is in a corner.  He committed to select a vice president based on gender rather than ability.  Because of the protests, Biden must now choose a woman of color.  Nevada Sen. Catherine Cortez Mast, probably his best possibility, saw the writing on the wall and withdrew.  Susan Rice is too deep in Ukraine gate, Val Demings does not know anything, and no one knows her.  Joe is forced to choose extreme liberal Stacey Abrams.  Listening to Abrams can be frightening to a moderate.  We will see how this plays out.
If Trump gives the illegal order to deploy the military against American citizens, I wonder if military officers will follow Trump or the law.

Somehow the fact that Trump spoke with Putin a few minutes before giving his 'get tough' speech seems to be swept under the rug.  Might this indicate, at the very least, who Trump is taking his orders?  We now have a President that call dictators to get advise on how to handle a crisis.  This is no longer just strange but dangerous.
The mayor has one priority. Protect the people who live and work in New York.

Two of the greatest peacemakers in modern history, Mahatma Gandhi and Martin Luther King, owned no more than the shirts on their backs.  They marched and died in peace, stood on their religious beliefs and did not falter.  
 
Blessed are those who do not see yet believe. To those who believe in His name: who are born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
I appreciate the bravery and strength of the law enforcement officers protecting the law abiding innocent people against those who are looting, vandalizing and assaulting.
The government needs to start fearing the population again, as they should. They need to serve us.

I sympathize with those who protest George Floyd's murder but stores and property are being destroyed. The rule of law has broken down and Police are being targeted. Trump unfortunately is right. This situation needs to stop and to stop now! If it's not stopped America will be completely destroyed and Donald Trump will win reelection in a land slide. White Democratic liberal politicians must either end the madness or watch Donald Trump do it for them.

commentBody:
Everything Donald  Trump touch turn in to a mess.
 the biggest problem now is a lack of leadership. REPUBLICANS  will pay a dear price.
   WE are better than this. AMERICA will survive. peoples have to vote and politician (republicans and democrats) have to be held accountable.

The repetitious death of black people from the hands of police had been long neglected and we could see the consequences now.  The US government levels from top to bottom failed to prevent people exasperation and growing anger at the authorities.  In spite of very upsetting outcome of the horrible police abuse and tragic deaths we should not draw the extreme conclusions.  Our country has problems but the others have them too.  We are not a totalitarian regime like China where at people would not go to the streets but if they did they would be most likely killed by the government.  The europeans and others demonstrated against the US Police brutality; however, they did not demonstrate when the Chinese doctors got killed and bloggers criticizing Chinese government disappeared.  Will fix it in our democratic way.  But the culture of the Police in the US has to change and many senators and congressmen see it now.

So, the only winners we will have from all of this are those who stayed home.

This is gonna get real ugly, real fast.

commentBody: Did any protestors kneel on a cop’s neck for 8 minutes?  Did protestors get cops in felony prone positions and beat them with clubs?  How many protestors broke into cop’s houses and shot them while they were sleeping?  Until the media STOPS the false equivalency between looters and homicidal police officers, nothing will ever change.  And without change, America can never truly and finally be united.
Recall how Jesus had to call in the Roman spearman to cut a path for him through the angry citizenry so he could deliver his violent, vengeful message on the mount.

commentBody:
Please let us respect ourselves and others during this time and lead by example. Try turning off the news to focus on what's happening in front of you now. Challenge yourself to generate thoughts and opinions not based on overpoliticized rhetoric and hearsay.

New York City, the people and businesses large and small, are trying to recover from COVID-19. Looters going after businesses and sacred establishments and should be ashamed of themselves. Hitting a city that is already so down is new low. I join and support peaceful protesting. Please be mindful of social distancing and this current pandemic...COVID-19 did not go away. Please don't burn our city down.

Another link to the Bush regime; like Bush once called the military "Christian Soldiers" quite incorrectly as God said "Thou Shalt NOT Kill", Trump has deceived the nation with his appearance following his threat of military force, before the Church holding the Bible in a Blasphemous display of spiritual dishonesty implying he had the right to kill under God.
NYC needs National Guard troops--needed them days ago.  Time to restore order.
