commentBody:
The (peaceful) protests are not in response to a police officer killing one (1) innocent, restraint black individual, while joking, posturing and being looked on favorably by three of his colleagues. The protests are in response to the fact that, despite being filmed (all cops were aware of that fact) they believed to have a reasonable expectation that their clearly unlawful actions would not have any consequences for them. 
In other words, the protests are not in response to individual brutality against a black individual, but against systemic brutality against blacks as a whole.

The American era is coming to an end. It's carried the baton of world leadership for a century following on from Britain's century in the sun preceding that.
That's a reality nobody can alter, but it's a reality one man is expediting. Trump's next term in office will bury any lingering notion of dominance & will probably end in a major global confrontation somewhere across the globe as his ego & arrogance wont allow him to accept being at the helm when that end comes.
How many of us Times readers rolled our eyes at reports of stepped up gun buying when the covid crisis started? I did. How many of us are now wishing they had gone to the gun store themselves?

commentBody: Active military   large protests = Kent State on steroids.  Trump’s megalomania and authoritarianism are going to get a lot of people killed.

The thin veneer of civilization easily cracks in the US. With the current abomination in charge, the US regime has nothing to blame authoritarian thugs anywhere in the world. 

So far Trump and his acolytes managed to loot the US collective coffers of trillions to be paid by the coming generations, squandered US world influence and clout, divided the US more than ever in many decades, ruined small businesses and ordinary workers with an inadequate and downright foolish response to the ongoing pandemic, and now he eyes the chance to further fuel social and racial discontent and divisions with futile violence. 

There's only a small step from institutionalized racism and inequality in your legal and law enforcing systems to acceptance of full blown fascism with the ruling "elite" and their "soldiers" above the law for the "ordinary" people.

Wonder if the average US voter will choose a fascist dictator over a more difficult but much more competitive democracy? It is not given, because democracy comes at a price, namely mutual respect and equal rights, and not the least some ability to accepts physical facts and real productive economy.

I too am seriously considering voting for Biden but if the Democratic leadership in CA, NY, and other progressive states (like mine) can't stop this violence, I may have to vote for that loudmouth Trump.  I'm getting scared and so are my neighbors.  Stop pandering and pretending you are so nice, and actually BE nice to the 99% by stopping this violence NOW!  Cuomo do something!

commentBody:
"I won’t traffic in fear and division. I won’t fan the flames of hate. I will seek to heal the racial wounds that have long plagued this country — not use them for political gain.”  Joe Biden

Biden hit the nail on the head. Trump has polarized the country and is cruising for a racial war. A clear sign, (for those who can't bring themselves to believe it) is the symbolic imagery of him and the bible before a church he considers enemies of the white supremacists. With that picture he is attempting to rally those who are panicking before the images of destruction of American cities. He chose the Bible, to sacralize the spirit of WASP white power and instigate a racial war under the auspices of the Nazi National Alliance.  Too far out?  Not possible in America? Think again.

As many human beings irrespective of color, I am appalled at the recent events - Amy Cooper, Ahmed Aubrey, Breonna Taylor and now of course George Floyd. And this is all within the space of the last 2 months, with 3 of these horrific events happening within a period of ~1 week!

And no one WANTS the protests to turn violent. I am Indian... and so know all about non-violent Gandhian protests. But what has non-violent protests gotten the black community frankly? A token expansion of civil liberties ...but the fundamental rubric of American society continues to be steeped in deep racism. And white men and women have continued to weaponize their skin color against people of color - black mostly, but any shade of brown typically!

Coupled with the Covid crisis disproportionately affecting black communities, and a President who has nothing calming to say to an anguished population other than the threat of military force and shootings - I absolutely do not blame the crowds for going a little outta control. When a white man fights against establishment and discrimination, it gets labeled "fight for our fundamental rights" or the "freedom fight". When a black man does the same, we are quick to label these acts as "terrorism". 

We fought for freedom from the British because we didnt want to pay the exorbitant taxes imposed. What is wrong with black people fighting to literally save their lives and NOT be killed for simply living their life?

The cities that have had least damage are those where police have used absolutely minimum force.  Leave it to the eternal looser, Trump, to demand that we institute a "solution" that has already been proven to make the problem worse.  In the mean time Bannon sits pulling the strings saying "yes little puppet, give me my race war".
Oh man! We are winning so much. I am dying of all this winning. I CAN'T BREATHE.

Yes, American unity is dissolving.  It has been degrading for at least forty years.  And it is the fault of two political parties reaching to their extremes.  (Democrats to the left, Republicans to the right.)  There are several causes, such as mass immigration and the hollowing of the national economy, among others.  The United States of America was a nation of 226M+ in 1980.  Now 331M,  (With a flat-line birthrate, any way you want to compute it, it means a lot of new people.)  Do not be deluded,  There are two sides to this confrontation, and both have equal anger.  Greatest fear is that governmental authorities can not maintain law and order, and the opposing sides eventually reach confrontation.

Anyone who doubted or denies  the influence of Russia back in 2016 should watch the current 'Russia Today'  coverage of events unfolding in America.  The undiluted glee of their commentators as they describe the multiple crises across the country is unmistakeable.

The notion of "protest" has become so diluted with looting and violence as to become essentially imperceptible.  The failure of the urban mayors to take decisive action against the lawlessness speaks volumes relative to their agenda.  Rule of Law has become Rule of the Lawless in the big cities.  It's time to turn that tide.
As bad as this is (and it's VERY bad), this is just a taste of what the U.S. will be like in November if Trump loses and refuses to accept the results.

commentBody: If Trump uses US military force against US citizens it leaves fewer military personnel protecting us from Putin.

This always happens when you have a lot of young men without gainful employment. Colonel Mustard isn't being a good leader - fanning the flames - and resembles Adolf more and more every day. He used his playbook before the election and he's still using it.

I support the protestors. This flashpoint is about racism and police abuse, but is it so much bigger than that.

If we don't fix the social and economic disparities in this country, particularly for people of color, then addressing police abuse alone will not fix this.

You put enough economic pressure on human beings and they will eventually blow.
You put enough economic pressure on people they will disengage from the political system (that's what elites want).
But once they disengage they then need a voice-- protest and anarchy seem like good options at that point.

 Our economic institutions (The Treasury Department -run by Goldman Sachs, globalist corporations, hedge funds, investment banks ) have corrupted all of our political and cultural institutions with a market agenda and have negatively impacted all aspects of Americans' lives. Many Americans are made to feel less than human.

 Universal Health Care for all. A living wage for all. A chance of a life of dignity for all Americans instead of letting BANKSTERS  and corporatists corrupt all of our institutions and game the system directing ALL economic rewards solely for themselves

 The lower middle class police have way more in common with the protesters than the power structures who pay them barely more than a live-able wage to keep the disenfranchised in their place. 


The myth of meritocracy is a joke.  It's a crony capitalist, unequal society and the chickens are coming home to roost.

NY Times: "Protests have erupted in at least 140 cities across the United States in the days after George Floyd, a black man, died in police custody."

"Died in police custody"? Is it impossible to write what actually happen: "Brutally murdered by police" or at least "killed by police"? Don't use euphemisms to conceal what happened.

Jesus would have walked with the peaceful protesters yesterday in Washington DC.  Rubbers bullets and tear gas were shot into the gathering. For a photo op. With the good book being used as a weapon!

Folks, we are headed to a dark place very quickly.

commentBody: Look at the mayhem scene in DC; look very carefully. Of course many Americans will be outraged, particularly white educated and privileged Americans as if their inner whiteness is being violated. How can the police dare to shove me out of the way! But in fact what you are seeing in DC in that crowd being dispersed is just another form of white privilege. Huh? How can that be? Look carefully. Nobody getting hurt here. Tear gas on the ground but not fired at the crowd. Startling flash bangs, of course. Some shoving and tripping on scampering out the way, but look carefully as there is no police swinging batons at the protesters, mostly if not almost entirely white protesters. Look carefully. Isn't that a bit strange? At least that is what this clip NYT posted shows. Not sure this is the case in black neighborhoods by the way. Not sure police uses that much restraint in black neighborhoods. Show us what is is really outrageous NYT. Stop delving in white privilege, compounded with white self righteous outrage. That will never happen.
This is not Trump's city New Yorkers, it is yours, demand more from your mayor and governor. Your disdain is misplaced while your city burns.

Donald Trump's response to the turmoil and heartache of George Floyd's death is to shoo away protesters with smoke grenades so he can get photographed at a church holding a bible. 
That's his response? 

He responds to the voices of thousands wishing for justice with military helicopters threateningly poised over the throngs. 
That's his answer to racial iniquity? 

And he admonishes governors not to look like "jerks" and to "dominate" their pained populations. 
That's all he has to say?

Mr. Trump's cartoon vision of the world is dangerous to our country's well being. We've weathered years of his lies, his flippant and scabrous remarks and now we are in the middle of a pandemic, and suffering long overdue social unrest, and what does he do? 
Nothing but make matters worse. 

It's difficult remembering how good we had it before Mr. Trump arrived on the scene.
Police are out there causing violence and harming citizens.  They deserve what they get.  At this point we regard the police as out of control violent agents of the nazi Trump.

commentBody: A pseudoreligious, self righteous excuse to gas protesters.

It is taking a corrupt and inept president, a failed political party, a history of enslavement andracism and a global pandemic to bring our democracy to its knees.

Like the global fires brought on by human caused climate change, this conflagration is not going to be extinguished any time soon.

May our better angels ultimately prevail.

I just voted, in person.

I feel GREAT.


(PA Primary).

We must all be outraged that Trump, with seven deferments during Vietnam, Trump who when he saw protestors outside the White House went to HIDE in his bunker, Trump who had the DC police gas PEACEFUL protestors so he could WALK across the street to St. John’s church for a photo op....is now THREATENING American citizens with the Military! This is what Trump’s extremist supporters in the White Supremacy grupos want, they want a 2nd civil war! Trump is actually threatening Americans.....this is pure EVIL! 

 New York Times, YOUR headline from last night was an insult to America. DO better, New York Times!

I am a 61 year old white male anti-fascist.  I have not gone to observe or participate in local demonstrations largely due to Covid concerns.  At the risk of being pronounced a domestic terrorist, after seeing Trump’s despicable unhinged display of bizarro bible-posing cowardice yesterday, I am going out with a mask to join the demonstrations. 

#DominateThis

So now more people have been killed and injured and more businesses and property ruined in honor of George Floyd. Seems like the dumbest Memorial in the history of memorials. All this did was make everyone madder. Everyone already hated the murder of George Floyd, but now we hate the rioters too and the protesters who gave cover to criminals for days.

Trump is getting desperate. This is desperation over the natural reaction to his failed leadership. We'll watch five more months of his atrocious behavior. 

Tear gas for citizens so he could wave a bible at a church? How stupid can someone get.

“Hundreds of governors called me.”
        — Donald J. Trump
             June 1, 2020

As we only have 50 states, this is another blatant display of Trump’s mental illness.

No wonder he is the laughingstock of the world, from Macron to Putin.

commentBody: The two worlds of unrest - peaceful protesters making a valid point, thieves, thugs, idiots, anarchists, and criminals destroying probably most of the good efforts of the peaceful protestors. We need to assist the former and we need to incarcerate the latter.

Three reasons not to loot stores ...

1) You miss out on customer loyalty points

2) You cannot return the merchandise if it doesn't fit

3) You're being filmed by security cameras and news networks, you morons.

We may be on the verge of witnessing an American Tiananmen. Tom Cotton, among others, is calling for that to happen. Many Americans, at their core, are deeply reactionary and supportive of oligarchy and inequality. 

If an American Tiananmen does happen, I would like to see the governments of Japan, Germany, South Korea, and many other nations immediately demand the withdrawal of U.S. soldiers from their territory. If you wouldn't trust China to guarantee your nation's security and prosperity (and the governments of Japan and South Korea certainly wouldn't), why trust a United States that carries out a Tiananmen-style crackdown against its own citizens almost exactly 31 years after the original Tiananmen?
Maybe I'm missing them but where are the voices of prominent evangelicals in response to what Trump is saying and doing in relation to the murder of George Floyd?

I have a solution. Some wealthy protest supporters from New York can sell some of their property (with some discount due to riots). Convert it to cash and distribute proceeds (as a cash) among all who needs it. It should be easy to collect few billions, I think.

commentBody: Finally, Joe and the liberal establishment are arising to the moment. History will, has judged us. Awake and arise.

Interesting that the Philly/Biden article doesn't mention the non-stop looting and rioting since Saturday. Over 10 explosions last night alone as looters attempted to blow up ATMs (one person died). Gun stores are being broken into. Most pharmacies in the city have been completely gutted. Target in the suburbs was looted on live television at 3PM on Sunday.
Law and order President? You mean the grifter that ordered federal employees to ignore congressional subpoenas?

\\Washington’s mayor called the use of force “shameful,” and Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington said she was “outraged” that the president had gone to the church “after he threatened to basically rain down military force.”//

The Times neglects to mention that the minister of the church was on Fox News last night thanking the president for coming to the church and publicizing the attack on it.  He said he was "honored."  

You can always find a left-wing crank somewhere to attack the president, no matter what he does.

commentBody:
The protests are no longer "peaceful" if the crowd does not leave after three (yes three) warning messages, and it takes tear gas to get them to leave.  This is exactly what happened yesterday in front of St. John's in DC.  

Biden made clear that he has problems with Trump's appearance at St. John's where he held up a bible, but was very divisive in the process and made no effort to unify by speaking specifically to the many small business people who have been looted and the many citizens who have been violently beaten by these rioters.  

It is time to shut down all of these so called "peaceful" protests.

commentBody: After 7 days, this is not protesting Floyd.  The violence and looting are a reflection of the lack of care your government has for its people.  Spain implemented "guaranteed income," as a response to Covid 19, helping millions out of poverty; and we continue to have free healthcare.  The USA has 40 million unemployed and one citizen (Robert Dennis, a Centennial High School teacher,) received an $840,000 bill after being in intensive care for Covid 19; a community transmitted disease that almost cost him his life.

To all those that are looting, please stop it and start doing the hard work of something constructive so that George Floyd's death will not be in vain but instead be a catalyst to change this country and move it towards equality.  

To all those that are criticizing the looters, whose conduct is so obviously rooted in hopelessness and a belief that they have no chance in society as it is presently structured, what are you prepared to do to help change this country and move it towards equality?

Violence and criticism are cheap and easy; action, unending selfless effort towards improving everyone's life that does not give up even when it fails more than it succeeds, as it usually does, that is hard.

The first requirement of leadership is that you watch over the people in your care. That's what soldiers want from their officers. It's what families need from their fathers. It's what voters demand from their presidents.
Val DEMMINGS!! for president .

Obama described the protestors/rioters as “thugs” for looting and burning businesses in Baltimore when he was president.

commentBody:
Showing absolutely no concern for the underlying issues or causes of these protests, our *resident threatens to unleash the might of the US military to violently suppress free protests against police brutality ... I suppose the beatings will continue until morale improves?

Last night, a caravan of military helicopters flew over our neighborhood.  It was a truly unnerving experience, and I pray it was not an omen of more to come.

The shootings of police officers were inevitable.  And if these protests continue, I fear some nutcase civilians will show up with ARs and fire into crowds.  I think the Floyd family needs to ask the protesters to stop gathering after 7pm.  They also need to talk directly to BLM who can then reinforce that message with loud-speakers into the crowds.  That way, the riot element has no place to hide.  I honestly don't know what else can be done.  

Biden is "fanning the flames" with his speeches.  He is partly responsible for supporting legislation that got us where we are today.  

I read some of the comments in the NYT and WaPo from Dems.  They are anti-Trump and many don't seem to be bothered by the riots, saying they're justified to some degree.  That's easy for them to say while they're in the safety of their homes.  But wait for a couple of weeks, when this is over, and they go "downtown".  When they "see" for themselves the destruction and devastation, they should change their story.

Trump, the master of chaos, confusion and distraction, accomplished his goal; no, it is not the invocation of the 1807 Insurrection Act, or the bizarre display of a bible as a prop. If you listen to Trump’s call to the governors that preceded his reality tv performance you realize his mission to was thwart an Occuoy Wall Street long term protest across from the White House. His campaign messaging was set to target black voters with his championing justice reform, low unemployment rates and “what have the Democrats done for you?” The fact checkers could write columns of news print calling out Trump’s “misleading” claims...but the articles must be read,,,and we have been numbed into accepting that lying is just Trump being Trump.
But the constant presence of protestors camping out across from Trump’s sanctuary, covered incessantly on TV would be a refutation of the (un)reality Trump fabricates that Trump cannot lie his way out of. The referendum on Trump would be clear: who should we believe, Trump or our lying eyes?

This is like what happened with the Yellow Vests in France.  At first they were happy to have more people in the streets, more anger.  But as time went on, they realized that the looters and vandals were their enemies, handing conservatives a gift-wrapped pretext to dismiss their grievances: "These people are not on the streets because of taxes; they just want free iPhones and Nikes".  The people who really care about police brutality need to realize that the looters are their worst enemies.

Why are the police officers doing this for a presidential photo op?  Why are the police officers not questioning their authority and assignments?  Do police officers not value human life?  I am enraged and sadden.  My father is a veteran and I believed in America growing up. I now have little hope for the USA and doubt that our executive, legislative and judicial branch can uphold the American values and the constitution that I believed in. All 3 branches of government failed in the last 3 years and this is why we are here. As a healthcare worker, I'm appalled by our federal response to a pandemic, and now we have this response to a bit of looting and for a photo-op. Do we really value property over people? We now have 2 healthcare crises: 1) COVID19 and 2) trauma injuries from police using forces against protesters.
Me, I like presidents that don’t cower inside a bunker.

Soon I suspect the crazed vigilante right will join in for an opportunity to shoot at unarmed human targets, fulfilling their fantasy, turning this into a full blown civil war.  If covid doesn’t get you a daytime sniper round might while shop.

we the people of the United states, in Order...... and  the Whitehouse is using military force against you the people?
 There is something going wrong

The protests at this point go beyond the George Floyd death, and inequity in the criminal justice system. Socioeconomics are now at play here. This is what happens when people feel they have little to no opportunity, no hope, no future, nothing to strive towards, and when we have a Government that caters to the ultra wealthy and donor class. This is the inevitable result of inequality and crapping on working Americans for the past 30 years. People are angry and have been for a while.
Who is the person "George Flored" that Joe Biden makes the centerpoint of his address? He mentions him in the first 30 seconds of the speech.

commentBody:
Not being snarky. 

This is a plea to Barron Trump:

I ask that you would consider joining the marchers.

You will never regret it for the rest of your life.

You would see what it feels like to walk in another man's shoes.

If you disagree with him at the end of the march, that's OK too...you will have tried.

You  will say, later in life, I was there when people were so passionate about something.

No matter what "side" you're on, you may find it very enlightening.

Barron...please consider it. 

And know you would be welcomed if you decide to. 

It's amazing how participating in actions for change can make you feel, even if this time it's not change you totally agree with.

You would be embraced for showing courage to participate. 

Barron...you are young enough to still be open minded. 

And old enough to make your own decision to join.

It may be uncomfortable, but that is the real life of most people.


Please think about it. 

Join Us.

Respectfully, Ignatz.

commentBody: As of this writing Trump has been in office 3 years, 133 days, 22 hours, 6 minutes and 25 seconds.  During this time do you remember any moment where he has exhibited a sense of empathy, intelligence, wisdom, thoughtfulness or even a tad of humor?  Narcissism thrives, festers and grows showered with attention in any form.  That is what Trump wanted with his church walk.   He doesn’t care about the priest they tear gassed for his photo op nor the peaceful protestors they had to shove aside to do his stunt at St John’s.   Narcissism dies without light.  Let’s dim this light.   The more outrage we express the more he puffs up like the Baby Trump Balloon.   Let’s not only vote him out of office but turn our backs on his antics and howl with laughter.  Let’s focus on what’s important.  America. People. Helping each other.

It’s inspiring that people around the world are expressing solidarity with anti-fascism.  I assumed Trump and his allies would cause a war before the election to stay in power and it seems a short though they are.  Roger Cohen’s neighbor talked about ‘gunning up’ and I hope it doesn’t balloon into a full-on civil war.

This is no longer about George Floyd, justice for his murder and peaceful protests.  It's rioting and looting. As Trump hides in his bunker, bereft of leadership calling in the military, so do Cuomo & DeBlasio hide in their respective bunkers.  However, they've called in unicorns and fairies while innocents are attacked and killed, businesses pillaged and the cities burn about them.  They are all playing politics for and favorites their own gains. Each bereft of common sense in their own unique ways...

Biden: “I promise you this, I won’t traffic in fear and division. I won’t fan the flames of hate.”

Thank you, Joe. 

I know where I’ll be November 3, where will you protesters be? Are you even registered to vote?

commentBody: There are far more peaceful protestors, exercising their Constitutional duties and rights to Demand Better from their government, than the rioters and looters hell bent on instant gratification.  At a pivotal moment in this country's history, our so-called leader gasses innocent protestors so he can effect a photo op, uplifting the religious charade to new lows.  I don't recall "you must dominate" ever being uttered in the red-lettered Bible.  BTW, he just violated the First Amendment with that stunt!  But the show must go on, sang Pink Floyd.  And the memory of George Floyd pulses through our veins, just like Eric Garner, just like scores before them.  Wake up, America, while emotions are raw, or there won't be anything left of a country worth saving.  I have a dream by any means necessary.

Last night I cried for my dad's memory.

As a young boy in eastern Poland, my father witnessed the Soviet army march into his town in 1939.  Two years later, he witnessed the German army invade from the west.  Decades later he painfully recounted the show of brute force, mechanization, and intimidation both armies brought with them as they occupied the streets of Korets, Poland.   

My father came to the United States in 1951 seeking an escape from the totalitarianism and war that haunted him in his youth.  He loved this country and the opportunity to live without tryanny.  Dad cherished America's values of freedom, justice, and equality.

Last night I watched a line of mounted U.S. Park Police, shielded Military Police and National Guard marching on a crowd of peaceful protesters in front of the White House.  They were firing flash grenades, rubber bullets, and tear gas on the crowd.

Trump's volatile words followed by the actions of our military and law enforcement echoed my father's memories of 1939 and 1941.   It was horrifying to watch.

If we want to avoid the tyranny of the Soviet Union, the Nazis, the People's Republic of China we need to speak out now, organize, and vote in November.   

Finally, a question to our Secret Service, U.S. Park Service Police, Military Police, and local law enforcement personnel that participated in dispersing last night's protest in Washington, how do you justify your actions?  Just following orders isn't good enough.
The only thing missing from the Orange Bunker Baby's desecration of the  Bible  in Washington yesterday was to have waved a bottle of disinfectant in the air and claim it was  Holy Water.

Are the leaders of our cities discovering that commiserating "words" don't stop rioters and arsonists, but give them more room? 

They tried the emotional speeches and the "I feel your pain" empathy ... 

Now, those same responsible leaders have seen that they have to use curfews and the National Guard to protect the vast majority from a tiny group that has been given far too much space .... tragically so many will have their whole livelihoods destroyed by real hate and disregard for every law in human society. 

Any peaceful assembly is a Constitutional right ... looting is not a moral duty or right.

commentBody: Unfortunately a lot of the protesters are not peaceful and are looking for an excuse to act violently. Mobs of violent youth are doing nothing to help the victims of police violence and their families, and they're doing the opposite of making people sympathetic to the protesters. We need constructive dialogue and reparation to address injustice, and that can't happen with this senseless mayhem.

I would like to congratulate the New York Times for its all columns headline earlier today "Protesters Dispersed With Tear Gas So Trump Could Pose at Church." I wish I could have been in the room to hear the argument which I'm sure took place.

I have read the Times for decades, and it is not an exaggeration to say that things I have read in the Times have changed my life. In these last 3+ horrible years in the history of the United States, I have turned to the Times as one of  the most, if not the most reliable news source on our beleaguered planet. But recently I have found myself paying more attention to those commenters who blame our current situation on the Times's lopsided coverage of the 2016 election and who note that its columnists who now call out the so-called president daily did not do so when it mattered, before the election.

This morning, the Times finally made it as clear as the Liberty Bell that they stand on the side of our country and the Constitution by calling out the horror that the so-called president is happy to rain down on our citizens in order to have a photo taken of himself standing pathetically in front of the Church of the Presidents and holding a Bible, probably for the second time in his life, in hopes of being re-elected to a job that he never wanted and can't do. 

Welcome to the fight.

On April 15 I wrote a reaction to the article Trump Has A Gut Feeling etc. I wondered what arguments Trump's supporters could have at the time. There were almost 60 responses to my contribution, thank you! The reactions were clear and not so strange. We are now almost 2 months further and America is on fire. Yesterday was a big meeting in Amsterdam, Netherlands despite the covid restrictions for Black Lives Matters. Today it is the talk of the day because the mayor (Halsema) did not ban the demonstration when the covid rules were broken: right to demonstration. If the United States is not to let its own view of its own country be too embarrassing, it is enough to remind the country regularly in the coming months to November of everything that has happened since Covid and what role the president played as the people's leader has an impact on the developments and the impact on the economy and the happiness of the American people.

Active duty military and federal law enforcement personnel using tear gas, flash grenades and rubber bullets against peaceful protesters, exercising their first amendment rights, should shake all Americans out of the deep sleep of the  past fifty years.  This should alarm everyone, including those Americans exercising their constitutional right to "keep and bear to Arms".  It is not much of a leap to move from flash grenades and rubber bullets to live ammunition.  

We would like to believe that the military would not obey an order to open fire on peaceful American citizens exercising their constitutional right to "assemble peacefully and petition their government".  After watching the Monday  assault on peaceful protesters across from White House, that fundamental assumption have to be revisited.

Often those who are willing to excuse systemic police brutality as "a few bad eggs" in an otherwise good institution are the first to lump looters (of which there are few) with peaceful protestors (of which there are many). Nobody is here to excuse looting, and no one should excuse blatant examples of police brutality either.

Perhaps worth sharing that I rode 30 miles in Brooklyn on Sunday and did not witness a single broken window or burnt out car. Conversely, there were more police officers, some in unmarked vehicles and uniforms, in a community park in Queens this morning than there were civilians.

But they aren't.

They are playing politics.

They are reveling in the timely and unanticipated appearance of civil disorder so close to the elections, and will let it go on right up to November.

commentBody:
Curfews might seem like a solution, but even if they are, it does not mean we should reflexively support them.

It is obvious the vast majority of Americans are not on the streets protesting, and it is also true  the vast majority of those protesting are doing so peacefully, but yet, their right is being curtailed because of a tiny minority.  One possible outcome, and I hope it does not happen, is that some in  the peaceful  majority might be pushed to join the criminal minority.

But we are at this juncture because there has been a narrative creating the impression that police misconduct resulting in deaths is widespread, and if the misconduct involves a white police officer and a black victim, then the reason must be because of race.

Those who did not push back on that narrative, because of some narrow interest, are now reaping the fruits of their indifference or tacit support. Now, there is an emerging narrative in some quarters that is painting the protesters with one broad, criminal brush.

The lesson for all of us is that we should stand up for  the standards of fairness, equality and objectivity, even when doing so goes against some narrow and personal interests.
If you can loot in person you can vote in person.
The riots have propelled Trump to victory in November, and a mandate for his second term. Any Politician that sided with the protesters will be ousted by White voters.

Then the police fired a few gas pellets and they moved..I don't see the big deal. ..If Biden wanted to speak, he would need protesters moved too if they refused to move...If they were peaceful, they would have moved..Then moved back after the President spoke. They choose to fight to stay close, rather than protest further back...Perhaps the President is wrong and the Cities and Governors have these riots under control as best they can. Perhaps the looting and burning can't be stopped by more police and national guard...Trump thinks more police presence will slow down looting and burning...Most here don't agree with that.\n.Yet most Governors are actually doing what Trump says and using the National Guard to add more force anyway..The issue is, should more force be used to stop the looting and burning?? I agree with Trump and the Governors that are using more force and protecting people and property from criminal looting...Though most commenters here disagree.", 'createDate': '1591111360', 'updateDate': '1591120405', 'approveDate': '1591112958', 'recommendations': 3, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107380962, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'MN Mom', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107382195', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107382175, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107382175, 'userID': 58439161, 'userDisplayName': 'James', 'userLocation': 'Georgia', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': "I'm pretty sure it was entirely due to his desire to not be seen as cowering in the bunker. commentBody: With all that “shock and awe” fire power and protection of Army Black Hawk helicopters, armed police on horseback, legions of police in riot gear carrying tear gas and concussion grenades, the secret service that surround him, the United States Military on call and very likely drones armed with hellfire missiles circling above, rather than strolling to the church and back you would think Trump would have learned from watching police in other cities that the mere act of kneeling on the ground as a gesture to acknowledge the pain and injustice suffered by African Americans is a powerful means to defuse the anger of and possible danger from protesters. The unwillingness to learn from others, reflect, consider options and lack of flexibility are some of Trump’s major flaws which is why he lacks the capacity to be a leader and unsuitable as a head of state.

I’m recalling how many times I wrote comments here over the past three years decrying the rise of fascism in our country only to have the Times moderators reject them for posting. But what we’re seeing, once again and more plainly with each passing hour, is a fascist authoritarian regime in power in the White House and looking to expand that power relentlessly. 

The real rioter is in the White House. He’s set fire to the Constitution and he and his henchmen in the GOP are looting the Treasury by the hundreds of billions. 

Get in the streets, and stay in the streets, everyone, until America is a democracy again.

commentBody: Everyone who is blacking out their social media accounts, this is just performative. Social media is better used to display images of what is going on in society and create awareness. Black Out Tuesday, as I understand it, was devised as protests for black artists being exploited by record labels and saying we are hitting the pause button on content. How does it help here? Everytime I see some young person black out their social media, I think this person is deluded into think they've done something useful today.

I understand the importance of protesting the torture and murder of a black man in police custody.

But 8 year old Thomas Valva was tortured and murdered by his father just a few months ago. After months of abuse and torture!

I wonder why there are never any protests about the children who die of abuse every day. Isn't this important too? Doesn't this make you angry?

The "peaceful protesters" must organize and separate themselves from the looters and other thugs (yeah, that's what they are). Perhaps organize marches on streets with fewer businesses? I don't know. Anybody have a better idea? Look, not since King (Martin, not Rodney) has so much of the country decided that, yes, let's work to change the racist culture in America. But that won't last until the the real windows stop getting smashed by the thugs.

Party's over - America's inner authoritarian has emerged, even within the "liberal" media. All the focus is on the looting, despite the fact that the overwhelming majority of the protests have been peaceful...that is, until the police attack. That's another thing the media isn't showing - they need to focus on looting, after all! - but the violence is almost exclusively started by the police.

It's all looting and antifa supersoldiers all the time, so white America is going into its typical authoritarian stance - the one where property damage is prioritized over the continuing murder of black men by tyrannical police forces.

I encourage others to look out for foreign media sources, to see how these protests are covered overseas - despite the fact that American media are literally being shot at by American police, the US press is still reticent to call a spade a spade when it comes to violence by American police. Foreign news organizations do not have such Stockhold Syndrome and are unafraid to call out the tyrannical brutality at the hands of American police.
Arlington police assisting DC park police were ordered to leave immediately. Good news! These Arlington police are professional and good guys, they should not be involved into this dirty mission!

There is something that can be done to relieve the catastrophe of a violent death and a national violent reaction. It is long past time for the federal government to take a role in restraining the police unions' power to ignore illegal, unprofessional, even biased, attitudes and actions. Citizens must no longer just shake their heads and tacitly accept this totally unacceptable behavior.
Police, armed as for war, are a constantly threatening presence, especially for the black community. Should the police shoot (in the back) a person guilty of minor theft, for example and maim or kill him? Should a citizen and his son, seeing a black jogger , get out their weapons and shoot him as he jogs, killing him? How long will we citizens tolerate this?
     There was a time when police carried "billy sticks", not weapons. No suspect was killed, the streets were safe. Was it the NRA who started all this militaristic response? I understand our Defense Department offers excess weaponry, (even tanks!)  to local police departments who can accept or say no thank you.
   Our current leaders are incapable of understanding the centuries of police brutality against the black  community that America has chosen to ignore. There is no justice for all. We must change.

Why didn't these get solved during the great Obama years?  He had 8 of them.

We have been democratic for years in Chicago.  Look at all the blacks dying here.  The world is so sad.

I'm an independent.  I voted for Obama hoping for change and he brought none.  Now we have Trump who kept the economy growing and created better deals for the US and all you people want to do is trash him.  Did you ever give him a chance?

commentBody:
So, if I understand the recorded details correctly, the average training time for a member of the police in the USA is 19 weeks.
Obviously this does not cover the elite units like FBI etc.

However, if that really is the case, then there is no reason to look any further for the problems you have in policing.

19 weeks would not get you past the first hurdle in the UK, Germany, France etc.

A few minutes ago I reviewed the Beatitudes from the Sermon on the Mount. I also read the (admittedly corny) Max Erhmann poem Desiderata.  I know I need to do better, maybe the current series of crises can help me remember to try harder.

Ok, this may be a beyond-naive comment when it comes to strategy with (just) the looters, but if they go into a place like Macy's or any store in mass, they have to get OUT of Macy's and/or walk up or down the avenue. So, a line of people/resistance at points of exit?
You say, online: "... as people faced off with the police for the seventh straight night since GEORGE FLOYD DIED." He didn't "die" he was killed. Good journalism demands naming events with accuracy.
As I said when he botched the pandemic response, Donald Trump needs to resign. He can’t lead and we need a leader.

The Times is failing in this moment. Trump has declared war on the first amendment--indeed, on American life itself. 

I implore you--tell the truth--please--rise to the enormity of the challenge of this time. Tell the truth about the rising tide of white nationalism in the power structure of the government at all levels. Demand on-the-record statements from "anonymous" white house officials. 

Help us!

Many public policy issues are just classroom management problems writ large.  An out-of-control classroom always starts with one or two kids being disruptive.  If you don’t deal with them firmly, a few others feel emboldened and the original malefactors get even wilder.  Stronger measures are required at this point.  If none are forthcoming, most of the other kids start acting up too, leaving a frustrated core of “good” kids who really want to learn but can’t because of the chaos.  Only serious punishment will work once the situation has gotten to that point.

Moral:  wild behavior is contagious, particularly to the young, because it is fun.  The longer you let it go on, the harsher the measures needed to stop it.  Leniency doesn’t work in a classroom and it won’t work here.

There could be no more ineffective, inflammatory response than Trump’s. GOP leaders seem restless. The GOP has an opportunity to actually help make things better and calm things down. Throw Trump under the bus. Reject his hate, racism, and the divisions he is creating. He is fanning the flames. Call him out for it. You made a deal with the devil. But he has given you a loophole to escape. America will appreciate it. All you have to do is stand up to him and acknowledge the truth.

Jesus would never have behaved in such a way. Anyone on the right or left or middle that calls themselves a Christian and still supports what Mr. Trump did are people I would call armchair Christian's. This is not what the Bible teaches us. Today and all the days going forward should not be about President Trump. It should be about George Floyd and all those before him. 

Senator Cornyn, Ted Cruz, Lindsey Graham, Michael McCaul, Mitch McConnell now is the time to prove you care about America and ALL her people. What Trump did was appalling. Do each of you also want a civil war. Get out of your Ivory Towers and start doing some about the racism in this country. I challenge you to step up and start speaking out for those peaceful protestors. It is what Jesus would have done. He would not have stood and had his picture taken and pretended to be a a Christian. What are you going to do?

commentBody:
Suggestion: Instead of sending in troops; send in food, diapers, medicine, home necessities, clothing, rent/mortgage help, caregivers, and substantial financial support. In the long run, you might save people, their homes and cities.
Do good.

commentBody: So surreal listening to an inauguration speech in June before the election in November. As I noted previously, Biden should own the last four paragraphs of President Kennedy's speech in Amherst in 1963. It's all there. A hopeful agenda, message, a guiding spirit for healing and national reconciliation.
Sheesh. Everything went south so fast. I can't even focus on work right now.

After all the sacrifices made by medical personnel, first responders, business owners, essential workers of all ages and races,  and regular people who have been sheltering in place for months, to deal with and protect themselves from  COVID-19, these vandals, and thieves who have hijacked a memorial movement most likely will set back much of the progress in containing the disease. This is a dark time when the forces of entropy seem to be on the ascent led by a president who draws his perverted strength from chaos,disease, anger, and ddespair.

commentBody:
The NYTimes needs to do a service to its readers by putting up a big box with the Curfew Times during this … no idea what to call it.

Eight PM   -- the sun does not set until 8:22.  

This is obviously in reaction to looting at Rock Center and Macy's and other yesterday -- altho this took place in daylight hours.

How does the curfew affect  people who want to walk by the river at sunset.  

Looting is not a great thing-- but the stock market's back the S&P 500 just 10% below it's all time high.  (The rich are getting richer; the poor are losing their jobs- all's right in the world!!)  We still can't afford single payer universal healthcare and the FED is still buying corp bonds via BlackRock.) 

Unfortunately, police violence will not end.. And guess what all women (not just black), all over the world  are "in danger" of abuse.   (Not sure encouraging blacks to think that every white is privileged is useful... I know black men with white mothers!)  The black-white version is a diversion and keeps the vast part of the public from demanding what might be considered a basic right in a very wealthy country-- low cost or free healthcare, social benefits.

I am from Europe and used to work for an American multinational till the mid 90ies.
I cannot help wondering who of my ex colleagues are still supporting this "Central Park Five" president.
I have to admit it is a very disturbing thought, very disturbing indeed.

commentBody: I am seeing so many acts of police brutality on social media and the Internet. Innumerable videos and accounts. Yet the NYT keeps on putting the assault on police first and foremost in its reporting. I am not sure I have ever been so disappointed in this publication. The peaceful protests shoved to the ground, dragged, tear gassed, punched and kicked while on the ground, beat with batons, etc. are nowhere to be seen or described except in the vaguest terms and are brushed off by this article. Is it any wonder people are furious? The NYT should do a more thorough investigation and honest reporting of what is happening on the ground, than this bird's eye view, "we hear from our police contacts that the police are hurt" reporting.

commentBody: After decades of vandalizing other people's neighborhoods in places like Iraq and Afghanistan Americans have now turned our own neighborhoods into war zones.  In one sense, Trump has not started any 'major' conflagrations in the international theater. But he has managed to turn all the anger and hate in his soul and the souls of his followers and those who despise him into a civil war directed against ourselves and our neighbors. Where would we be today if Trump were not the choice of the Electoral College???

Trump has denigrated (with continued self-congratulation and immeasurable bluster) not only the office of the Presidency, but the rule of law, the right of Americans to protest peacefully, and now the Bible.  And we still have a long way to go!
I can't go to church, but the President can usurp the military and police to have people beaten and gassed so he can hold a Bible?

My support and thoughts are with the protesters who are standing up for justice and against injustice.  And Trump stages a virtual reality show by going to a church across the street so he can look like a christian - who are we kidding here.

I have been horrified by the use of rubber bullets on peaceful protesters.  Where are our leaders.  Oh, I forgot, we have none!

We have a right to peacefully protest and George Floyd's death at the hands of a policeman is a valid reason.  But it has been evident for several days that the protesters are serving as a shield for rioters and looters who are turning the message of justice for all on its head.  Like most bullies, the rioters are cowards who use the hours of darkness for cover.  They hide behind the front line of nonviolent protesters and throw bottles and bricks over their heads at the police and then scurry away.  If the police try to give chase, they have to go through that front line and appear to be aggressively attacking them.  Thus shielded, the mob feels free to smash, burn, steal and beat up anyone brave and foolish enough to try to stop them.  
Those who want to peacefully protest should know this isn't about their message anymore.  They now serve only those who are bent on destroying our cities and creating disorder in our society.  It's time for the real protesters to stay home.  If they do, if they remove themselves as cover, the rioters will suddenly feel vulnerable and will dissipate.  If it stops now, there may still be a chance for the country to heal.  If it continues, race relations and notions of social justice will be further damaged for another generation.  When cooler heads finally prevail, come back out and protest again.

commentBody:
Yesterday Trump ordered the military to attack peaceful protesters on TV, so that he could TERRORIZE We the People (across the country), by proving he could get away with replacing peaceful Citizens in DC with his violent allies.

The definition of TERRORISM is using violence to change the political and economic behavior of groups of people. (The concentration on international terrorists, while Right-Wing Domestic Terrorists kill more Americans than foreigners, is just propaganda; more twisting of definitions by the Right, accepted without challenge by 'centrists.')

Derek Chauvin didn't just torture and Murder a man. He knew that he was being video taped as he nonchalantly (with his hand in his pocket, showing he had NO FEAR) and slowly suffocated a human in broad daylight in full view of his community and the nation.
Derek Chauvin was TERRORIZING We the People, using brutal violence to cause fear in Our hearts, to change the political and economic behavior of U.S. Citizens.

If we do not use the actual definitions of words to understand what is happening, then Republicans can use their definitions to make us believe lies. (btw, Elizabeth Warren doesn't let them get away with it.)

Donald Trump used the United States Military to TERRORIZE We the People on a split screen on CNN. While he threatened to illegally invoke the Insurrection Act (unused for 200 years), against peaceful protesters (with looters as an excuse) TRUMP ORDERED THE MILITARY TO ATTACK PEACEFUL CITIZENS!

Me thinks that the protests are now taking a life of their own— they are a combination of legitimate backlash against police brutality, economic stagnation and despair, political frustration, and revolt against the quarantine. 

It’s a toxic brew, further intensified by polarization, and not addressed in a holistic way by the government (at all levels). 

It is all emotional, and unfortunately humans are not known to be rational...
This is worse than W's Mission Accomplished photo-op. That one was just malodorous, this is nauseating.

A former Real President, in a profound display of great empathy and love, beautifully chooses to sing the comforting words of “Amazing Grace” in the charged aftermath of a racist slaughter occurring in an historic southern black church by a white supremacist while the present Fake President, one week following the shocking public murder of a shackled black man by a criminal cabal of racist police, chooses to unconstitutionally abuse state power to violently interrupt a peaceful protest to afford him the opportunity to defiantly posture in front of an iconic Washington church while ignorantly brandishing the Bible of peace and understanding as a “law and order” prop. What have we become?

commentBody: It’s not just that Trump had the crowd gassed, but notice how the story references his advisors and family who advocated and apparently supported this stunt. Realize that the President is surrounded by people who encourage and validate his actions. Realize that danger. The cynical amongst us posed the rhetorical question - will he make it through four years, in those first few months if his presidency. The better question should’ve been will this country make it through his first four years? We are limping to the finish line with festering physical and psychological diseases. We will start his second term in a weakened position that portends for a very scary future and yet I have no great illusion that we collectively unite to dispel this vermin from our government in November. Prove me wrong America.

It's nothing new to be embarrassed by our state legislators in SC, and we've had more than our fair share of opportunistic, tone deaf Governors, our clueless 'Luv Guv', Nikki Haley's ongoing weathervane partisanship and lately McMaster the Doofus.
  
  His servile allegiance yesterday to the President was a betrayal of his own state, but no less than this President betraying his oath of office.
 Firing tear gas, using strongarm tactics to disperse peaceful protestors hours before the curfew in Charleston, SC was one jump ahead of Trump who shouted out orders to Governors to violently subdue and 'jail for a long time' any protestors to avoid looking ' like jerks'.  
The optics are the end that justifies the means. Our President is again showing his affinity for tyrants/despots with an sickening eagerness to apply the tactics he's long espoused. 

   Who else would use violence to disperse peaceful citizens to enable him a rare walk outside the WH to use a nearby church as a photo op using the bible to instill his might as God given right?

 I am sure he turned down those who warned him this would not imply his desire to be seen as a tough guy, and the blatant pandering, using a church, the holy bible as props would be seen as blasphemy.
  
  Hopefully those on the fence will join Americans appalled that the office of President has become a Constitutional blasphemy, and exert their loyalty to their country by choosing someone worthy in that honor.

As a white citizen of the United States I recoiled with  horror watching the cruel and pitiless murder inflicted on an innocent black man by police. They didn't seem to mind being filmed while committing murder, doubtless because they felt so insulated and protected by this so called "law and order" president.  I am forced to conclude that we are living under system of apartheid here in America much as the South Africans did. After watching Trump use tear gas and rubber bullets for a photo op while simultaneously threatening to call out the U.S. military it is abundantly clear that America is no longer a democracy.  How humiliating and poignant that Egyptians see so many similarities between the George Floyd protests and their own ill fated Arab Spring.  Many lines are being broken right now as Trump is urging the police and military to use deadly force against peaceful protesters.  Once those genies are let out of the bottle it will be impossible to put them back in.  As the American dream is savagely burned to the ground by the Greedy Old Plutocrats they sit smiling and sipping their mint juleps without a word of protest.  Not even a peep.  We've seen it coming for awhile. Now it's finally here. The GOP are inciting a coup to forcefully take over the USA and remake it in their image. The only question now is whether the cops and military will go along with it.  I'll vote for Biden but I've frankly given up waiting for the Democrats to save us, or do much of anything else.

commentBody: Authorization minded people in power never leave office without a fight. The orange liar and thief is mobilizing his henchmen to safeguard his status.
Still showing reverence to this abomination: trump did not "visit the church."  He desecrated it.
Unfortunately protests in this country have always provided cover for the looters and other criminals in our society.

Trump has once again succeeded in making a national movement all about him. The malignant narcissist rides anew. Watch in the days to come as he signals to his base with flexes of power. Watch how he manipulates his TV audience. Remember, the people in the streets--us--are nothing but objects. It's OK if we are hurt. All that matters is his ego and the win. Of course, his supporters have no functioning consciences either, so expect them to support the naked emperor. Expect more chaos. Expect more trauma unless we turn away from him. He needs to be removed from office--25th or the vote--so we can move on to healing and rebuilding.
Now is the time for Joe Biden to step up, go into the crowds, talk to people, and establish himself as the diametric opposite of the cretin now occupying the White House.

commentBody:
Yesterday's attack on peaceful protesters was disturbing on so many levels:

- The Russian-backed president threatening to use US military forces to quell the protests while...  

- The police shoot tear gas, rubber bullets and charge violently at peaceful protesters so...

- The weak little man pretending to be president can lead an entourage of lackeys (including Ivanka and Jared) to St.Joseph's church, a nationally revered house of worship so...

- He could have a photo op holding up "a" bible - not his bible, mind you, desecrating the sanctity of the bible.

- And just 30 days ago, an armed protestors stormed the Michigan state capitol to oppose a governor's order intended to protect the general public from a deadly virus.

Step back a moment and suddenly this moment in history looks remarkably like many moments between 1928 - 32 during the rise of the Fascists and the Nazis.

It is time to discard the pretense.  

Every day that the Republican party and its illegitimate president remain in power is another day when the United States falls further and further toward Fascist rule.

Totally shameful to what level Trump has sunk the US: tear gas against peaceful protesters, arresting journalists without any enemy in sight. If this is not a wake-up call for voters who believe in democracy, then what is?

Trump inflicted violence on peaceful protestors in order to preen uninvited in front of one of Washington D.C.'s most iconic churches. 

Keep rising up, people. 
Take our power back from this vain renegade posturer.

The NYT jumped into action to join the national media hysteria to ‘Stop Sanders’ when he was sweeping in the Primaries. This very paper, which positions itself as caring about peace and progress, used its great power and weight to put down Sanders supporters’ push for representative democracy. Let’s be clear. They told us all to go to hell. And here we are.

People think that this is as low as he can go?  Folks, there is no bottom to the depths that this selfish and evil man who calls himself Donald J. Trump, who signs his signature in thick black magic marker, can sink into the muck.  And before we forget let's be sure to add that the same goes for anyone who supports him.  YOU support him and YOU are complicit in the filth.  

As to the looters who have nothing to do with the reasonable and understandable protests after the murder of Mr. Floyd, there is NO link between them.  CHANGE in the wake of the Floyd murder.  NO MERCY for the looters.

The NYT jumped into action to join the national media hysteria to ‘Stop Sanders’ when he was sweeping in the Primaries. This very paper, which positions itself as caring about peace and progress, used its great power and weight to put down Sanders supporters push for representative democracy. Let’s just be clear about this. They told us all to go to hell. And here we are.
Is Trump declaring War on Americans?  Does he really intend to shoot people on Fifth Avenue?

commentBody: Americans love to see this stuff in Hong Kong or Cairo. Here it’s more like” “Protest the right way. You know, the way that doesn’t change anything, but the cops get to take your picture and track you. Either that, or we send in the tanks.”

Is there a powerful nation with a powerful military that can save America and help impose a regime change - back to a democracy again - just as America has done globally for years? We are desperate for a regime change about now given that the elections are now so corrupted under the thumb of an autocratic party and a militaristic strong-con-man.
NY is burning.   Back to the gritty NY of the 70s .  Sometimes you get what you want.

As a Canadian I am surprised to read that it seems  innappropriate to break down a gathering after a curfew. 
Is there still a rule of law in the U.S. ? Or the purpose makes the law , including  not respecting curfews ,looting , burning  , firing on the police etc. 
The purpose doesn't justify that .
Violence and violating laws doesn't solve it or anything else.

commentBody: Of course there was more rioting in NY last night.  When you set a curfew beginning at 11PM what do you expect.  By then it is already dark, the gang has been on the street and semi-organized for hours.  Curfew has got to be dusk to dawn or forget it.  Another case of authorities not on the street themselves, mismanaging a crisis.

The peaceful protests over the deaths of George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbey, and the many that came before them speak of the need for action to end our country's racial oppression and improper use of force.  As Coumo and Obama have stressed these protests need to transform into organizing a voter registration movement with the ultimate goal to bring out the vote in November to effectuate the needed change in leadership in our country.  Violence, looting and vandalism is not the answer here.   All those protesters should make gut check for themselves before going out on the streets.  Are they registered to vote in order to make real change?  Do they promise to turn out to vote on November 3, 2020.  That is the important date to participate in the peaceful revolution that is democracy in action.  When the power of the people truly speaks.

All these tech-savvy kids:
I would have thought that they would know by now that there are better ways to protest in 2020 than to go out into the street. 

Looting and burning cities are really not the way to get the job done.  

Marching and screaming with banners make for good pictures but are ineffectual.

The good news is our politicians on the right & the left understand the power of the mighty dollar.  Raise money and start buying up the politicians (they are for sale) and you'll see change!

Apparently in Pittsburgh the burning and looting were linked to a white person dressed in black. See https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/protests-white-instigators/2020/06/01/b916bd98-a426-11ea-bb20-ebf0921f3bbd_story.html?utm_campaign=wp_politics_am&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&wpisrc=nl_politics What's the difference between the Trump "administration" and a Mob protection racket? At least the latter didn't wave a bible in a photo-op. (However, a friend of mine overseas sent me a photo of Hitler doing the same ca. 1933.)

commentBody: Whenever I mention the president’s father’s ties to the Klan (I believe your newspaper reported the arrest), the comment is censored. I’ll keep saying it, nevertheless. The divider-in-chief, raised on documented racism, cannot—and does not want to—unite the country. He would rather bring about civil war than to calm the populace. We’re in his head now. This is what a refusal to call out his mendacity has wrought. The NYT used an old playbook: repeat what he said. As a result, you have been, democracy has been, played. You changed course, as a giant ship might (slowly, clunkily) and it’s too late. May there be a country left by November.
Putin is laughing so hard right now.

commentBody: Looters successfully negating all the efforts of other protesting people who are making desperate attempts to hopefully nudge the society in the direction they genuinely believe in.

When Trump got elected, many people spoke the empty reassurance: "how bad can he be?" A persistent concern, however, was how this volatile, egotistical man would respond in the event of an unexpected emergency or tragedy. We've seen plenty of emergencies and tragedies during this administration, and all those fears have been proven many times over. How bad can he be? Worse than we could have even imagined.

commentBody:
So, for all of us who can't get out into the streets...

I suggest we burn up the phone lines and blow up the websites of all of our elected officials and demand responsibility and reform...now. 

The poor, the disenfranchised, young people who have been lied to about our reality and their prospects for the future, those left behind in 2008, and most of all black Americans who have been ignored and dehumanized for more that 200 years...

...yea, people are very angry. God bless them for getting out there to do our dirty work.

The work we've been unwilling to do the last 3 years while the Trump administration normalizes dysfunctional, damaging and destruction words and actions...every day.

Our dirty work since the birth of this nation when we enslaved and dehumanized a race of people...willing ourselves to believe - and that's the key word here, believe -  they were some how, some way...lesser human beings than you and I.

Shame on us. Time to speak up, stand up, man-up...and take responsibility for our nation. If we wait any longer our right to protest will be stripped from us by the President, branding us "domestic terrorists."

The chaos is unfolding...only we the people can stop it.

Trump must be made to go to a black church.  Everyone at the NYT, everyone who reads it, should demand as much.  It should become a regular question asked at every presser, without let up.  Let’s call his evangelical bluff.

Wake up all you educated voters!  Trump isn’t just “ losing it” , he never had any mental competence. The White House lights were turned off;the prez hid in the safe bunker with armed guards at the door; peaceful protesters were barraged with rubber bullets and tear gas; Trump held an unopened Bible while posing in front of a boarded church.....Is this anyone you want to lead this country?? Not me.

Our country was not founded on peaceful protest.  It was founded on violent revolution.
Now we have people who claim to be “patriots” whining about broken windows and stolen cheesecake and ignoring abuse of power and injustice and state-sanctioned murder.
We are a decadent country in the last throes of our republic.

I am outraged by this coverage. Officers have killed, maimed, and assaulted countless protestors and innocent bystanders. "They fired tear gas" trivializes what actually occurred, as they assaulted peaceful citizens occupying a public space, all within their legal rights. And the portrayal here of officers being targeted, without context is equally offensive. The police have continued to commit atrocities across the nation, while the nation protests previous atrocities.  Sure, it sucks to be a good cop right now, but still not as much as it sucks to be a black man walking down any street in this country.

Trump's speech at the Rose Garden, the police fired rubber bullets and gassed the peaceful protesters to clear the way for this " Petulant Child " to have a photo op in front of St. Johns Church.

The message is, " I want to keep this Apartheid System intact ".

Give the peaceful protesters Justice by establishing a national demilitarization and retraining commission over all local police with the authority to disband corrupt organizations and terminate any corrupt officers. make the local police meet standards to protect and serve, not to threaten and kill. Then, with the peaceful protesters gone, so will be the agitators who needed them for cover.

Aside from the obscenity of gassing peaceful protesters, the clueless pose of Trump awkwardly holding a bible - clearly an act he has little or no experience with - underlined the hypocrisy of the GOP's fake-religion posturing, and the willingness of evangelicals to accept these empty gestures to keep the punters donating to the church. Absolutely revolting.

Nobody sinks to the occasion like Donald Trump.

The 63 million people who voted for this Presidential charade and charlatan need to lift their heads up and reconsider the error of their ways.

Donald Trump is a Presidential catastrophe of the highest order.

The tear gas incident at St John's Church seemed pointless and petty.  Then it occured to me that a lot of people have been jeering at President Trump for sitting in the White House basement during the riots, and for someone with his fragile ego, who prides himself on being "macho" and brave, it must have been humiliating to be labelled a coward.  I'm wondering if Trump arranged for the protesters to be tear-gassed to demonstrate both a show of his strength to supporters, and an overt warning to those who threaten him.

“You have to dominate,” Mr. Trump told the governors, warning them that “you’re going to look like a bunch of jerks” if the National Guard were not heavily deployed in protest areas.

No surprise here. It’s Trumps modus operandi, no empathy, no compassion, just hollow words to feign support or empathy. No attempt to unite America but rather bring out the big stick, threaten and sue protesters into submission while making example of others.

Real Americans are sick tired and frustrated as words of condolences, of expressions of horror prove insincere as time and time again nothing changes for the better. Trump says it’s terrorism what happening while taking not responsibility nor healing actions for the terror black Americans suffer via racism everyday.

The American economy was on an upward trajectory when Trump took office, but apart from looking after his freinds he has squandered opportunities, trashed governance, egocentricity lied constantly, with no regard or apparent wisdom as to what has made America great, albeit imperfect. 

Honoring George Floyd by making amends should mean working to change America for the better, that’s why the protests are spreading because many Americans have little faith in that as appalled as Trump would like us to believe he is, he will be quick to move on to “business as usual” and the protests will have been in vain.

No doubt there are opportunists gaining the protests and causing damage, one I know of is a jerk going by the name “Trump”
Yes...again the ghost of Nixon’s evil imperial presidency and the catastrophes that followed. Trump is worse and we are dying as a nation.

Trump is actually pushing for a Race War/Civil War make no mistake about it. The Fool doesn’t realize that this could literally blow up in his face. Everybody’s got guns now and the Military is largely brown. If they are forced to shoot their own kind... it wouldn’t take long before they turn their guns on him. There will be a break in the ranks along race/cultural lines.... and that’s when we go from insurrection to all out war.
Trump fiddles while America burns!
Trump's walk to the church and speech yesterday were so transparently phony.   Any positive comments he delivers are so disingenuous amidst the authoritarian bluster.

commentBody:
Trump makes every decision in favor of making himself look big and strong. Every decision he makes has a wrong base, or is destructive, or undermines the US, or whips up the public unnecessarily, or glorifies dictators. It is always short sighted, or just plain wrong, and makes the problem worse. Under Trump the US is becoming a broken country, disassociated from other democracies, uninterested in its own public, prone to dictatorial decisions, seeding chaos and fear, hyping racism and supporting far right wingers. 
In short, the US is in a steep downward spiral with Trump triumphantly leading the way, and we are like lemmings running to drown in the sea. A sea of stupidity and ignorance, racism and fear. 
Why are we allowing this to happen? Where is this inability to cope coming from? Is it all from Trump the Disfunctional? Trump the Wrecking Ball? Trump does have power after all. The power of total destruction. After he leaves a vast wake of destruction behind him, can we pick up the pieces from the rubble?

This is exactly what Trump wants: a race war!  He wants to act like a new dictator, come-in all heavy-handed, and then be seen as Putin (or Kim Jong-Il) 2.0.  Sadly, all that's happened is he's managed to do is bring back the 1918 Pandemic, the 1920's Great Depression, and the 1968 Race Riots all at the same time.

That's one hell of a magnificent mess-up, by any measurement!

Trump and his henchmen and hench-women are looking for ways to suspend the constitution, or at least the parts they do not like.

This is it.  This is the moment.  We are fighting for our nation, our way of life, our democracy.

This is the most critical moment in the history of our nation.

There is no alternative to voting blue if you want this nation to continue.

Trump must go and the Senate must flip.

Trump will make this the most ugly transition in history.  He will lie, cheat, threaten and bluster to maintain power.

He will not attend the inauguration of his successor.  He will denounce that person as fake.

And on and on.

We have to endure and stand up to the madness wherever it rears its insane and ugly head.

Do not give up or give in.  Vote Blue and stand for decency, truth, honesty, and justice.

That there are a handful of bad cops on the street, is a problem that has to be rooted out. Instead of showing concern for human life and honesty and integrity, the protesters have decided to destroy and steal from every business in sight while the police stand idly by. If the Black Lives Matters protesters were hoping to convince the average American not to fear the next Black youth they pass on the street, they have failed miserably.
