commentBody: We need other world leaders to speak out and "condemn" Trump's rush to turn America into a fascist dictatorship.  We need the military to stand down and disobey any orders from Trump to fire on their own people.  While that may be defined as a "coup", it may be the only way to remove the canker that is this current administration.

The mixture of religion and politics is poisonous especially in difficult times. Going to the Church and gassing the peaceful protesters on the way is an example of this insensible and arrogant behavior.
Trump is decidedly NOT the president of law and order but a petty dictator of disorder. Pelosi was correct when she labeled him and his pals fascists.

At what point do Republicans jump ship? I guess there were some who stood by Nixon until the end, too.

This is pathetic.
Shooting police officers and hitting them with cars is uncalled for. Blue lives matter, these officers did not have anything to do with George Floyd.

Well, “ we are ending the riots and lawlessness “, right Trumper,dream on. As  a Christian I am insulted by what that fool did for a photo op. Holding a bible? I am sure he has not read a page. Well done let’s start more violence. Is that a leader?

This is the military coup many of us believed Trump and his Fascist enablers were capable of happening before our eyes.

This is a Dictator and if we dig deep we will find White Nationalists are the cause and the “radical Left” as Barr tried to frame it.  In fact, they are being paid to infiltrate peaceful protests.

He will not leave office and we need all of Congress to realize it.  Open your eyes!

Courtroom images of witnesses swearing on the Bible to the crimes committed against America by trump that's what I long to see.

He is a hypocrite and a criminal. We need justice.

Let me cut to the quick. How do we get rid of this narcissistic calamity? We have to vote against him and his enablers. People cannot vote unless they are registered. We have five months to see that people are both registered and going to vote. We need to have people vote by mail to avoid COVID. Get on it Democrats and others concerned about our future. VOTE THEM OUT!

I never thought I'd see the day that the President of the US, a four or five time DRAFT DODGER, would come to the point where his only interest is playing with the tools of war that he fought so hard to avoid.

Trump should go visit "The Wall"....not his vanity project, but the 
 somber Black Granite in Washington, where 52000+ names are engraved of the dead who went, while he dodged the draft with his bone spurs. Four Times.

There, he can say to the Wall, "See? Now I get to steal your valor and play with all the shiny weapons and military toys to play with while I pretend I am a "war president" against my own fellow US Citizens. I'm Mr. Military!!!!!"

 I can order the troops around, (who volunteered to serve didn't even need to be drafted like you poor slobs)....not like me, hiding under my Daddy's roof....

And I didn't have to step in one mud puddle or dodge one single bullet!! No messy blown out intestines or blood filled lungs for me calling for Mom before I died, staring at the sky 12000 miles from home.

And, being a genius, I KNEW that forty five years after the Vietnam war ended, and seventy five years after WW2, a lot of gullible supporters would elect me to office!!  I could con them!!

Even the VA supports me!!!"

Gotta go now. Time to plan a military parade. 

STOLEN VALOR.

 C.I.C. by default. 

Makes me SICK.

Angrily, Ignatz
 
(G-father WW1 vet, dad WW2 vet (against Nazis) and brother, Vietnam, Saigon during TET.

The looting is being done by professional thieves of all ethnicities.
It is a disservice to lump the looters in with protesters.

How can he still think that he represents the American people? The whole world sees him handling the Covid-19 epidemic so disastrously, talking about anything like using disinfectant, and now that it is clear that the police were cowardly and racist in killing this poor man. He talk now to use the army to hide its ignorance and its insufficiency to understand what people actually experience every day in its country!
But how is it still possible?

I notice the only state with no protests is Mississippi.

Makes sense with their history of terrorizing with murder and suppressive violence against Black Americans; such as Emmet Till, Medgar Evers and the 3 Civil Rights workers to name but a minuscule fraction.

That is what I call state sponsored terrorism.

Maybe I am missing something here but how is the image of Trump walking to holding up a bible in front of a Church at the same time as siccing the national guard on demonstrators in front of the WH in anyway shape or form a positive look for him? He obviously coordinated this whole farce to prove a point and as a photo op but for what purpose? He just looked stupid standing there with a bible he no doubt never reads before a Church that he did not enter and apparently rarely attends and kicking out in overkill fashion anyone standing in his way -- just seems ridiculous.

I wish to express my support for the people of the USA and my horror of the circumstances of the murder of George Floyd.

Racism is a stain on the human race wherever it occurs and I look forward to the day that it is eliminated altogether.

President Donald Trump is a disgrace in my opinion to the office which he holds and I believe he will be shown to have been one of the worst Presidents ever. 

My best wishes go out to the good people of the USA.

Scotland
2.6.2020

To those asking about leaders, Joe Biden is out there, talking to people and listening and calling for calm and for solutions.

The question is why he isn't on the front page of the NYTimes, which yesterday, ran yet another "investigation" of him.

Could it be that four more years of Trump is good for their business and that of their advertisers?
This reminds me of 1968 when the country went wild and  Nixon was elected.

commentBody:
By all means, you have to stop Trump, who wants to deploy the military to deal with the unrest.  His threat bitterly remembered me of the night of June 3, 1989, in Beijing, China --- the Tiananmen Square Incident.  At that time, they didn’t hesitate to execute their force and shoot their people. They just performed what the one-party dictatorship government ordered them.  The U.S. is a democratic country.

The U.S. is a democratic country.  But in any country, the army follows orders. 
You shall not have Trump deploy the military. No more lives should be lost.

If we followed the Swedish model as a response to Covid19, the U.S. would not confront a $7.9 trillion cost for the response (as estimated by NYT), and there would likely not be any riots or anarchy remotely at this level. No one disputes the injustice of police forces, but officials and the media need to take responsibility for stay-at-home orders which created a pressure cooker on poor and non-essential workers in the U.S.

commentBody: If there are still people in this country who believes we're the richest and greatest country on the face of this World they must be either a Trump supporters or naive. If he gets voted in one more time I'll totally lose faith for the future of my grandkids. We should be all ashamed for what's happening and vote him out come November.

I hope every American hears the story of how our president ordered the assault of peaceful protesters for a photo opp, that every American sees that photo of Trump in front of the church, and though he is holding a bible (as if he were a righteous man - lol), what I hope they mostly see is that smug look on his face, the smug look of a small man, one ill-equipped to lead our country for another day, never mind four more years.  If he hasn't alienated all Christians with this ridiculous, callous, and tone-deaf stunt, I'd be genuinely surprised.

commentBody: Trump had a group of peaceful protesters gassed and shoved out of the way so he could walk over to the church and hold up a bible. What does that even mean? Trump is insane.

Among the transformations we need in our thinking is this: the vast majority of protests were peaceful and those protestors far outnumbered small groups looting or doing damage or actively clashing with police.

As a subscriber and former journalist, I wonder why the news media can't do enough self-reflection to put the peaceful photos up top, which would convey the story accurately. Why does it lead if it bleeds? Where has that taken us as a country? Isn't that the same non-standard of judgment that Facebook now defends?
replies: [{'commentID': 107379620, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107379620, 'userID': 64618464, 'userDisplayName': 'Nathan', 'userLocation': 'Brooklyn', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': 'The same reason they didn’t lead with all the peaceful arrests police made the day George Floyd was murdered.', 'createDate': '1591106724', 'updateDate': '1591121614', 'approveDate': '1591107645', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107378966, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Sara', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107379620', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107383471, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107383471, 'userID': 65224677, 'userDisplayName': 'Sara', 'userLocation': 'New York', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': "@Nathan, I disagree with that only in that a death-by-cop should be big headlines until it stops happening in broad daylight, on video, with a cop who seemed to have no concern about any of that. Bad cops with long lists of complaints who are happy to be on camera need to be big news.\n\nHowever, I agree that we need more context to reporting and we need it in the moment. We also need more coverage of places like Flint and Camden and the places where rioting is not occurring because the cities have reinvented their police-community relationships and practices. What we have as news is still too tied to practices that lead to clickbait, and that is accelerating, in a digital landscape, our spiral to the bottom. So journalists and editors need to do some soul-searching - and so do the rest of us who too often don't support good journalism because we think we can get the same product for free somewhere on the internet.", 'createDate': '1591113660', 'updateDate': '1591125164', 'approveDate': '1591117745', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107379620, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Sara', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107383471', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
I am so glad that Terence Floyd conveyed the message that violence is not the way to respond to his brother's murder.  The President will only use the looting to fire up his base to restore law and order and will open the door to his re-election.

The message that should be dispersed during peaceful protests should be:

DEMOCRACY = EQUALITY.

Our legislators must insure equal opportunity in getting an education and in justice.  To insure that everyone is equally well educated the states have to stop disbursing money to school districts derived from property taxes.  This is patently unfair to poor communities.

Whoever these rioters & looters are, they're not doing your movement any good, to put it mildly. They're not only sapping it of all the sympathy you'd otherwise be getting, they're also buying trump's ticket to a second term. Changes in cop shops will have to come from political leadership, and that starts in the White House. Replacing trump with Biden, although not sufficient to effect the reforms you-- we-- want, is NECESSARY for a reform movement.

If these violent thieves among you are outside instigators & criminals, you need to stop them. Now.

commentBody:
We who read the NYT online need to check out the hard copy on occasion.  

If I wanted to subvert a newspaper on the cheap, I’d be paying off the the headline writers.

Weird thing is, you tune into live coverage during the day and most protests around the country are peaceful.  There’s always an element that will use protests as an opportunity, but as much trouble as they cause, those people are in the minority.

Contributing to a worldview where all protestors, who have legitimate and honorable reasons to exercise their First Amendment rights, as criminals, is dishonest and dangerous.

commentBody: It's really fitting that President Trump posed in front of a church with a Bible in his hand. That photo really captures what the Christians in this country support. What a sham. Franklin Graham and Falwell Junior must be grinning with dollar signs in their eyes right now.

After all of Donald Trump's "shenanigans" (and I am using language that will not be offensive to the NYTimes moderators), it appears to my wife and myself that the only people who can still support this malefactor are members of a brainwashed cult of personality.  (I have been using the term "Cult of Trump" to describe them for some time.)

Only a shallow, mindless buffoon would have the horse-mounted US Park Police and military forces of the US teargas and otherwise roust a large number of Americans who were using their First Amendment rights to peaceably protest in Lafayette Square so that he could walk over to St. John's Church and hold a Bible (upside down no less) for a photo op.  (Mayor Bowers says that no DC police were involved.)

I am reminded of the scene from Dr. Zhivago in which the Russian Cossacks, mounted on horses, sabres flashing, ride through a large number of Russian peasants who had the audacity to plead for assistance from the Tsar, leaving dead and wounded in their path.

Trump seems to want to have feudalism be the political system in the US, with himself (and then his family) as the hereditary rulers, with the 1% as the "nobles," and with the rest of us 99% as serfs.  

Emperor Donald The First of Queens has no clothes.  

We need to vote him, and all his Republican enablers, out of office on 11/3/2020.

Will Trump "threaten to deploy the U.S. military" to 'guard' the polls on election day?
Think carefully my friends. 
The old white men with the power and money are very scared right now. They shut down Colin. These protests are much harder to stop and they are nervous. They are also clueless and hateful.
What will they do to keep the status quo?

Looting of property and other riot reports are important, but should not be the headline news at NYT or anywhere else.
The headline news should be that the would-be Putin/Mussolini in the White House is using military weapons, helicopters and soldiers against non-violent American citizens on American soil. The headline news should be that King Donald encouraged his armed Nazi MAGA cultists to travel to the White House to defend him against protesters. 
The headline news should be that King Donald intends to use an 1807 law to "justify" using the American military against Americans nationwide.
Those of us with ethics, conscience and brains warned during the 2016 election that if elected, Trump would be an agent of doom who would quickly wreck our country.
We were correct.
Nixon is looking like a saint now.

commentBody:
Yes, the vandalism, looting and violence against police are deeply troubling. But equally if not more troubling has been the unprovoked police violence against obviously peaceful protesters and members of the press.

I've seen videos of protesters standing or sitting still with their hands up, lying face down in the street,  walking calmy on roads or sidewalks, or standing on front porches in their neightbourhoods ---only to be bowled over by police and thrown against concrete or metal, pepper-sprayed in the face, kicked, fired at with rubber bullets, tear-gassed, beaten with cudgels. All this has been amply documented by testimonial, journalists' accounts and, more irrefutably, video.

Watching these assaults --and there is no "fog of war" confusion here--  it's difficult to avoid the conclusion that some police officers are simply vengeful, power-drunk or sadistic, or that these men are part of a systematic effort to discourage, through violence and intimidation, citizens from assembling (lawfully and peaceably) and journalists from reporting.

In the public interest, the NYT should be gathering evidence of unprovoked police violence and asking what if any *directives/ instructions* are given to riot police when it comes to dealing with unarmed citizens peacefully exercising their first amendment rights.

It's clear: some citizens demanding accountability for cops who use excessive force (sometimes lethally excessive) are being met with... more excessive force, brutality.

commentBody:
I think it is kind of pathetic the way the right is trying to use the current civil unrest to appeal to “law and order” and “property rights” the way they have in the past.
They genuinely don’t understand how much things have changed.  They are using the old playbook as hard as they can.
But it’s empty.  They are the only ones buying it.
Things have changed.  People are sick of the abuse of powers that are being committed and they are rightfully angry.  Get used to it.

commentBody:
The so-called "libtard" governors and mayors are choosing restraint by the police and don't want the military on the streets --because they are wise.  " Retribution" is vengeance, plain and simple.  Restraint and curfews are tools that are used by government officials who have actual jobs protecting citizens. 

The Republican "mini-me" mayors and governors who choose to be "tough" are empowering the police to run wild.  This will only mean greater crimes against protesters as the innocent will be violently punished. 

And the punishers will be bullied along by the worst elements within their ranks, enough of whom are their commanders and 
colleagues as to pull everyone else along with them.  The very culture that caused the murder of Mr. Floyd and so many others thus rewards the bullies within police forces and marginalizes the many good cops who might be open to change.  It encourages bullies to join the police and drives others away.

Of course our President is grasping for an opportunity to revive his failed regime and get re-elected by a public that craves order and "normalcy".  He will pursue this ongoing series of street battles all summer, tweeting non-stop , and moving on to yet another series of crazy conspiracy-memes as a holding pattern if the protests die down and the next opportunity arises, and arise it will as sure as daybreak.

Many years ago I had a clinical psychology professor who had a gift for translating arcane criteria. She said that the clue to identifying Cluster B personality disorders (antisocial, borderline, histrionic, narcissist) is when the social group's daily existence is monopolized by having to attend to the demands of that one individual.

We have a so-called commander-in-chief who normalizes dysfunction and behaves like an addled warlord. He cares not for the consequences but rather thrives on them.

He has become our primary role model, albeit irrationally and unconsciously. (Doubt that? Educate yourself about the function of mirror neurons in the human brain.)

And then we're shocked when society's rot boils over into nonstop looting and rioting?

Mr. Trump said he wants ten year-prison sentences mandatory for looters. Okay, Mr. President - start with Matthew Lee Rupert - ten years in Illinois State Prison for looting and inciting riot with no chance for parole.

As with the peaceful protesters, there are many people of good will commenting here. And like the former, there are many people who have embedded themselves for evil within these commenters to spread discord and hatred.

commentBody:
Repeat a lie and they will believe it to be truth.  A Hitler.

The photo op has a parallel. In that picture Hitler holds up his "My Struggle". 

Hitler surrounded himself with drug addicts, simply crazies and even a homosexual. Their commonality: they worshiped him. They hung on his every word and in the end killed themselves or denied everything. 

The human toll was over 100,000,000. While Jews were the best known targets, people with disabilities, too outspoken Roman Catholic priests and political enemies were not given a pass.

The Episcopalian leadership has spoken out. On this issue it is not Joe Biden's job to lead until and unless the Pope, Islamic, Jewish, Buddhist, Hindi and other religious leaders come forward.

I did not mention the faux preachers speaking out. They  teach anything but what Jesus Christ said or did. They are seekers of wealth and as Jesus said, "For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also." 

The issue is: "Where is America's heart?"

"Where your treasure is, there also lies your heart."

commentBody:
Trump’s stunt yesterday was a reminder that, thanks to Evangelicals, Christianity in this country is yet another partisan think.

When people mention Christianity these days, I don’t think of Jesus.  I think a greedy white Republicans in the Red Welfare States sitting in a lavish megachurch, passing judgment on everyone.  What’s worse is that for Christians, the highlight of Sunday isn’t listening to the words of Jesus but rather going to a restaurant afterward to berate the low paid (often minority) server and walk out without leaving a tip.

To me Christianity is nothing more than an extension of the GOP with churches and ministers all across the Red Welfare States upholding the racism, homophobia and misogyny that are the core values of the GOP.

The images that touched me the most in the last 24 hours were those where law enforcement knelt or walked with protesters. Those actions calmed the crowds and put an entirely different psychological aura on the protest. Imagine if Trump had offered a prayer, or had one given by someone like Rev Al Sharpton, when he went to that church yesterday.  It would have been a moment of healing that this country desperately needs right now.

commentBody:
“Scores of Officers and Protesters Injured on Seventh Day of Unrest”

Really? 
This is the page 1 headline, the most important frame for the stories I am about to read? 
This isn’t just false equivalence; this is purposely misleading and I am glad this is not the only paper I read, so I know better. 

You just lost another subscriber.

The majority are peaceful protesters, however it is recognized that embedded within them and numerous outside agitators who are encouraging anarchy. In effect they are using the peaceful protesters as a shield.
Why are the media providing cover for these anarchists?

commentBody:
I keep hearing that the insurrection is being organized and facilitated by groups which encourage insurrection. Something called "antifa" keeps getting mentioned. 

New York Times, where are your pieces which report on those allegations? Where are your interviews with the leaders of the alleged groups who are encouraging this? Or is this just a fantasy about such groups? I don't even see anything online from anyone which encourages such behavior. 

Lacking that I need to believe that what we're seeing is spontaneous, unjustified violence, insurrection, and law-breaking engaged in by an underlying criminal element which dwells among us. How does breaking into Macy s and stealing stuff further anybody's cause?

Oh the irony if there was a massive, organized walkout/strike by officers all across the country. It would allow the rioters do as they please and destroy what they please and there would be no more confrontations between the public and the police. It's an experiment I'd very interestingly observe, especially once the rioters come to the suburbs and really stir things up.

commentBody:
Is it legal to gas peaceful protestors?  Is it legal to fire rubber bullets into a peaceful crowd? Sure seems like another example of police brutality.  Or is it okay for the Secret Service and National Guard to do the same thing?  Will anyone in either of these organizations be held accountable for the unnecessary attacks on innocent people exercising their First Amendment rights?

I hope, but am not optimistic, that protest against police brutality does not lead to increased military and governmental brutality.

commentBody:
As some have mentioned here, do not forget the 100,000  lives that have been lost during this pandemic. Trump and his team soar in chaos because each outrage distract us from the previous and wears us down. 

Do not forget his government and his hacks in the senate abandoned the interest of the people a long time ago! 

Get out and vote in November. Be outraged by his admiration of police brutality and tactics. Be outraged by his abysmal response to COVID. be outraged by his disregard of tribal right. Be outraged by his lack of concern for climate change. Be outraged by everything this government and republican senate have encouraged and allowed.

Black voters and white voters MUST end the perception that police forces are the old South's carry over from Jim Crow. Outliers (race murders) should be publically prosecuted to the fullest degree.

They [State/County police recruiters] also tend to brag that they hire police with degrees: What does a degree have to do with the self control and experience and hands on training that someone needs in a fearful confrontation?
Outlier police are there because with all the money funded to police and the excellent police pensions, state/counties don't require them to work for 6 months interning in a social service capacity in the same neighborhoods they will soon patrol carrying deadly weapons.

They need hands on training in "real" situations just like doctors or surgeons...and they need to find ways of testing them out if they fail.


They [State/County police recruiters] also grab combat veterans who are trained diametrically opposite of what community policing is supposed to look like. 

These are steps that should start TOMORROW...not after a phony and costly "investigation" after a black citizen is brutally choked.

“the police used tear gas and flash grenades to disperse peaceful protesters so that the president could visit a nearby church and pose for photographs with a Bible.” – unbelievable yet so very real. Every horrific thing predicted came true and worse under this disturbed sociopath. I see no chance of anything close to healing or progress out of this hole until he is removed from office.

Reality Check reason why we have police is because  our beautifull country turn into bunch deplorables. Dont blame our president for what we become. We could go back to probition an get rid of tabbacco an alchol an make penity for illegal drugs firing squad . Fear does have effect on mental illnesses.

Where was Trump’s forceful message of law and order during the chaos that engulfed Charlottesville, VA in 2017? 

How are people protesting police brutality ‘thugs’ but white supremacist and now-nazis ‘very fine people’?

The leader of this country does not value all lives equally. And his ‘concern’ over the unjust treatment of minorities and POC is a genuine and his Christian values.

commentBody: I have noticed a greater erratic change in Trump since Mark Meadows has become Chief of Staff, there are two basic questions here, first, how much guidance is Meadows taking from McConnell, it is not inconceivable to think that McConnell has not been the puppetmaster, all you need to see is the amount of bad influence McConnell has demonstrated since the beginning of the Trump presidency, second, Meadows was a congressman of a Republican division the Freedom Party, what exactly do we know about the Freedom Party when you look at many of the Congressmen of the Freedom Party, you see Jordan, Gaetz, Ratcliffe?, these are voices of anger and division, more concerned about their rise in Government  by associating with a corrupt President, I again go back to what you learn as a child at home and in School, You are who you hang with, that will be your legacy, therefore we all know Trump is a racist, therefore, we must conclude that Meadows,Gaetz, Jordan and many other Republicans are racist and see this tug of war as strength as opposed to cowardism. The fact that Meadow's sister is married to a Black Man does not mean Meadows is not a racist, many of us have family members who are married to people of whom we don't approve but we know how to play the game, it is our subconscious actions that truly represent us as people, our prejudices comes out during these times, no matter what we portray in front of our loved ones.

Trump: "I have an Article two where I have the right to do whatever I want to do as president".

He thinks he is the Sun King, albeit with a lousy taste, and thinks "L'etat, c'est moi".

Le carnage, c'est moi. 

That is a better description of a man who allows peaceful protesters to be tear gassed, shot at with rubber bullets in order to pose with a bible - a book he most certainly never read - in front of a church for a photo-op.

African Americans have been 'legally' lynched by law enforcement, while also having the highest death rate of Covid-19.

I cry for you, America.

I’m reading defenses of the police that sound like the lament of the School-Yard Bully who got caught because somebody “Told on him.” If it were not for all those people with cameras in their phones, all those reporters telling the world what happened, showing all that video… If it were not for “them” then the death of George Floyd would have been just another drunk trying to pass a bogus $20-bill causing his own death by not cooperating with the police. So, the real problem is the Tattle-Tale who told everyone exactly what really happened. So, all the problems are the fault of the Tattle-Tales, not the police who actually caused George Floyd’s death. 

When the police respond to the protests, they go after the obvious Tattle-Tales – the reporters, people with phones and cameras held to record what the police are doing. The Tattle-Tales are the problem – not the police. Move along, nothing to see here,… hand over your phone, camera, et cetera.

The property damage is sad. I fear that this will also launch yet another wave of SARS-CoV2 infections and Trump gets to blame the protesters and the Tattle-Tales in the press for causing the second wave of infections as well as the property damage. 

I only fear that the Generals won’t answer Trump’s order to wage war on protesting American Citizens with: “Sir, No Sir!”  If they deploy and start shooting citizens as if they are “the enemy” this nation is doomed.
Does any doubt remain that the president of the United States is deranged?

Police brutality.  Should we be surprised?  Racism. How much longer should our black brothers endure?  Riots.  Don’t we deserve them?  White Americans, we are responsible.  This convulsed time is our opportunity, maybe the last one before we fall like Rome once did. Let’s end racism. Let’s clean up our police forces across America and restore their mission to serve all citizens with respect and humanity, regardless of race, skin color, social standing, or national origin.  May Trump be the cusp of our decline.  May we rebuild the promise that America has always been to us and the world.  I trust that we all together can do it.

commentBody: Everything Trump is doing seems designed to inflame tensions.  Can someone please lock him in his bunker without his phone and throw away the key.

If we as a nation have had our fill of looting after only five days how do Black Folks feel about their place in American society after four hundred years? We are the end of our collective patience with the Thugs,as our president calls them, after only a week.How dare them tear down our countries wealth that was mostly built on their backs by way of slavery? They are told it is the American Way to allow peaceful protest while it is the American way to accept police killings also. Our in action has caused what is happening now and we must own it or it will happen again. We must accept when it comes to people of color nothing we do is fair. We blame people of color for their plight and absolve our self of any responsibility. The worldwide condemnation of the killing of Mr Floyd by a stoic police officer looking into the camera as he killed is burned into our memory. As when Bull Conner put the dogs on people for asking to be treated equally the world is watching. Our children are watching and we should be ashamed at what they saw last Monday.

commentBody: So the RNC wants to court black voters!  This should surely do it.  This shameful abuse of religion should show the Evangelical wing of his base what his Christianity is all about—or will it?  They have accepted a man who breaks at least one Commandment daily—false witness.  Is married for the third time, has been an adulterer, claims he never asks forgiveness because he never needs to, fans the flames of hatred and division, urges violence against the very people he has sworn to protect, yet waves the Bible, a holy book, for a photo op to show his “courage”—surrounded, of course, by a phalanx of armed troops after hiding out for eight days while the Nation suffered from a lack of leadership.  And to add to the outrage, trying the latest in his quiver of demagoguery,  calling legitimate protest “insurrection.”  Tweedledee Barr surely instructed him about what the term means.  Oh, he probably already knew, being a “genius.”   What will it take for the GOP in Congress (e.g. Cotton, et al) to wake up.

For NYT and its readers the most desirable outcome would have been that DT starts going to the church among the 'peaceful protesters' and never comes back.  Since the tear gas prevented that from happening, there is an understandable outrage that it has been used.  Otherwise, it is laughably stupid to expect that he simply takes a stroll among people who never hid their intent to harm him as much as possible.

I know that it makes little to say anything to the people supporting this daily who appear to be blind to and endorse the destruction, willingly or not, but the problem have never been peaceful protesters but the 'unidentified' looters and vandals.   In the current mayhem, in no small part incited by the rhetoric of the propaganda pieces as this one, it is almost impossible to say who is who.

commentBody: trump is sick, and we are all infected. How long will it take to recover? Can we recover?

Can we stop giving our police officers military-grade equipment. 

When you're a hammer, every problem looks like a nail. Or in this case, a punching bag. 

Some of these cops are WAY too jazzed about getting an opportunity to get physical. Their motto is PROTECT and SERVE. Not SUPPRESS and IGNORE

I respectfully ask all of us to consider the following when discussing the murder of George Floyd and the protests. 
"You keep saying 'It's horrible that an innocent black man was killed but destroying property has to stop.' Try saing 'It's horrible that property is being destroyed but killing innocent black men has to stop'"
[from a person named “Max Well” on FaceBook]

commentBody:
A truly comic sight straight out of Charlie Chaplin’s “ Great Dictator”. What did he think he was doing with the Bible? Carrying out an exorcism?
If this was to demonstrate how brave Trump is it demonstrated what a coward he really is. He had to use police and army units, armed to the teeth, throwing tear gas at peaceful demonstrators, before he ventured out of the White House.
The army needs to refuse to obey this tin pot, sleazy real estate dealer with delusions of grandeur.
WHERE IS CONGRESS TO STOP THIS??

commentBody:
OMG.  tear gas on demonstrators for a photo op.  This whole situation is not going to end well.

We have citizens ramming law enforcement with vehicles just as police did to protesters.  Not gong to end well.

When the police and military start killing, the protesters will do the same.  We live in a nation of guns.  This great 2nd amendment republicans' and gun nuts promote, coming back your way.  Not going to end well.

There are not enough military to stop this movement - 140 cities.  Not going to end well.

40 million unemployed.  Fuel for the fire.  Not going to end well.

And we have a president that thinks heavy handedness is the answer.  Not going to end well.

commentBody:
This was so predictable in 2016. Press, stop quoting his barbaric tweets and threats! STOP it. He thrives on your attention!  Just say what is true: the sick old man is at it again.

The fact that people are outraged with the deeper slide into authoritarianism that the corrupt mass in the WH  is using for his purpose, while of all things holding a Bible?!, shows just how naive and lacking in historical knowledge most people are.

Stop saying that the guy in the WH "does not understand." He does.  He knows what he is doing. He is going to use every corrupt means within his grasp to keep himself in power.

This guy has the military and a Senate full of Trumpian midgets and the corrupt Barr. Why isn't the American Bar Association speaking up? Where are the Constitutionalists in this country?  

Why does anyone think he won't send troops into states without permission?

Where is the unified messaging machine that people like Mr. Bloomberg and Mr. Steyer could fund day in and day out to stop that man?

Where is the old Republican 'establishment' who have sworn to uphold our Constitution--not loyalty to one man. This does not refer to the old white segregationist men in the Senate.
 Where are the true Christians and not the desiccated contemptible "evangelicals?

This is beyond horrifying.   Congress has said "enough."  The old white men in the Senate have cheered him on. 

We have to find a way to unite behind who we can be at our best.  Not sink to the level of that man.
The absence of Pence, a person of faith, from the photo op, was glaring. Is it possible that participating in this storm trooper spectacle ordered by Trump too repugnant for Pence to bear?

commentBody: Each day keeps getting worse and worse. Mind-numbing. Hopeless...
What do we expect with Trump the WWE promoter? Fake man inciting fake fights at the altar of money. In the past, all the participants are willing. Now, many real people die.

Trump last touched a bible when he was being sworn in because he had to. For him to use the holy book for a photo op is plain abhorrent and goes against the teachings. This was just the icing on a stale cake in form of a martial law threat he made earlier.

The photo of the crowd in front of the Minnesota governor's residence is the opposite of the group who stormed the capital building wearing their costumes of fear carrying weapons. These are true Americans, this is the true majority, this is the face of the people, the cowards are outnumbered.
We must remove the entire trump administration!

However appalled decent people are by Trump's actions last night -- claiming to value peaceful protest as he gassed peaceful protesters -- he is going to claim today that his heavy handed tactics worked. Because they did. The federal police and soldiers chased after protesters and by 11 pm/midnight, the city was quiet. The looting in DC last night was minimal. And look at NY, where a more "restrained"  approach and an 11 pm curfew allowed vandals to once again loot the city. 

People on the left cannot continue to rationalize the looting. To defeat the Trump terror we must be willing to both support peaceful protest on behalf of Black Lives Matter AND condemn rioting and looting by young people of all races. Otherwise we are just as hypocritical as Trump.

commentBody: This is typical of Trump. Everything he does is posed and phony, because he himself is a phony. If anyone ever was unfit to serve as President it’s Trump. He is amoral, asocial, and pathologically egocentric. Even his wives and family are only extras on his show. Over 100,000 Americans have died of Covid 19 because of his unresponsiveness to a pandemic. Drs Fauci and Birx are nowhere to be found because they speak the truths that undercut Trump’s posturing. And now the hatred that Trump fostered so well over the last three or so years is boiling over, demonstrating his destruction of the nation that he swore to preserve, protect, and defend. As was said of him by other Republican candidates before the last “election,” Trump is a con man, a fraud, and a phony. But he seems to think that he is God’s gift to the world, and Heaven help us all if he decides to order military action against his own people. He must have hired Kim Jong Un as his new adviser. His administration is a total failure, and while the demonstrations both here and abroad are focused on police brutality, they are caused by the brutality of the worst President in our nation’s history. Trump is not my president and, if you’re not among the 1 percenters, he’s not yours, either. Put a mask on him and vote him out!!!

This is also a constitutional crisis, in the sense the Constitution and its language is not longer adequate in reflecting the nation as we see it today.

Moreover, this is a clear reason for the role of the Executive branch to be reigned in, refined, and reoriented to act in the interests of the People—not the narrow band of sycophants which blindly adhere themselves to it.
Now that America is great again, can we even imagine how much more greatness Trump has in mind for us?

I never thought it was a realistic possibility that Trump would refuse to accept the results in November when he loses.

Until now.

If he is prepared to use force on peaceful citizens exercising their First Amendment rights in front of the White House just because they are in his way, there is no telling where this will lead us come November.

I can't believe I am saying this, but the survival of constitutional order in this country may come down to whether or not the armed services understand and live up to their oaths.
The White House has released a campaign video (my words) of yesterday's nice outing in Washington by trump and his bunker bible. https://twitter.com/WhiteHouse/status/1267676026391404544
Make your point all day, but then go home at night.  Don't become "Exhibit A" for those who would justify your persecution.

This is the American equivalent to the Arab Spring protests, George Floyd is our Mohamed Bouazizi, the merchant in Tunisia who died protesting the authoritarian tactics of the Tunisian police.

I hope that our democratic institutions are strong enough to ensure the survival of our country and it's ideals.

But, I am not hopeful.

In certain intellectual circles, Trump's rhetoric has been explained up until now as a kind of ironic or postmodern impulse, of a kind of winking agreeance between a populist and the population. Well irony shifts to tragedy, and progress comes a-reckoning. Let us pray-pray-pray for 1790 over 1871.
Trump and Barr have gone too far.
Mitch better hurry up and get those next rounds of stimulus checks sent out asap .

How is that nobody cares of Coronavirus?
It is still there. It won’t go away because people are protesting. It is still very dangerous to gather even if you are using a mask, I think.

Corona virus is having an explosion opportunity all across the nation. 14 days from now we will have twice as many cases and it will double and triple from there. It will make the riots unimportant. Watch out.

Total "unrest" in my Queens neighborhood last night?  A single homeless drunk defaced a small George Floyd memorial in a vestpocket park that mostly consisted of children's drawings placed over the weekend. Yet the local Facebook groups were chock full of over-the-top panic and hysteria about rioting, which seem to have been largely limited to a handful of shuttered commercial blocks in Manhattan and fanned by provocateurs.  The city should be able to handle this without a full five-borough restriction of basic rights of the public.

One big problem that will effect the the upcoming election. If the riots continue, voters may well remember the lawlessness, fires and looting more than the legitimate protests and begin to associate the protests with the riots. That can only help the Trump campaign - not really something that I think the protesters want. Before this I happily considered Trump a sure looser; now he might just pull off a victory. It will not be because of what he has done (nothing positive): it will be because of be because of what what the cities (many if not most Democratic) have done (nothing). Minneapolis for example - with the record he had, why was that cop still employed there? Mr. Mayor and Mr. Police Chief please tell us - inquiring minds want to know.

Our President is waging a war.  In his words you see a desired separation of White and Black, Police and Protestors, the Church and the Godless, the privileged and the unprivileged.  Division.  And he has chosen his sides. This is how he "leads."  

He talks of a great country and how it is going to come back really soon.  His idea of greatness is only a thriving economy that creates greater wealth for those on his side and no real opportunity for the other.

He somehow claims to be on the side of God and the Bible, yet he does not speak to or on behalf of God, and knows nothing of the text, but in siding with both there are votes to be had.

With whites being a the larger population group, he has chosen them.

And by creating and taking sides he hopes to stay in office and keep his power.  And that is what it is all about:  Power.  But a great country?  Sorry, sir, that ship sailed when you rode down the escalator.
Oh please, what’s the fuss?  He was just heading out for a little Bible study and found the church locked.

"Authorities Use Tear Gas So President Can Pose for Photo [in front of a Church]"

What happened to "separation of Church and State"?  For decades it has been the US policy to condemn foreign leaders who exploited/used religion for political gain.  Mr. Trump just debased the United States' Constitution and the U.S. presidency by making himself indistinguishable from mullahs in Tehran.

We need to hear from Democratic Senators and Representatives now.  If not now, when?  

We need to have a National March on Washington, in the same way that we have done in the past.

We need to call out police and military violence, sacrilegious photo ops, and fascist tropes.

We need to assure that we will have an election in November and not low flying helicopters and tear gas.

commentBody:
I'm seeing a lot of people in power who've been somewhat "euphemistic" about about Trump speak out more forcefully about the shortcomings of him and his administration.  

His behavior is truly disgusting and it's heartening to see that others agree and are willing to voice it directly ... "Social Distancing" at it's best!

In the name of justice, the protesters are marching towards the brutality and inhuman treatment by the police.  Looting, burning, scuffling, damaged facilities, and incidental death are typical byproducts of large scale demonstration. 

Our government supported similar but more deadly protests in HK.  But no one said anything.  In the name of democracy and freedom, mobsters and rioters were entitle to do looting, burning, destructions, and killing.  Our government did nothing to stop them.

It is a tale of two countries.
So many people are about to discover how difficult it is to get a job/housing with an arrest record and all while going into an economic depression.
and still the Times condones anarchy and violence, calling those acts "protest", and encourages attracts on the police through biased and incendiary "reporting".

I know there is the fear that these uprisings will allow Trump to grasp the law and order card. The same card Nixon played in the sixties. The difference of course, was Nixon, as morally compromised as he was, looked and acted competent. Trump, on the other hand, looks and acts like the clown---you can't elect a law and order clown.

I seem to recall that when some folks at Trump rallies got out of hand, attacking anyone who didn't like Trump, he excused it with "People get excited".  When Nazis marched in Charlottesville and one drove through the crowd and killed a woman, his response was "good people on both sides". When he blabbered "Liberate Michigan" and it incited some people to attack others, the Instigator in Chief stayed silent.  
 
Now there are protests of a long-standing problem and deaths, and when a small portion committing crimes the protesters are all "Thugs", and "Military must dominate".  But not a hint of acknowledgement that his years of race-baiting and appealing to white supremacists has worsened the problem.  

And for a final absurdity, and probably a violation of the protesters' rights to free speech and to petition for redress of grievances - "Authorities Use Tear Gas So President Can Pose for Photo"
The City's own medical doctors were in on the collusion with the police report. The rot runs deep. Very deep.

Donald Trump used the military to attack protesters so he could look dominate, take a walk and have a photo op with a bible in front of a church. If that isn’t the perfect expression of an authoritarian thug and predictive of the months ahead I don’t know what is. He’ll get to be the “war time” president yet and his “war” will be against his fellow citizens. Blackhawk helicopters harassing protesters and aggressive military units using tear gas and flash bang grenades is only the beginning. How far the Donald will take his “war” will only be limited by the willingness of the military to follow his orders. When he tells them to start shooting people then what? All he can do is make things worse and so he will.

When Donald Trump closes his mouth, he's criticized for being silent.

When Donald Trump opens his mouth, he's criticized for being divisive.

When Donald Trump takes shelter in the White House, he's criticized for retreating.

When Donald Trump leaves the White House, he's criticized for being a bully.

Your newspaper is seriously out of touch with reality. Multiple media outlets flat out lied when their analysts said the President was "silent" about the protests this weekend. On Saturday after the SpaceX launch, I watched his speech from Cape Kennedy live on TV, and he addressed the protests for at least ten or fifteen minutes. It was a decent speech, but you don't even acknowledge it exists. He might has well have spoken into a black hole.

This paper is fueling the flames by refusing to interpret anything the President says or does in anything but the most malicious way. It's messed up.

I thought it was really powerful when the President walked to the church. A world leader, in broad daylight, walking through what an hour ago had been a seething, angry crowd, to visit a church that had been firebombed the night before. He created a contrast between cities that were tolerating riots and looting, and a city that adopts his rhetoric of dispersing unlawful protesters with overwhelming law enforcement presence.

Nothing he does will ever earn your approval, which is messed up. You're more invested in watching your own city burn.

[{'commentID': 107378340, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107378340, 'userID': 65836973, 'userDisplayName': 'Bob Hawthorne', 'userLocation': 'Poughkeepsie, NY', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Kyle Davis

You’re so right Kyle. Trump is really such a great guy, an upstanding leader who always displays the utmost thought, compassion and intellect. If it wasn’t for that lousy news media more people would see his true character!!! He’s a victim in all of this!!!

 By the way Kyle, it’s you who is messed up and out of touch with reality.', 'createDate': '1591104164', 'updateDate': '1591113083', 'approveDate': '1591104317', 'recommendations': 5, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107377164, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Kyle Davis', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107378340', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107378843, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107378843, 'userID': 73019165, 'userDisplayName': 'Maggie', 'userLocation': 'Maine', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Kyle Davis   What had been an angry seething crowd was no longer because it had been tear gassed and dispersed! How does Trump walking an empty thoroughfare, in broad daylight or not, accompanied by secret service,  indicate any kind of courage??   If poor Donald gets criticized because he can’t do anything right, perhaps he could start doing a few things right.  I would recommend starting with acknowledging the racism that exists in our country.', 'createDate': '1591105204', 'updateDate': '1591111269', 'approveDate': '1591105753', 'recommendations': 6, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107377164, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Kyle Davis', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107378843', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107379708, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107379708, 'userID': 75205468, 'userDisplayName': 'Kyle Davis', 'userLocation': 'Orlando, FL', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "@Bob Hawthorne 

I won't stoop to the level of calling you names, Bob. Trump is flawed, but so is the NYT. What they have in common though is that either of them will admit it.

The funny thing is, absolutely no one thinks what happened to George Floyd was anything other than flagrant police abuse and outright murder. I am a Trump supporter, yet I believe the days of tolerating this police abuse are coming to an end. I am sincerely rooting for the protesters' success. I also want things to be peaceful. But it cannot come against a backdrop of lawlessness, looting, and riots. There are videos online of people hurling rocks at firetrucks, torching police cars, beating up business owners and leaving them for dead, or else mocking them for their losses once the dust settles. It is absolutely disgusting.

In the current environment, when the police disappear, businesses get looted in broad daylight and burned burned to the ground at night. Communities that don't set boundaries—no looting, or you will get arrested; no torching the police cars, or you will get arrested; no assembling past curfew, or you will get arrested—those communities will be hollowed out and worse for wear whenever this is over.

I cannot emphasize enough: I am rooting for the protesters success. But first the state needs to set boundaries, since regular people clearly sense the police are afraid to enforce the law, and have no compunction against looting their local shoe store.", 'createDate': '1591106862', 'updateDate': '1591108062', 'approveDate': '1591108062', 'recommendations': 0, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107378340, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Kyle Davis', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107379708', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
"O' beautiful, for spacious skies
But now those skies are threatening
They're beating plowshares into swords
For this tired old man that we elected king
Armchair warriors often fail
And they've been poisoned by these fairy tales
The lawyers clean up all details..."

Don Henley.
Sad and shameful. Hiding behind Bible to manipulate his base.

Back on May Day 1971, I was tear gassed and arrested on the National Mall, along with 10,000 other people, for peacefully protesting against the Vietnam War.  All of us were rounded up without probable cause and carted off to jail by the police.

The lesson I learned from that experience is that our constitutional right to peaceful assembly extends only so far as the people in charge think that constitutional right should go.  As proof we have yesterday's action by Trump to tear gas peaceful protesters so he could grab a photo op with a Bible in front of St. John's Church.

Our country elected Nixon, a lying, cheating tyrant with delusions of grandeur.  And we saw how well that went.  Yet voters learned nothing from that grim episode in our history and elected Trump, another lying, cheating tyrant with delusions of grandeur.  As Hegel so neatly put it:  "We learn from history that we do not learn from history."

The daily Trump outrages will continue until he is voted out of office.  There is no excuse for not voting against this malignant coward in November 2020.

If you want to be heard, rise up and register to vote.  A massive voter registration movement in June would get the attention of the politicians.  Less than 1/2 vote.   These marches and protests won't change anything.  VOTE!!!!!!

We knew this President was unhinged long before this photo op.  We knew it when he started out the lie about how big his inaugural crowd was.  We knew it when he bragged about grabbing women and going into teen dressing rooms at his beauty pageants.  And his GOP enablers and competitors running for President new it and know it too.  Vote them out.
Seeing Trump stand there with that bible, I swear it seems we've regressed 1000 years, all the way back to the Crusades.  Ready to massacre in the name of God.

commentBody: All that was required is to say please clear the way for the President. Peaceful protestors would have understood and  removed themselves to make way. But no. Our Dear Leader wanted to show everyone and demonstrate how to quell a protest. Set an example to show the Governors how it is done. The height of stupidity. Are there no adults in the White House any more? I am guessing they have they all left?    Even a layman knows what Trump should have said "If I am elected again, you have my promise there will be reform. I hear your voices and understand your anger deep in my heart". Is that so difficult to come up with? Seriously? Trump and his siblings lost touch with reality quite a while back. But do the others surrounding him also have to lose touch? Or were they hired because they also had lost touch with reality? Was that a job requirement? Deep down, I think Trump knows he has already lost November. In his frustration and anger by coming to terms with this, he wants to take it out on the American people by leaving them with a country in tatters. As a sort of some kind of  payback. His hope is that his successor will have so many pieces to pick up that somehow his Presidency may, in hindsight look slightly less chaotic. His only incling of a  hope. Try and understand his psyche. Oh, and one last thing. What happened to all those vicious dogs in the White House?? Did they also take shelter in the bunker? Sad. Very sad. It is not so beautiful.

do we have the arian-brothers in the White House next??
(or are they already...?)

If you’re francophone etc. Swiss , sorry ^_* \n\nVergangenheitsbewältigung or something like “coming to grips with a difficult past.” It is generally used to talk about how Germany has dealt with their Nazi past. It is of course something that is not over - every German citizen has to come to terms with the NSDAP when they come of age or immigrate and different generations have shown different trends. I am hopeful that Black Lives Matter will leave as much of an impression on the US as the 1968ers and that America will begin our own Vergangenheitsbewältigung about White Supremacy and Faschism in America.', 'createDate': '1591105081', 'updateDate': '1591105492', 'approveDate': '1591105492', 'recommendations': 0, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107377638, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Verena Bolliger', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107378781', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: I fear that Americans aren't prepared for what happens when an authoritarian government emerges from a democratic system. This much is certain - the Trump White House will stop at nothing to steal this election, and if it loses it will blame voter fraud, illegal immigrants etc and refuse to accept the results. What happens then? What if the GOP still stay silent? What if Trump urges his base to use their "2nd amendment rights" to resist the "deep state coup"? Voting is a necessary first step but it will not remove a fascist authoritarian from office.

Why doesn't Trump just cut to the chase and come out with his henchmen Barr and that military mutt , dressed in White Hoods?

Just get it over with.

We know what you're about.

So our beloved leader wants his own Tianamen Square?  The tree of liberty must be replenished from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants. It is it’s natural manure. Any deployment of troops by our beloved leader should be met with resistance.

“He did not pray,” said Mariann E. Budde, the Episcopal bishop of Washington.

I have it from inside sources this is not entirely correct.  It is said he did pray.  He said: "Thank you Lord for providing this small Bible so that it will fit inside my hand and make me look like the pious man you know I am not.  But Lord, I try, I want to be the first President to be a Saint, help me Lord,  want to be greater than the Lord yourself--don't take this the wrong way, you're a very good Lord, but I am even better.  And Lord please bless my family finances, and of course, my family too, please also make Ivanka a saint, she's better than that Mother Teresa whatever, and Jared, he makes St. Francis look like a fraud--Jared's much more humble.  All the Trump family is humble, we started humbly with only a few $million anyhow--.  And thank you for providing all these no-nonsense police, and the batons they swing and the rubber bullets they shoot and the tear gas they throw--a President can't take a simple walk outside without them--oK, time to go back to the White House, I want to see myself on the news in the few minutes, please keep the wind down till I get back so it doesn't mess up my hair, Thanks Lord."

Trump has resorted to the ultimate delusional outrage of holding high a Bible to proclaim he has the right to kill under God. He is alluding to the Apocalypse and the battle of Armeggeddon. He is wrong.
Seriously, Donnie needs to be quiet.  Adding ignorance to a conflict is like adding gasoline to a fire.

Only Donald Trump is so afraid of his fellow citizens that he was unwilling to walk from the White House to a nearby church without the police clearing away peaceful protesters with tear gas and flash grenades.

Can you imagine any other President acting in such a craven manner? (Even Richard Nixon went out in the middle of the night and met at length with antiwar protesters.)

And all for the most shameless of photo-ops....

I know it’s a serious matter, but that photo of a scowling overweight Trump in his frumpy suit holding up the Bible In front of the church, caused me to belly laugh.  It is one of the funniest photos I have ever seen.

I think young people realize innately that now is the time to make the country they want for themselves and their children on issues of race, income inequality, climate change. From this upheaval of mass protests, economic depression, and pandemic disease, a new world will emerge. One that is better than what we have now.

Looks like Americans are finally getting it, they are being farmed like cattle. Algorithms reveal the ratio of citizen assets to CEO's and wealthy elites required to keep them living in opulence. Feed them enough to allow them to keep producing wealth and slap down those that threaten the herd from within. Neiman Marcus, J C Penny, Hertz old established ranches having thousands of workers fed minimum wage could not weather a few months shut down. The owners and CEO's harvested billions and left town leaving the herds to survive as best they can or die of hunger.

These are no longer protests. Looting and arson are criminal acts. National Guard needs to be brought into the Bronx now. Not this afternoon, not tonight, but right now. The police were completely overwhelmed on Fordham Road last night. One more night of this, and the Bronx will be back to where it was in 1978. Forty years of progress and rebuilding destroyed by criminals with no one to stop them.

commentBody:
Meanwhile, Senate Republicans are monitoring Ruth Bader Ginsburg's health and thinking about her successor on the Supreme Court. 

Monomaniacs don't deviate. That is the problem here. In order to bring about reactionary, originalist control of the Supreme Court, who could have imagined that Senate Republicans would acquiesce in destroying their own party by making a Faustian bargain with Donald Trump?

Sadly and regrettably what the last few days have shown is this: it doesn't take more than a 100,000 people to storm into the White House and drag the chair out with the  President still sitting in it. Bullets or no bullets. Tear gas or no tear gas. Vicious dogs or no vicious dogs. Sad. Very sad. This is not beautiful.

commentBody:
Do you really think Trump marching over to a church with Bill Barr marching not far behind was for a photo shoot?   

Trump gave himself the opportunity to use the police and armed forces to continue his scare and bullying tactics by putting the police in the situation to use force.   I wonder how the individual officers felt about that?  I wonder how the police forces throughout our country feel about that?  

Another trumped up reason for the photo op would be to create a breach between the legitimate and peaceful protesters of this country and its police and armed forces.  I'm sure he's keenly aware of the police captains and other police who have expressed support for the protesters.    I'm sure Trump is uncomfortable seeing that occur.

Trump instigates chaos for his own benefit.  Like all bullies he's afraid of the size of the crowds who are taking a stand together against the murder of George Floyd and against rampant racism.

Melania, how about if you finally come out and protect the country you're now a citizen of.   Call out your husband's mental imbalance?

7 days of close proximity protests during a pandemic is too much; this has to end.      
Create a clear demarcation for the good protestors and the bad.   
Protests must conclude by 5:00, anyone protesting after 8:00 will be arrested.   

I'm Liberal, I support their cause and understand the anger but last night while my building was preparing for night fall, it struck me: this is nothing more than terrorism on fellow citizens
We are witnessing in Trump a throwback to Bismarck's Germany 150 years ago. Ruling by blut und eisen: Blood and Iron.

There is no bottom to this man.  Every time I think he can not sink lower, he proceeds to do so.  Peaceful protestors tear gassed so that he can emerge from his bunker, stand in front of a church, and wave around a Bible as a prop.  I am at a loss for words.

First, the leader of the country founded on the principles of separation of church and state should not be waving the Bible around as if it's the Constitution (and I am a practicing Christian). It wasn't even his Bible and I doubt if he's ever voluntarily read more than a line or two of the book in his entire life. Second, it was extremely rude not to liaise with church officials before just showing up and using a house of God as nothing more than a photo op (he is far, far, far from a regular church goer and nothing about his life demonstrates true Christian values). The demonstrators when he showed up were peaceful. Did he tell them he respects their concerns? No. Did he lead a prayer? No. Did he call on everyone to look into their souls and pray for calm,  for peace, for open hearts and minds, for healing, for tolerance? Of course not. It's sickening how he treats the "Church of the Presidents" as merely a sop to his narcissism and ego.

Trump had time to use a church for a photo op and talk to Putin yesterday as well as threaten to use active duty military against the protesters.  About the only thing missing for him was a round of golf.  Sad days for the nation.  Vote this filth out of office in Nov and begin to restore the nation's honor.

@Raymond.   There are always vultures that take advantage of chaos.  Call them out.  Don’t conflate their actions with those who were justifiably protesting.  That’s exactly what the dividers in this country want.  Surely, you are not for further division!
People go to church to pray and worship, not have photo ops with the Bible after crashing a peaceful demonstration.

Trump spoke to Putin yesterday morning before instructing the Governors to "dominate" and hours before gassing peaceful  protesters and grabbing a bible and calling out the tanks
Every road leads to Putin.

Trump talks about some counties being a laughing stock in the eyes of the World.  But it is the current US President himself who we not only describe as a laughing stock on a daily basis in most democratic countries.  They would in fact be the least of his attributes that have kept us dismayed and beyond words.  Not only now, in these times that would call for a Nation to  come together, and the right method of leadership.  But long before.  Unfortunately now, we really see and care about the hold that this dystopian thug has on the US in its entirety.

There truly is no limit to the despicable behavior of this strong man 'wannabe'. To turn tear gas on peaceful protesters just so he could 'stroll' through the park for the chance to pose in front of a church with a Bible? Somebody needs to lock him up for everybody's safety. He does nothing more than fan the flames. If he wanted a photo op at a church, 10 days ago he demanded that churches open up because they're essential. Where was he on that day? Oh, my bad... he was on the golf course. He is trampling all over first amendment rights even as he thinks he's acting 'presidentially'. I truly think it's time for the 25th Amendment. Let's see if he understands the full scope of that one, since the 1st amendment has him puzzled.

I disappointed in almost everything I read in these pages.  I read little about love; I read little about compassion; I read little about forgiveness.  

I wonder what Dr Martin Luther King would say about these things? Would he be leading the looters who steal from others in the name of justice?  Would he be criticizing the President because he visited a church? Would he encourage people to destroy the country in the name of justice?  

We all know the answer.

commentBody:
Tin soldiers and Nixon coming
We're finally on our own.
This summer I hear the gunning
Four dead in Ohio.

Gotta get down to it
Soldiers are cutting us down
Should have been done long ago
What if you knew here
And found her dead on the ground?
How can you run when you know?

— Neil Young, "Ohio"

Remember when protesters assembled in states capitols carrying assault rifles and demanding their governors liberate their states from stay at home orders? What was Trump doing? Egging them on. Now, when there's a legitimate grievance and understandable protests, Trump threatens to bring in the military. It's one thing to respond aggressively to looting and violence; quite another to clear the streets of peaceful protesters with teargas for a deplorable photo op.

commentBody: Time for China to cut trade with the US as the administration no longer represents the American People.

Trump already took the country very close to its 2nd  civil war, closest since the 1860s. I don't expect almost anything from the Republican party. Mr Trump did that as he is the weakest President ever in US history, hands down,  and never ever engaged in a street fight, forget going to the war in Vietnam. He is having a very distorted upbringing where hired goons and lpaid lawyers fought for him, as he is doing now using his core support base. 

I do expect that Democrats to step up its game, fully politicize the issue as it rightly deserves. I am more than confident that the majority of White voters would support it and almost all, maybe 95-98% of minorities, would wholeheartedly support it. Failing to do so would only embolden Trump and his party and that would lead us to a full-fledged civil war.

Viruses are sentient and choose who they infect!

The virus can tell the difference you see; the barber and the dude in the chair will both die if they have the temerity to get or give a haircut.  You'll die if you sit in a bar on a stool 2' away from the next guy who is also drinking a beer.

But if you're waving signs and marching, setting buildings on fire, throwing bricks through windows that magically appeared right where you might want to find one, burning cop cars or stealing flat-screen TVs then the virus won't infect you.  It knows you're politically correct and doing a "good thing" and as a result it will leave you alone.

commentBody:
Trump is a desperate, frightened, malignant narcissist who sees that his prospects for reelection are fading fast.

Predictably, he will seize on any opportunity to further stoke the racial animosity that animates his base.

He has one, and only one, goal and concern:  to get himself reelected.  And he will do absolutely anything to achieve that end.

At this point, he is a clear and present danger to this country.  There will be no bottom to his depravity.

May God help us all survive until November.

Simply appalling. Decades ago, I was a Republican, back when they stood for free markets and free choices. When they veered off into right-wing proselytizing, I identified as a libertarian and became a never-Trumper. Yesterday was the last straw. We can't have a reasonable debate over policies until we defeat fascism, which is what we're facing. So I'm joining the Resistance, if you'll have an old man who has finally seen the ugly truth.

It is not in Trump’s interest for this to de-escalate. It’s not in his interest for Governor’s to get control of the situation. What is in his interest is more chaos so has a stage to act out his core mode: domination. But of course since all bullies are actually scared, he’d rather have his MAGA cultists do his dirty work - thus the nod to 2nd amendment in his church photo op.
Note that all the police are white.
Cue the military, mounted police, tear gas, incite riot. Cameras, action... Photo op. This is far from MAGA, this is just a horrific reality show and we are all members of his cast.

A hundred years ago, an American roused the conscience of the peoples of the World, saying ‘For Evil to flourish it only needs Good men to do nothing.’ The peoples of the World expect no better from an Evil Tyrant Trump to speak up for Justice. Neither has the mainstream US Media, muffled in its self-chained role of sensational reporting, the moral character to speak up for Justice. It is the protestors alone, common American protestors alone, who have fearlessly lofted alight the torch of Justice & Liberty for the past 7 days in the US. The peoples of the Free World SALUTE - not hidden indoors Barack Obama, not silent Bill Clinton -  the bold protestors in the streets.

I feel like I'm watching one of those blowout college football games and somehow Trump has the ball, but he takes off in the wrong direction and can't hear his teammates yelling that he is going the wrong way; he waves back at them with a big grin and a thumbs up and is thinking "I'm so good they aren't even trying to catch me now." He crosses the wrong goal line and gets into it with the refs tell who tell him what has happened. He threatens to sue them and then says he will fire them all. 
Another day in the life of a pretend wartime "president".

This is how things come apart. When circumstances have a head on collision with the realities of biology. As Richard Feynman wrote after the Space Shuttle Challenger exploded, "For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for Nature cannot be fooled." So here we have the circumstance of a brutal police killing that could not have been more ill-timed. And then crowds gathering too closely just as some place were making progress with quelling the virus. And then Trump, whose twisted, sick governance places his own warped "public relations" above everything. This is a very, very dangerous cocktail being shaken.

Trump already took as very close to a civil war, closest since the 1860s. I don't expect almost anything from the Republican party. and he did that as he is the weakest President ever in US history and never ever engaged in a street fight, forget going to any war in Vietnam. He is having a very distorted upbringing where hired goons and lawyers barked for him, as he is doing now using his core support base. 

I do expect that Democrats to step up its game, fully politicize the issue as it rightly deserves. I am more than confident that the majority of White voters would support it and almost all, maybe 95-98% of minorities, would wholeheartedly support it.

“Authorities Use Tear Gas So President Can Pose for Photo”

In your wildest imagination did you ever dream you would read a headline like that - in an American newspaper?

We need a TRUE LEADER in this country.

Get out on November 3rd and VOTE!!!

I finally saw the clip of Mr. Trump’s walk to St. John’s church.  My God - he always makes things worse. This was worse than his Charlottesville rant at Trump Tower.  That he sent Mr. Barr over as the “canary in the coal mine”....and the only people that he could get to walk with him were his kids.....having police clear out a peaceful protest with tear gas....posing with a Bible in his hand.  Did he even mention Mr. Floyd’s name in his Rose Garden remarks?  Once again, Mr. Trump demonstrates that it’s all about his ego. 

Donate, volunteer, vote. Less than 160 days until Election Day.
