commentBody:
We have to talk about the split in American Christianity after the Civil War that came to a head during the Civil Rights Movement. Only then will the photo op make sense.

The Republican Party married the neo-confederates in the 60’s, and in doing so hitched itself to the Southern version of Christianity, which is based on the Old Testament prophets who lived with their concubines and wives in the same homes — that’s Southern plantation life. The only person who mattered in this system was the white master. Slave women were routinely raped and everyone knew the “light-skinned” children they bore were fathered by the master. White wives just had to be still and silent about it, raising sons to be just like their fathers.

During slavery, slaves and whites attended church together. This was of course to keep slaves from going behind the master’s back. But after the civil war, the two races stopped attending church together; and the newly freed slaves, though they’d learned the evangelical tradition from white Southern mostly Baptist churches, adopted a more progressive Christianity. The end of slavery meant the end of paternalistic Southern churches.

So what did white Southern churches do in response? Employed “end days” doctrine to preach that “Yankee liberals” and the slaves they freed were at best misguided and at worst satanic, and that a coming holy war would remedy it. Trump using the military to clear the way for him to hold up a Bible signifies that the war is here.
Authorities used year has against rioters that tried to burn down a church.  isn't burning down churches a hate crime?

commentBody: none of this should come as a surprise to anyone. trumps' steady, relentless assault on the constitution and the rule of law have now become prologue to things to come. a perscient observer once predicted that trump would have the country in flames before the end of his term.

When your president has Federal forces commit violence for his political advantage, as he did last night, the time has come for the world to reconsider precisely what sort of nation the United States now is.

Trump wouldn’t use the federal government to save Americans from ￼the worst pandemic in living memory and massive unemployment but he’ll use it to dominate protesters exercising their 1st Amendment rights.  Seems about right where we expected to be at this point in Trump’s presidency.

Like so many, I am very sad and very angry. But for the first time in a long time, I am also a little bit hopeful. In these protests, I see America rising. 

The stakes of the next election couldn’t be clearer. It will not be Democrat or Republican this time. It will be Democracy or Authoritarianism. 

Be sad. Be angry. And show up to vote in November. This is our last chance.

commentBody:
Many rational Americans voted for the imPOTUS because they felt he'd shake things up, and not do business in the normal way...

Is this what you were looking for ?
Can we please stop the madness....I can't take much more of 2020.
I’m surprised he didn’t burst into flames when he picked up that strange thing people call Bible.

Trump who watches so much Television would do well to watch the final episode of Homeland (Season 7) in which a divisive President Keane resigns before the Nation on national TV for the country's good. 
C'mon Pres. Trump - How about taking one for the Team ?
History will treat you much kinder.

Facism: " a form of far-right, authoritarian ultranationalism characterized by dictatorial power, forcible suppression of opposition, as well as strong regimentation of society and of the economy"  

Remind you of anyone?
Sweden and Colin Kaepernick look more intelligent every day.

Off Topic: Rioting/Harlem No Rioting
Subject: Harlem
Please Relay: NOVEMBERYANKEETANGO
To: Harlem Officials and Residents

"The Little Dictator/The Cameleon/Christine Deleon(Berdache)

Will be in Harlem (APOLLO THEATER) Noonish on 06/03/2020. No Riots Please

“If there is no struggle there is no progress. Those who profess to favor freedom and yet deprecate agitation are men who want crops without plowing up the ground; they want rain without thunder and lightning. They want the ocean without the awful roar of its many waters.

This struggle may be a moral one, or it may be a physical one, and it may be both moral and physical, but it must be a struggle. Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will. Find out just what any people will quietly submit to and you have found out the exact measure of injustice and wrong which will be imposed upon them, and these will continue till they are resisted with either words or blows, or with both. The limits of tyrants are prescribed by the endurance of those whom they oppress.”

— Frederick Douglass, August 3, 1857
He always makes things worse, and he knows what he’s doing. He’s doing it on purpose. He doesn’t care about riots or any of underlying issues. This is all about his fragile ego and getting reelected.

Media, please ask every GOP politician: “Do you support the president of the United States and US Attorney General tear-gassing a peaceful crowd of protesters for a photo-op of POTUS standing in front of a church hoisting a Bible over his head”? It wasn’t even a good photo-op since he handled the bible prop like he had barely touched one his entire life; he’s so much more comfortable hawking steaks, wine, trump properties, etc.

The president ordered the military clear the path from people exercising their First Amendment Rights for his Photo Op.

He is the Commander in Chief, but the military why is the military carrying out illegal orders? Are they weighing insubordination over defending the Constitution?  I thought it was clear - they defend the Constitution, even if it means insubordination.

Headlines set the cognitive stage for reading a news article, and The Times caught righteous rage and scorn over the shocking right-wing skew of its headlines last night.  In the midst of events which could set the stage for yet another turn toward white authoritarian rule, how many minds were grabbed by those headlines?  Despair is rising.

Where are the Democrats and Republicans in Congress?  They are all silent.  This President is doing a dry run for "ruling" this country.  The stage is being set up for martial-law.  Where are our elected officials?  If this wasn't a case another case for removal from office, I don't know what is.  Get back to work and do something!  This madness leading us to a third-rate dictatorship has got to stop.

All we people are getting are images of chaos and burning. All across this country people are gathering, and placing their lives at risk, because our police continue to behave like thugs and murders—and we still get the same empty promises and meaningless gestures from our politicians.

In that sequence, and it that sequence only.

The USA has not even got the first step right, after 250 years of so-called "independence".

"My Country Tis of They People you're dying".

commentBody: " If It Bleeds It Leads " is an old newspaper saying and it is 100% true. Without all the ongoing conflict and violence how many of you think the national media would still be covering this story ? They have been letting these murders by the police go on and on forever. Anyone remember Michael Stewart who was murdered by Transit police at Union Square for graffiti back in the 80s well I do because I was living in the East Village and people I knew were his friends and liked him. Another one in a long line of police murders of young Black men and women and there have been so many like that since then. For once they are not going to be allowed to move on and hope the public forgets until there is another one.

What kind of weak mind falls for these staged photo ops? There is absolutely no indication this man is religious in any way; he is the personification of the seven deadly sins!

I just don’t get his followers, and for that I am grateful my mind doesn’t go in that direction.

The civil unrest is justified. Trump just fans the flames.  But wait
until Trump refuses to leave office and declares martial law.

The civil unrest following that be justified and magnified.

Mike

When the dust settles, will Mitch McConnell and all the other Republican Senators get up from fetal position and do something for the country? Is there any reason that they should be receiving a pay-check, let alone be permitted to continue hold the formerly honorable position of U.S. Senator? Except for their usual inexorable efforts to provide welfare for the rich, they've really accomplished nothing for the nation and average Americans since Obama was elected (by the people/popular vote..unlike the last two Republican Presidents.) Do they not at least have enough personal pride to not want to bring such shame to their families?

commentBody: Gassing innocent people, suppressing free speech and peaceful protest, knee on the throat of democracy, We cannot breathe

Trump is suddenly more concerned with the Chinese -made junk 

in the stores that he is with Americans who have the right to 

protest.

Well, at least the protest is Made in America. 

And what's with the Police standing about showing off their clean pressed Mr. Military garb?  Instead of preening with your toys on the bridges and the interstates, where I'm fairly sure not much looting takes place, go guard the Walmart and the Target so all that Chinese made junk doesn't get hurt.

Looked  “ like a bunch of jerks” led by a stable genius, staging a coup. An “iconic” forever photo in real time,  of ownership of a rogue, lawless  Republican Party and Administration . I am looking for our Governors to be our line of defense to hold the line and create a safe space to begin reforms and a fare and equal process for voting. Oh.....and btw next time genius, at least hold the Bible right side up for your iconic photo. I fear for our future if we fail to hold the line long enough to invert our Democracy from Me to We. The tyranny of now is pressing, We Can’t Breath.

What repulsive person thought it was a good idea for the most immoral president ever to hold a bible in front of a church?  Is anyone in this country stupid enough to  believe that a bible is ever something Trump would carry except as a political prop?  If he opened it up it would surely be upside down.

commentBody:
I remember the demonstration of the white supremacists and the counter demonstration by those who opposed the nazi-esque and white supremacists which resulted in many injured and one person killed.
Our glorious leader went on television and proclaimed there are good people on both sides.  What better way to unite the country-an imbecilic statement at best.
And his theatrical show at the church with a book he possibly has never read in his hand.  Quite the show.  

Now, the inciter further pours fuel on a conflagration with his statements of the use of military force on the people of this country.  Our military.

But, perhaps Trump sees himself as the authoritarian that has free rein to have our military engage the citizens of this country in a shooting spree.

Let the local authorities do their jobs.  They don’t need to listen to the rantings of Trump and don’t have time to engage in conversation with Trump.

Go back to the bunker, Mr. President.  You are not helping solve the issue.

Trump is no friend of the military, he has attacked them at every turn with his comments. If he gives orders to the military to suppress the protest the military needs to stand down. Only then can this tyrant be stopped.
The photo that will live in infamy. What a sick man in a position of great power.  Neuter him NOW.

Trump wants the voters to forget the covid19 dead and all the unemployed Americans. 

Trumps tweets are about that!

commentBody: A fascist embracing the Church for political reasons.  Franco would be pleased.
Dear US friends, please send this "president" where he belongs to. And this is not the Whitew House! Force his resignation. This person is a danger for the whole free world!

Trump supporters on this comment board last night expressed explicit approval of Donald Trump tear-gassing and shooting Americans who were doing nothing more than expressing their First Amendment right to peacefully assemble. They were not looting, or rioting. They were not breaking curfew. They were just existing between Donald Trump and his photo-op, which the church itself and even the national diocese expressly immediately condemned, as did countless active and former military officials. 

Do not ever forget who--and what--Trump supporters are: fascists. They believe that if you disagree with Donald Trump, you lose your constitutional rights and should be maimed or killed. 

Donald Trump and his brownshirts declared war on America yesterday. Which side are you on?

Masked and heavily armed militias stormed a state capital, to intimidate elected officials: Trump praised them. 

Unarmed demonstrators chanted in a park across from the White House: Trump unleashed the military.  

The contrast says everything about this tinpot despot and his lackeys.
It's news from the TDS paper !

Trump had his chance for peaceful demonstrations earlier in office. At the suggestion of his Special Forces teammate, Colin Kaepernick knelt during the National Anthem to protest racism. But Trump, his billionaire team owners, and his fawning press allies couldn’t leave it alone, pandering to His naive audience. 

He is like child in so many ways, this time picking at the scab, never allowing it to heal. As demonstrated so often, he is unwilling to learn, especially when he thinks it will energize his “base”.
What are  the people in the Senate and the House saying and doing?  Can someone report on that please?
No, the headline should have read, "President poses for photo so he can use tear gas on protesters."

Last November, the Atlantic carried a piece on Generals who had been critical of 45, including AF Gen. Mcraven. They now must speak up. The military can't shoot citizens. America is not the Philippines, El Salvador. We in Europe are in shock and it's difficult to watch the mayhem, especially when 45 violated the start of the curfew in DC to photo op at a church! I used to live in Amsterdam, Berlin and last night's vigil there was unreal. Nearly 10 000 people came together. The Bible and the Sword = Fascism.

We pay taxes to support this con artist/ grifter and crew.  That doesn't even count all his GOP enabler bobbleheads.
I've worked hard, opened and ran businesses my entire adult life.  My point here is we've all contributed and many with much more than their tax dollars.  Much more.
Why am I or anyone else paying taxes to support this madness and thievery?  
When we actually get a government back I'll be more than happy to once again start paying just like I have for decades.  Why should we pay to keep the lights on in donalds WH basement where he cowers in fear over some protesters calling him names.  Bone Spurs must be acting up again.
Besides when this debacle is over with we're all going to need every dime we have just to survive.

commentBody: Nice to see that Our Dear Leader could take time away from his busy day of mean Tweeting to terrorize Americans exercising their first amendment right to peaceably assemble.   He and the looters at least have that in common (though the latter are probably better behaved on Twitter).

“....then I will deploy the United States military and quickly solve the problem for them.”.”

Well, I’m glad to see that Trump’s statements concerning a use of force is being heeded.
Now that in some cities the rioters are shooting at police officers and civilians, what will Trump’s use of force consist of-Apache helicopters, armed drones and perhaps a couple of AC-130 gunships?

These opportunists that are not protesting for change and are using the protests to loot stores and shops need to be stopped and the curfews imposed are not preventing much of the looting.
But, is violence the answer, particularly from our military on our soil?
I can't wait to vote Trump and his whole family out of office!

What does it say that trump was on the phone with BFF Putin to get orders - or is it advice - and sharing a laugh just before tearing into governors and ordering them to use military force on American citizens to then a few hours later showed them how by brutally clearing a peaceful protest of youngsters - oh how he envies the young - for a perverse selfie in front of a church he has never attended holding up a nondescript book, like an updated Old Testament - the Neo-Testament as spoken by the trump their god.

In spite of all the tear gas he assaulted citizens with, he shed not a tear. A monstrous deity indeed.

Under trump, law enforcement feels emboldened to thuggishly brutalize citizens knowing the thug in chief has their backs - indeed HE TOLD THEM TO BRUTALIZE CITIZENS! Promises made, promises kept.

If Trump really wants to show what a 'tough guy' President he should try strolling through Lafayette park without clearing the path with tear gas and rubber bullets and leave the Secret Service agents back at the White House. His bravery would impress the world.

This is our new Kent State, Groundhog Day Style. Dante wrote about this, centuries ago. It must end. We must be one people -- humans, with life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, with equality for all, one world, an extended family, from sea to shining sea all around the world. The occupation by the 1%, the use of troops against the people, the denial of basic rights including food, housing and education must stop. Black Lives Matter. Human Lives Matter. Don't let this moment pass. There should be no hate in the world and the people who spread hate need to shunned until they repent.

Watched in horror the behavior of the President of  United States only because he wanted to go to the Epispocal Church not to show humility and pray but for a photo-op.

There was a peaceful demonstration because of the brutal execution of George Floyd in broad daylight .
Instead of showing empathy and humility trump just wanted a photo-op holding a Bible when the Church was closed.

 Police used tear gas and flash grenades to disperse peaceful protesters before the curfew started.

Please all register and vote this man out of the Office.

A Gideon Bible, “ borrowed “ from one of his Hotels.
   A Campaign Stunt, while America Burns.
       Great Job, very stable genius.
                  NOVEMBER.

"Have you no sense of decency, sir? At long last, have you left no sense of decency?"

This question was asked about 46 years ago to the day but it's worth asking again.

commentBody: Don't take it for granted it was a Bible. Could have have been just a black leather covered notebook for all we know. Remember all those folders displayed at Trump Tower showing he has divested himself from his companies? Nothing but empty blank pages inside. Reporters should ask him to see the Bible physically.  Start calling out his cons for everyone to see. For all I know, it could have been his personal notebook containing phone numbers, including Stormy's.

The First Amendment to the United States Constitution enshrines in law "the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances."

Forget Russia, forget cronyism and encouraging China to spy on political opponents. Using police power to disperse a crowd that is exercising their fundamental rights as citizens of this country is the ultimate abuse.

Watching him parade across the street, trailed by a bunch of his in-crowd as the police clear the undesirables out of the way... I can't help but think we could just as easily be looking at Maduro or Kim or Assad.

Remember, remember, the 3rd of November.
Make certain that Trump and every Republican member of the Senate and House goes down to the humiliating defeat they deserve in November.  The future of our nation depends on it!

commentBody: Which national guard leader ordered his troops to gas peaceful demonstrators?   That officer is guilty of a crime and should be exposed.  Obeying unlawful orders, even from the president, is not to be tolerated.  There is sufficient history of such acts by military and they should have consequences

A police force dressed as robocops, following orders to fire tear gas and rubber bullets without provocation aimed at law abiding fellow citizens has forfeited their right to bear arms in the line of duty.

It appears that soon the military will also abandon all honor and credibility by firing on and attacking citizens on the orders of a military state in support of Trump and not America or the citizenry. 

It did not take long to squander the honor of America, its politicians, now its police and soon its military.  How can Mattis remain silent?  Where are elder statesman that should be standing up for their country in its time of need?  A revolting man uses force- tear gas and rubber bullets to clear law abiding citizens from Dear Leader's path to kneel on the throat of America, bible in hand.

He still can't cite his favorite passage from the Bible. Even as a lapsed Catholic I could have faked it better than that (who doesn't know a few commandments?). November can't come soon enough. The Republican party has no credibility.

You can bet the staged photo-op image of Trump, standing tall and proud on his shoe-lifts and holding a Bible aloft like Lady Liberty's torch, will be revered by the zombified followers of this evil false god.    

Fake gold coins will be available soon.
In the United States of Trump the First Amendment provision for freedom of assembly is eradicated.

I would like to vote for a Republican in the next election, but I cannot in good conscience vote for Trump.  

I have always voted Dem.  Seeing the response of my party allowing cities to become unsafe and small businesses to be destroyed- first by COVID closures with incomplete support and now by gangs of looters.  I no longer think the Dem party can protect my interests. Why do I need to stay indoors for months and uproot my professional life, but as soon as minorities are angry, crowds can congregate again? Why do I pay high, liberal city taxes and not commit crimes so that the police cars my money bought can be fire bombed and denigrated? And all without consequence to the criminals- rather, the goal is appeasement.  I have had this conversation with other, life-long Dem friends who agree that the social covenant has been violated and we need a new party. 

A moderate Republican (Mitt Romney comes to mind) running as a third party candidate would have my vote.

commentBody:
Wake up, America! There is no need to cry for Argentina, or Hong Kong, or North Korea. Cry for democracy in the United States of America. When the commander-in-chief ordered his military to attack a group of unarmed citizens demonstrating peacefully in Lafayette Park (the irony) and threatened to use the same overwhelming force against any group of protesters he disapproves of, a large part of democracy in America died yesterday. 
I'm not a revolutionary, or a member of a "terrorist" group. And I'm appalled at the thought of a military coup in the United States. But I can only hope that when the commander-in-chief orders his troops to attack a group of unarmed civilians gathered to protest racism in America, that commanders throughout the military establishment will give careful consideration to whether this is a lawful order from their commander. 
The rule of law is no longer prevalent in the United States. It is now the rule of domination.

commentBody:
The president showed how quickly dangerous and lawless riotous environments can be corrected when there is a will to do so and that areas that have looting, rioting, and vandalism do so by choice.

Protesting within the law is repected.  Violating the right of others by blocking streets, rioting, harassing law enforcement is illegally and I DO NOT respect that.

The president showed that an area where arson and lawlessness one day earlier presented danger to life and property was now safe for himself and his staff to walk to.

I strongly expect protesters were given an opportunity to leave prior to any force being used.  When you are acting outside the law, expect forceful intervention if you do not cooperate.

commentBody: Now add “blasphemer” to the list of our pretended leader’s failings.

What I remember from childhood teachings from religious leaders - whether mainstream protestant, non-denomination protestant or Catholic teachers - was that Christianity does not permit worship of false idols.  

Trump's orchestrated use of force against peaceful protesters was nothing more than an invitation to his cult followers to worship a false idol.

He is the FAKE idol.

commentBody: This morning I'm reminded of Leonard Cohen's verse: "I can't run no more with that lawless crowd while the killers in high places say their prayers out loud. But they've summoned, they've summoned up a thundercloud and they're going to hear from me."

There are those reading these comments because they  want to understand the motivations of the protestors, the cause of this unrest, and the roots of the problems that must be addressed so that justice, peace, and civility can return to our communities.  Then there are those who have no understanding and do not wish to understand.  The former are the commentors who write about justice, peace, fairness, and inclusion for all US citizens on both sides of this debate. 
The latter are those who wonder why more force isn't being used to once again silence and sideline the most oppressed members of our own communities.
 
The most enlightening news reports I have seen this week are those that those that show how peaceful protests can be most effective in catalyzing change and bringing people together in their communities.  Camden, New Jersey, Flint, Michigan, and Kansas City Missouri are models of how protestors and police can be respectful towards each other and start a constructive dialogue that will begin the process of healing our communities.

Unfortunately, one of the root causes that continues to exacerbate the violence and unrest and perpetuate the problems in our society that have led our nation to this point is the president and his followers that can no longer be called anything but a fascist authoritarian cult.  This man has been a danger to our nation for years and as long as he promotes racism, divisiveness, and white supremacy, this nation can not even begin to heal.

Once again, the words and actions of the president do not speak to the underlying cause of the unrest in this country, to the sadness and worry or to reaching a peaceful and lasting solution. No, once again, it was all about him, about what he was going to do about the violence and looting. It was all about him and how he was sending the military and about how he was going to save us all.

God help us. He is not saving us. He is destroying what little is left of reason and sense in this country.

“Then Jesus, seeing the suffering of the people, said to his disciples, Come, let us arise and go tear gas the people so that we may get a clear photo op of me before the church so that all will know that I am the chosen one of God.”

The insurrection I worry about is happening in the White House and the Attorney General’s office. 
I bet Mitch and his Republican posse are starting to rethink their impeachment retreat.

There are Republicans who will not speak up against how divisive, inflammatory and unfit this president is but believe it to be true. Why?

When will it be enough to speak up?

commentBody: The comments so far and still to come from Trump supporters leave absolutely no doubt which side they would have been on in Germany in the 1930s. Trump and his brownshirt supporters consider America the Fourth Reich.

A knee knelt on the ground in silent protest brought outrage from Trump and cost a moral/integrity-filled man his career.  But a knew knelt/forced on a human being's neck provokes not outrage from Trump but tear gas?

Where are our leaders?  Where's the majority of 1 who stands and says "America, take a knee..."  A national protest of all who hate.  We're a leaderless country.

Trump is truly tone deaf. Most of the major retailers and city leaders are responding to the violence with positive support for the protesters and changing the justice system. The picture of Trump with cops in riot gear are a perfect snapshot of the basic problem. Trump is enforcing white supremacy and announcing no reforms whatsoever. The Civil War was already fought over this matter, and we have waited long enough for every last person in this country to walk free in a peaceful, equitable society. Instead, Trump wants to keep fighting the Civil War in the name of the Confederate flag-a flag carried with pride at his rallies.
Eyes on the prize, guys. Trump will get fractally nastier as the election approaches. Of that we can be certain. Refuse to be distracted, stick to facts and vote blue in November.
@Ed L— Cowering.  Or secure, surrounded by the military.  Or “in the counting house, counting all their money.”

Your President last night essential declared a military state to be run by the federal government which is now comprised of a cowed Senate and an imbalanced Supreme Court and a Congress he wilfully ignores.  While he spoke of empathy for Floyd George, he did it as a prelude to the real objective: an electoral campaign stunt:speaking to his base while carrying a bible in hand.  The irony of this "beautiful law" is that he is justifying and supporting it by relying on the 2nd amendment.  The real reason for that amendment and the right to bear arms was to protect against the creation of a monarchy.  Be careful this is not a test run for November if he loses or you have a repeat of the Bush/Gore election or better yet, if he suspends the election in the name of emergency.  Too bad he wasn't this quick to move during the pandemic.

Trump and his base confuse “winning” and “whining”. 

The spelling is close, so....

If there's a silver lining here it's that his manufactured photo-op backfired.

To all Trump-voting Christians who haven't figured it out yet, he uses the Bible as a prop -- as he uses you and your vote to consolidate his own power. But his lip service to your "religious freedom" is just show biz. Bishop Budde is the voice of authority on what happened yesterday, not Donald Trump.

A larger concern in the long run -- since we're approaching an election to which his threats and actions seem prelude -- is that once again Trump has tested the limits of his (abusive) power and won. The police obeyed him and used unnecessary force (ironically, the original cause of these protests) to disperse peaceful, lawfully-assembled protesters. 

It's time for the people Trump conscripts to do his dirty work -- armed civilians and law enforcement alike -- to heed the advice of a prominent Republican former First Lady and Just Say No.

Refuse
Resist
11/3/2020

Wow NYT.

You have a whole section describing injured police, but nothing about the violence they are bringing to all of these protests? 

Great reporting...

The White House later released a tidy little propaganda film of this walk across the street on Twitter, where you see him leave the WH, walk past the cops in their riot gear and pose for photos. 

Leni Riefenstahl it was not, but still horrifying nonetheless. Our tax payer dollars at work!
Sorry, you don't just get to go around destroying things in a civilized country. That is NOT protest! This is getting out of hand, get them off the street!

commentBody: not once has trump mentioned or even referred to reforming the behavior of police, the precise reason for the protest.  he did warn that he would invoke strong police/ military force to restore law and order to keep stores and police safe from protesters. his priorities area very clear. to him, black lives do not matter. and, god save the businesses.
I am surprised that Bible didn't burst into flames.
So many law and order folks out here. I can hear the Birther King shouting "Disperse, ye rebels, disperse!"

Every member of Congress, past and present, every former President, and every former military leader (looking at you, Mattis, Kelly, McMaster) should be on their way to Washington DC to stand peacefully with these protesters so that this junta will realize that using force against American citizens will not be tolerated.

I think it's pretty obvious why Trump supporters are vocally approving of their leader's gassing fellow citizens because of their beliefs: One of Trump supporters' other heroes did the same thing in Germany in the 1930s and 40s.
I live in Dallas. The curfew was not citywide. It was confined to specific areas. The protestors stayed just on the edge of the curfew zone but never entered it.
It’s time for the military to say “no”.

This is exactly what character matters when we choose our leaders. 
Period.
Now would be a good time to read Naomi Klein's "Shock Doctrine." We're living in it.

Holding on to a Bible for a photo op after clearing the way with flash-bang grenades and tear gas. That's "domination" in action! 

If I recall correctly, there might be some useful 'policy guidelines' inside the book such as:
Blessed are the peacemakers, humble in spirit, pure in heart etc.

If you're going to reference the Bible, walk the talk.
Seen from England it's difficult to quantify just how President Trump has "Made America Great Again".

commentBody: I worry that the health plan he promised to put in place of the ACA he was ripping apart will not get done in time.

Of the over 4500 comments in the largest reader comment string that the “Times” ever published, it is notable that fewer than 10 comments mentioned the word Empire or Emperor.

Of note, among the founders and framers of the first American Declaration of Independence and the first “Revolution Against Empire” [Justin du Rivage 2014] it was commonly understood that “the disease (cancer) of Republics was Empire”.

When the admired Roman Republic declined to being an Empire, and the first Roman Emperor was installed, the metastasis of cancer in the Roman citizens’ government and ‘body politic’ could not be arrested — because the cancer of Empire had become terminal.

Let us ‘the American people’ understand and endeavor to learn from history, as George Santayana and Louis Brandeis both combined, knew, and pleaded to the people:

“We must learn from history or be doomed to repeat it” and ..

 “We can have democracy in this country, or we can have great wealth concentrated in the hands of a few, but we can't have both."

commentBody:
Trump's call for the military to quell the protests will only encourage protesters.  That  will cause an increase in Covid-19 cases.  He knows that and will use it as an excuse to declare martial law saying he is compelled to  protect public health and stopping rioters from destroying property.  He will say he warned everyone and doesn't have other options to keep the peace.  

As the November election gets closer he will further say he alone has a duty to uphold the constitution saying the mail in ballots are unlawful, therefore until the states change their voting to in person, the election is postponed.  

Don't think the letter of the law enshrined in the constitution will stop him.  He has the justice department and the military on his side and has demonstrated he owns them.
It is not very glorious to remain hidden in bunker on Sunday to go out surrounded by a small army and a band of "blessed yes yes" on Monday to show a bible to the nation.

I couldn't sleep last night after watching the president of the United States attack his own American people- peacefully protesting- so that he could show "dominance" and hold a photo op.

We are in big trouble. People better wake up and VOTE like our lives and democracy depend on it.
Soon we'll see the Bible on e-bay as a money maker.
Most importantly,  every single protester must get out and vote to rid our country of trump and as many republicans as possible in November. Voting is the best way to make changes in our society.
Trump saw himself as the President from the movie "Independence Day", the winner against the BLM Extraterrestrials.  Holding the Bible was the original touch.

I encourage everyone to watch the footage of the president in front of the Washington church yesterday. Watch it in its entirety. It was more than a photo op for Trump. 

He will edit the footage for a new campaign commercial. The Bible as prop, the church as backdrop and, as usual, he will be the star.
Another WWE quality act by a former WWE actor.

Trump’s genius in 17 words:

Trump himself is making the case for a Biden presidency and a democratic sweep in the senate 

Joe probably doesn’t need to do much — just continue to let Trump be a “genius”.
That religion can be used by profiteers and strongmen alike is on the head of religion and those who genuflect to superstitious ancient cults.
He held the Bible as an auctioneer holds an item up for bids. Make no mistake, Republicans; he’ll sell out all of you to benefit himself.

A peaceful protest does not mean one that does not cause disruption of any sort. It means it does not involve violence. I’ve seen many “law and order” types pine for the days of MLK Jr. and his leading of peaceful protests. Did Rosa Parks not refuse to move to the back of the bus? Were sit-ins at the lunch counter ended when police asked the protestors to remove themselves? The president is showing how he really feels about the 1st amendment when he decides he wants a photo op and the protestors are in his way. He lies, unsurprisingly, when he claims to be supportive of the protests and only against violence and rioting. Indeed, he invites those protestors to battle. His actions and his words are making this worse, not better, and all citizens need to know this, and remember this come November.
It is a sad reality that nothing but dishonourable conduct is now expected from Mr. Trump.  Perhaps only if he were to do something magnanimous would we be truly surprised by him.

Does it strike anyone else as odd that this may be the first time we've seen the confluence of Donald Trump, a church, and a bible?  And yet he maintains the unwavering support of his "Evangelical" base.  Exactly what religion is it that they follow?  I haven't seen previously seen Racism defined as a branch of the church yet they're doing their best to make it one.

commentBody: The photo op was the new low even for Trump's own standard. While we all know he does not know what is kosher and what is not, I am appalled at his enablers and those around him yesterday that thought a photo op at a burnt down church without any church members was a good idea.

Trump's response to Colin Kapernick's peaceful protest revealed that Trump has been on the wrong side of this debate for a long time.  His made-for-TV presidency is embarrassing to any decent patriotic American.
If I was an evangelist, I would be outraged.

commentBody: The logical next step for the thousands of peaceful protesters- lay down, be arrested, refuse bail, demand a jury trial. From an old book on, the need for reform. Have forgotten the title...circa late 1970s.
To the end he dupes the Evangelical followers already trained to.
154 days to November 3. VOTE!

While I have been  too bitterly angry about the rising powers of Delusional White Supremacists to watch much news, the events of the past days have demanded some attention.  I just heard the John Meacham and  Eugene Robinson condemn the "tactics of dictators" that the Mouth is now employing, and they both said they were more fearful for the survival of the Republic than they have ever been.

So, while the troops and the new Brown Shirts start flooding the streets of our cities, I want to say that all of my despairing anger at the deep betrayal of the Republican Senate in acquitting the Mouth was fully justified.  I knew instantly that, fearless of any check on his power, the Mouth's attempts to undermine a free and fair election would soon devolve into the other, more violent means  in the Facist Playbook deployed; and so last night, in Lafayette Park, there they were... Why are Robinson and Meacham surprised?  

Everyone remembers the last time we had to fight delusional white nationalists, right?  Then they called themselves the Third Reich; and that's where we are heading, for the Mouth will find a way to install himself into the White House again, and the Republican Senate will again cover itself in infamy, and let him.  So,it's goodbye America, and everyone can start planning somewhere in the still-free world to live.

Oh, and thanks ever so much, pusillanimous Romney for your utterly useless, tiny show of resistance.

So we are left to wonder, is there anything that Donald J Trump will not do in order to salvage a chance at reelection?

It seems that he is unlimited.

The time to November will show his potential.

We have not seen it yet.

[{'commentID': 107377333, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107377333, 'userID': 84864628, 'userDisplayName': 'Richard', 'userLocation': 'UK', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@S R 
Power currupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely, so true at this time. The bitter truth is once you start rolling down the hill, it is very difficult to stop, rather every more extreme action seems easier to take. It is the thrill of dictatorship .

Here are ten signs of dictatorship - left or right wing

1. Systematic efforts to intimidate and suppress the media.
2. Building an official pro- dictator media network. 
3. Politicizing the civil service, military, and/or the domestic security agencies.
4. Using government surveillance against domestic political opponents. 
5. Using state power to reward corporate and other backers and punish opponents.
6. Stacking and politicising the Supreme Court and Judicial System
7. Enforcing the law for only one side
8. Really rigging the system. Gerrymandering/ rotten boroughs/ controlling the ballot box
9. Fearmongering.
10. Demonizing the opposition.

Oh dear. are we at 7 out of ten?', 'createDate': '1591101655', 'updateDate': '1591105585', 'approveDate': '1591103276', 'recommendations': 2, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107376872, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'S R', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107377333', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
Are we tired of the greatness yet?  

If you're tearing up, it's not because of happy emotions.  It's more likely pepper spray, tear gas, and COVID-19.  

Or, maybe it's tears owing to the dramatic decline in America's very soul, engineered by just a single chaos president during a single term in office, who was elected by a shockingly large (not nearly a majority, but large enough) naive and ill-informed cohort of voters.  

"As democracy is perfected, the office of president represents, more and more closely, the inner soul of the people. On some great and glorious day the plain folks of the land will reach their heart's desire at last and the White House will be adorned by a downright moron." --H.L. Mencken (1880 - 1956)

As someone said many years ago, "when Fascism comes to America it will be wrapped in the flag and carrying a bible."
If we ever needed more incentive to stand up for America, to speak out against racism and--yes, the fascist impulses of Donald Trump and his sychophants--his stunt yesterday--brazen, cynical and devoid of authenticity--is a blazing call to action.

Any one who thinks that saying Trump is a dictator who wants to be king needs to look no further that this despicable behavior.  It’s appalling.  It’s disgusting and it’s now what happens in the USA.  

This is what the Republics have made.  Don’t let anyone tell you differently.  Trump is a symptom of the policies and philosophies of the Republican Party.

commentBody:
Trump has shown us once and for that he is totally devoid of respect for the citizens of this nation.  Ordering police to physically remove peaceful protesters just so he can have his picture taken in front of a church reveals the depths of his depravity.

Trump brandished a bible as if it were a trophy won in a contest.  To the the faithful, bibles are not won in battle.  They are studied.  They are revered.  They are not used for photo ops as the spoils of conquests.

Trump is showing us exactly who is his.  He is a thug.  He cares only for himself.  He can wrap himself in 1000 bibles, but he will still be a thug.

The USA is no longer a republic. It is a dictatorship with the vague appearance of a republic. It has a president who would like to be Hitler or Mussolini, but the situation is more akin to Caligula. His praetorian guard should provide a solution. They will not. This is a deeply corrupt nation, made more so by a man who is corruption. Christian nation? LOL.

Are you heading for a 21st Century Peterloo Massacre? (Where mounted troops charged a protest crowd with swords drawn).
The aftermath of that was complete suppression of dissent, whilst the soldiers and magistrates were praised by the King. 

Sounds a grim possibility - particularly given the make-up of the Supreme Court

The map of protests is great, but incomplete. Here are just a few more I'm aware of: Manchester, NH: https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/05/30/metro/police-hq-manchester-nh-closed-several-hours-amid-protest/ Jackson, WY: https://buckrail.com/protesters-gather-at-town-square-following-police-brutality-protests-across-the-country/ Burlington, Vermont: https://www.burlingtonfreepress.com/story/news/2020/05/30/george-floyd-burlington-vermont-protest-black-lives-matter/5291271002/
Someone said he's holding the Bible upside down? Is that right? My eyes are not that good..

commentBody: Your headline tells me what I need to know about the NYT: “Police and protesters injured.” Equivalent to you. How many police? How many protesters? How many protesters are dead? How many police? Equivalent? Injured by whom? We’ve all seen at least that one incident of “friendly fire” online, one officer shooting another with tear gas. Injured by whom? How many journalists have been injured? Dozens at last count. The policing system, whose murder and lies have brought us here, still have their interpretation privileged by you. It’s almost as if their lives are worth more than others’.

It's not hard to imagine why the nation is convulsing in violence. Take a guess when these lyrics were recorded:

Rockets, moon shots
Spend it on the have nots
Trigger happy policing
Panic is spreading
God know where we're heading
Oh, make me wanna holler
They don't understand

Marvin Gaye, 1971

Trump is correct in saying the use of force is warranted. 
 Are we to let the arson, looting, bodily injury and shooting and destruction continue until nothing is left?

commentBody: It is very ironic that President Trump threatened military action against US citizens "“if a city or state refuses to take the actions necessary to defend the life and property of their residents," when the protests themselves are about cities and states not protecting their black citizens' lives against police brutality, including repeated shootings of unarmed black men.  Trump has gone off the rails, drunk with the power the Republican Party has given him; a free pass to "do whatever he wants," and telling him he is above the law.  Someone needs to step up before this situation becomes much worse.  Military force against US citizens cannot be condoned, or tolerated.

When will republicans rise up and throw this thug out of office?
We are on the verge of becoming a police state.
China has Hong Kong - Trump now has DC.
We the people have the right to peaceful protest.
The President does not have the right to remove us for a photo-op...Little Trumpet Man and his outlaw administration are the enemy within and should be removed.
This is not insurrection, it is reality.

commentBody: Are you kidding me NYT. This is the last straw with this paper. How on Earth can you take the side of the rioters? Peaceful?? That crowd was anything but peaceful! The Lincoln and WW2 memorials were vandalized. Has your newsroom not seen the murders the mob committed around the country? Many were harder to watch than George Floyd’s terrible death. I and everyone I know thought symbolism for once was on point from the White House. From what I saw over the weekend, Antifa is a bunch of thugs and I will be doing my part to report people who I know are involved to the FBI. I hope anyone associated with Antifa, which are probably half the journalists at the NYT, get multiple years behind bars. Watch the video of that business owner in Austin getting beat to death while a bunch of kids giggled in the camera and tell me that you honestly have respect for the mob. Trump just won re-election after this weekend, or he at least won in Ohio big.

commentBody:
I watched this awful insurgence by the US army unfold right before my eyes. The protesters were literally standing quietly with their hands up ! And before I knew it , I saw police and army officers literally push back on the crowd , then fire tear gas for what looked like no apparent reason. Then we saw this tyrant president defiantly march to the church holding a bible . It was not only bizarre , it was  ANTI AMERICAN . Isn’t this against the law ? Using tear gas to disperse obviously peaceful 
protesters? And yet, it was all because this sad sack of a power hungry narcissist doesn’t care about law and order . 
    Let’s call a spade a spade. Trump doesn’t have authoritative
 “ tendencies “ he IS an authoritarian . Period . 
  And he will do ANYTHING within his authoritarian power and also  NOT within his power to do what he wants . And Barr will back him up . always , legal or not. 
 
  Barr is the highest law officer in our country , yet he has no interest in upholding the law , but rather emboldening  Trump to do what he wants , and Barr considers it his job to find a way to twist the law so Trump can do what he wants , law or no law . 
     With Barr at the helm we are in very dangerous times .

Where is the outrage?
Why don't peole march and burn and loot because of the murder of an Arican American named Dave Underwood?
Who is he you ask?
He is the federal officer shot and killed on Friday while guarding a Federal courthouse.
Should the people enraged by this march and pilage miniority neighborhoods to protest his murder?
Of course not because that is not what civilized people do.

"More than six police officers shot ... Scores more officers were injured when drivers plowed into their ranks"

That is far more serious than Trump  visiting a Church

And yet that, not cops shot at , is the head line

The NY Times is pouring gasoline on the fire

There are a lot of frightened, Fox watching white men who must be lapping up Trump's theatrics right now, who know there is a policing issue that must be addressed but who want to double down instead. Trump used the term "scumbags" sounding just like many locals on social media who are calling the protesters "scum" as they express outrage over the threat to local businesses -- which is all they care about behind their walls of white privilege, unwilling to listen. But mostly they are afraid, because what used to be contained in Watts and its equivalents nationwide has finally actually come to them and their town. All they want to do is contain it, not solve anything. Because they are the system so of course they want to maintain it.

commentBody:
A country where law enforcement, who are supposed to protect & serve, can murder citizens with impunity. A president who calls men storming  a federal building with weapons grade artillery, carrying trump flags, 'Good people' .
But orders tear gas & rubber bullets used on hundreds of young, unarmed, legal protesters holding their hands in the air saying don't shoot, for a photo op. Trump, the would be dictator, is Snow in the Hunger Games personified given the chance.  Make America great again please. Rid the WH of the racist bigot Trump and his enablers like Barr. It matters to America and the world, where all men should be equal.
This is the act of a tyrant.  The military general with him shamed the uniform.

I find it beyond ironic that Episcopal bishop Mariann E. Budde has suddenly found her voice regarding Trump ("He did not pray."  "He did not mention George Floyd, he did not mention the agony of people who have been subjected to this kind of horrific expression of racism and white supremacy for hundreds of years.")

Back in January 2017, a portion of the inauguration ceremonies for Trump took place at the Washington National Cathedral, over which Budde presides.  The Girls' Choir from the National Cathedral School (NCS) has performed for many years at presidential inaugurations, and a decision was made that the Girls' Choir would perform again at the Cathedral for Trump, notwithstanding his public bragging about assaulting women, and well as his many demeaning comments about women -- and over the strenuous objections of some of the members of the Girls' Choir and of many of us who saw such a performance as condoning Trump's misogynistic behavior.  This incident caused a huge uproar and strenuous protests and condemnations inside and outside the NCS community.  Notwithstanding the opprobrium, the Girls' Choir performed.  What a horrible message that decision sent to young females.

Budde was not one of the people who stood up to stop the Girls' Choir performance.  Now, however, she has finally seen with her own eyes what happens when people don't stand up for what is right.  Better late than never, I guess.

105,000 and counting Americans dead from a pandemic he ignored, downplayed, and now pretends has ended. 

40 million Americans out of work because he had no plan to mitigate the effects of the aforementioned pandemic. 

Nearly 20,000 lies and mistruths he has uttered in 3 1/2 years in office. 

Incendiary and racist rhetoric spewed at every opportunity. 

Impeached for extorting a foreign government to further his own political aspirations. 

Endless corruption. 

NY Times: demand this president’s resignation!

If the Democratic leadership, starting with Nancy Pelosi and Joe Biden are not going to step up now, when would they?

Since 'the mad men of 1600 Penn Ave' has been walking towards martial law-like bellicose rhetoric and utterly irresponsible actions that are certain to put the United States of America into further chaos and death.

commentBody: It's quite remarkable. Trump has a knack for responding to problems and events in the most heinous, asinine, and destructive way. If Trump were president during The Civil War, he would have sent troops to protect the mansions of Southern plantation owners and to insure that slavery continued. Can you imagine if he were president during WW2. He would have buddy-ed up to Hitler and exchanged secrets and technology. His mode of thinking is completely out of step with America. It's stunning.

I am outraged and disgusted that peaceful protesters about a tragedy and a deep injustice were gassed so that Trump could mug and pose with a Bible at a church.

Is there nothing he doesn't desecrate in his own service?

commentBody:
Where is Joe Biden? The country is inflamed and we need a leader!

I am horrified at what Donald Trump and his remade Republican Party have done to our country.  But Joe Biden asked for the job of Democratic candidate for president and has been missing in action.  He needs to be out there, forcefully and articulately making the case for everything we believe in.  Protesters are in the streets after yet another murder of a black man by a police officer and Joe Biden needs to be speaking in front of the press, wearing a mask, and modeling safe behavior.

The time for hiding in the basement is over.  Joe Biden needs to be on the front lines to help us win back the White House and Senate.

As I read another slew of horrifying headlines I find myself thinking, "Trump is going to win if Joe Biden doesn't step up and do the job he has applied for.

commentBody:
I'm a white woman in my 60s. As I stood in my living room and watched the president of the United States say on television that he was invoking OUR military against OUR people, I began to tremble. Then pace. Then cry. NO. NO. NO.
I stand with my African American neighbors. I stand with the disenfranchised and the poor.
I stand against trump. I stand against police violence. I stand against racial and economic injustice.
Get that frightening and sick man out of our White House before we lose our democracy forever. Our democracy is more vulnerable than many realize.
Shame on the republican legislators for allowing this to happen. This is on their shoulders. This is their man. Theirs. Not mine.

commentBody:
I spent two hours last night from 10:30 to well past midnight watching a Time Magazine live facebook stream of a march through Brooklyn.  It was amazing.  I saw  a well-organized peaceful group march through the streets and past police lines, singing, chanting, dancing, and just talking.  Most were wearing masks.  Each time they came to a line of police the marchers raised their hands chanting  "don't shoot don't shoot."  The police watched. I saw no effort to enforce the curfew.  

Individuals in the march who appeared to be marshals directed where the crowd walked and started the chants of "don't shoot" that seemed to steer the crowd away from conflict with the police.  The event appeared extremely well organized.  

The live feed ended at half past twelve, so I don't know what happened later.  But this is what a peaceful protest looks like.  It was beautiful and inspiring.  

What I am seeing in the news, though, is windows broken on Fifth Avenue.  We need a different kind of reporting, that highlights the hours of peaceful protest and doesn't lead with looters.  Even more important, we need to know who is organizing these peaceful events, so we can distinguish them from those who start violence.  Peaceful protest is legal and essential and must grow and get more attention.  

And those of us who cannot join the marchers in person need to know who is leading them, so we can give them our financial support to keep up the good work.

commentBody: Trump's greatest triumph, making America a Third World County complete with a police state
Congratulations to Terence Monahan for embracing protestors.  That is what needs to be done.  Join together.  Support each other.

"Carnage" - with this word Trump started his catastrophic term in the WH. Carnage is what he created. Carnage will be his legacy.

It did not have to be that way. But America chose a Trump. I know, the popular vote etc,... But this is how you, America, elect your Presidents. 

 Imagine what a different President could have managed to prevent with regard to the pandemic and with regards to these (justified) protests. Some policemen who took the knee immediately defused what could have escalated into violence. Imagine a President who took the knee! Alas, that will probably never happen, - unless Joe Biden becomes a daring candidate.

commentBody: They gas clergy's  too.

As the old union organizing song says "Which side are you on?"

The photo op of Trump standing waving a Bible after having entirely peaceful protestors gassed is something that calls for denunciation by everyone, and especially by the communities of faith. In terms that they should understand, we stand on God's side and he is on the side of the evil one.

As I watched in disbelief the St. John's photo op last night, I remarked to my wife "If there was a God, a lightning bolt would strike leaving a wispy column of smoke next to a Bible lying on the bricks."

commentBody:
When you have a lawless President, you devolve as a nation.

Thanks so much GOP, for having our backs.

The picture of Trump with his upraised right hand clutching a Bible put me in mind of images of Hitler with his upraised right hand and a clinched fist.

Let us all hope that's where the similarity ends.
Odd how Trump decided to give his "dictator" speech just hours after he spoke on the phone with Putin. Guess he needed some advice.

Should violence be used against a president who repeatedly uses violence against the people he ostensibly leads?

I believe the founding fathers knew the answer to this, and I do as well.

"if you wish to know what a man really is, give him power."

Donald Trump is a Bible Salesman.

November 3 2020

This will just further enrage the population, and bring more enraged people out to the streets.

commentBody:
Trump precipitated three major crises in 2020.  Two months of early denial have led America to become the epicenter of COVID-19.  The economy has collapsed as the result of Trump's ill-conceived trade wars and Trump's bungled COVID-19 response.  And now we have national unrest, which Trump wants to suppress with the US military and martial law.

Trump has always aspired to be an authoritarian, and now he's getting his chance.  In Minnesota, where George Floyd's death triggered the national unrest, Governor Walz has listened to the demonstrators and the unrest is winding down.

After three and half years of Trump's constant lying, corruption and autocratic rule, 2020 is a fitting way to end his presidency, which has been an epic failure

Good grief, this is a photo op worthy of a dictator. What’s next? A giant banner portrait of trump hanging down the full length of the pillars of the Lincoln Memorial, covering the statue of the guy with the beard?

commentBody:
The show of excessive force by the police in response to protests against that very same deadly force is chilling. What were they thinking?

These images have finally made me understand the mindset of these powerful police unions, commanders, allied prosecutors, and so called "internal investigators" that have caused the slaughter of unarmed black men and women and the aggression against peaceful protestors this week.

My conclusion?  The police think of themselves as an occupying force in the United States.  American citizens in our communities are seen as the insurgent enemy and must be subdued and controlled. The military paraphernalia the police use on domestic soil just reinforces that thinking.

I'm frightened for the future of our very fragile democracy in what appears to be a rapidly escalating police state.

When a policeman allowed another policeman to commit a crime, they become complices.
When protester allowed looting, they become looters.

commentBody: All Trump can bring to a crisis is matches and gasoline.

Of all the stories the NYT writes, I’m yet to see anything critical on the mayor in nyc. He’s been a disaster since the day he was elected. He’s been the worst person for the job during covid and not the rioting. 
May 5 he said no protests during a pandemic. And then when the protests weren’t going to be against him, he allowed it. And nobody from NYT says a word.

At least once a day at this point, I seem find myself in a conversation with relative strangers and inevitably a topic transitions into something related to Trump and I end up saying I can only imagine how people around the world now see us and how embarrassed i am to have this garbage human being in charge. This has been compounded over the last few months when i've reluctantly asked some colleagues abroad what they think of Trump and us and the answer is always some form of "you don't want to know". 

Regardless of the undeniable fact that he finished with the least amount of votes among the top 2 candidates, he won and as a result, I always wonder if people see me and assume there's a better than 50% chance I voted for him. It's kind of sickening to me.

commentBody:
Please, Congressional Republicans, reign this guy in.  Is maintaining your power really worth what you are allowing him to do to this country?

OUR government is here to represent US.  OUR police and military forces are here to protect US.  ALL of US.  Not just the rich, powerful, white.
The protests seem to work for Trump as his Reichstag Fire. Newspapers around the world conclude that on Monday, darkness descended in the USA.

If you really want to see how far we have fallen at the lead of the republican party and the aid of the media, just watch Republicans from the 90's wringing their hands about President Clinton. How they had to impeach because of the example he was setting for children.

These people are traitors and Biden needs to proclaim loudly and forcefully that his first order is going to be bringing justice back to this country, starting at the top. Yes, Congressmen, Senators, and aides need to be brought to account for their treason.

Trump was elected by a crowd chanting "Lock Her Up" on fabricated charges that they can't even define. We have a real criminal, where are the leaders calling for him to be imprisoned?

Step back and watch this with the eye of history. 

A weak President, doddering, clueless and vain.  

A working class and middle class who endured two decades of declining fortunes in the so-called land of plenty while oligarchy flourished. 

A sudden burst of hope with 8 years of our first Black President, smashed and defiled with the deliberate glee of a toddler by the race-baiting, illegally elected Trump backed by dark money and foreign influence and it seems the Dark Lord himself. 

Four years of systematic cultivation and incitement of heavily armed red-state thugs whose marches - with AK 47s for crying out loud! - into capital buildings is tolerated.  

More than a decade of the relentless militarization of police, who now have Humvees and armored personnel carriers and obscene stormtrooper uniforms, SWAT outfits and riot gear, all speaking to the theme of suppressing not criminality but democratic assembly. These militarized police are revealed to routinely use chokeholds and other forms of violence against the people of color whom they disproportionately target.  

Technology is used to brainwash and manipulate the truth and dissemination of facts as people become addicted to swiping and poking at their cellphones instead of watching the world around them and reading books. 

Civics is no longer taught and few people vote. 

This was inevitable.

I pray to all the gods in the heavens that it results in profound and positive change in every corner of America.
Trump at church, well that's a first. You don't see any photos of him on a Sunday.  Perhaps the car broke down and the A/C wouldn't work.

He hid in his bunker. We made fun of it.  China even made fun of him for it.  

So he wanted a photo op of himself walking out his front gate because his ego was bruised.  For that, he had peaceful protesters gassed out of the way.  What a disgraceful scene.

The whole church stunt is very Old Testament. Clearly, dear leader has an affinity for the wrath and vengeance aspects of religion. 

10 commandments? Not so much. 

God bless.

Of course had the peaceful protesters  instead been been wearing MAGA hats and waving flags and AR15's around and screaming obscenities at nurses, no problem.  Instead of getting tear-gassed, the Dear Leader would have cheered them on.

Trump intentionally stirred the pot last night; his remarks were intended to  - and did - inflame protestors rather than quelling the violence.  

Our Mad King reached lower than he ever had last night and put other peaceful Americans in danger to salve his fragile ego.
Just go home! Enough, the American public is tired of your destruction, let people open their businesses in peace.

As an ev. Christian, I struggle daily in prayer with not hating Trump and his administration for harming others. Without a doubt, I hate their actions. Trump and his administration have consciously and intentionally manipulated the name of Jesus Christ and used cultural markers of Christianity to support their immoral and violent administration. It is utter blasphemy to associate them with Jesus Christ in any way.               In a commentary on Dante, Dorothy Sayers wrote this about the fall in the garden and those who choose to know evil instead of good. She calls it the "Illusion of Hell": "If we refuse to assent to reality; if we rebel against the nature of things and choose to think that what we at the moment want is the centre of the universe to which everything else ought to accommodate itself, the first effect on us will be that the whole universe will seem to be filled with an implacable and inexplicable hostility. We shall begin to feel that everything has a down on us, and that, being so badly treated, we have a just grievance against things in general. That is the knowledge of good as evil and the fall into illusion. If we cherish and fondle that grievance, and would rather wallow in it and vent our irritation in spite and malice rather than humbly admit we are in the wrong and try to amend our behavior so as to get back to reality, that is, while it lasts, the deliberate choice, and a foretaste of the experience, of Hell."
As a blue dog liberal through and through, I have to be honest, I’m less concerned about the photo op story, and more concerned about police getting shot in multiple cities.

What Nectarine Nero is playing on here is quite easy to see through.
He wanted to start a war with some other country, but he was not able to.
So now, he ignores a pandemic warning, making sure that as many as possible get ill, and die, while closing the country down. 
This didn't work so well, so amidst the ongoing violence going on after another innocent person is killed, he just goes golfing, and waits for more riots.
Now that there are riots, he feels free to quell an insurrection around the country, and use his military. When this fails, he can declare martial law, and cancel the elections indefinitely. 
He can then declare himself king, or supreme ruler, or just plain dictator.
This because he knows that when he is out of office, he is in for a very long time in court which shall end in his imprisonment, along with members of his family and administration.
The entire administration's aim is to destroy the country, while stealing as much of its resources as possible.

There was a coup. American citizens were terrorized by federal authorities with flash bombs, tear gas, and armored forces and driven from Lafayette. It was horrific. “If you don’t dominate, you look like jerks.” Trump told American Governors in preparation for his “triumphal march” to a Church where he held up a Bible and posed. 
When the American people were horrified by the murder of George Floyd by four policemen, it wakened outrage everywhere. To watch a policeman put his weight on the neck of a defenseless handcuffed black man assisted by three other policemen two held Floyd while the other waved off civilians imploring them to let him breathe. None of the officers were stopped. No officer was arrested at the scene. 
Demonstrators gathered at the scene. Peaceful demonstrators were attacked by the Police who used tear gas, and plastic bullets on the first night. What followed was demonstrations all over the country. 
The news media turned it’s attention to violence, and looting. 4000 people were arrested. Three policemen who assisted in the murder walk free. Politicians focus on the “unrest”. Trump championed the peaceful demonstrators just before he had his forces attack them in Lafayette so he could stroll into the park. 
Will the news media focus on the dangerous dictatorial abuse of power that threatens our government and our way of life or will they resume their coverage of fires and broken glass?
Do you listen yet?
Trump near a church. It had to have been Photo Shopped.

If you ever need a guillotine, feel free to ask.
We would be happy to help the US citizens if we can.
Courage les amis!

commentBody: Yesterday, I witnessed live on television President of the United States ordering mounted police and riot troops to fire teargas, flash grenades and rubber bullets in order to clear streets of peaceful, lawful  protesters so that he could then pose with Bible in hand in front of a historic church. He never entered the church, he never prayed and I sincerely doubt he ever read the Bible. He never mention the protester’s  cause, nor expressed any empathy or understanding of their anger and pain from racial injustice. The man is a disgrace. I’ve had more than enough. Trump must go.

commentBody:
Military intervention to suppress these riots would surely be the largest domestic armed forces deployment since the Civil War.

In the past, riots were limited to a particular city or area. This is a nationwide revolt.

commentBody: Does the Times actually know the Definition of peaceful?  One need only look at the vandalism outside our capital building to understand the Times version of peaceful vs. reality.

The President has every right, just like any citizen, to go to an historic church. Protesters have a right to protest peacefully but they don't own the District of Columbia and the Secret Service must protect the President. This is a non-story but the continued death and destruction in our major cities is the story. One thing is certain: the need to obtain justice for George Floyd is being delayed and complicated by a violent element and elements who are seizing the chance to get Rolexes, Nikes,  whatever. When peace and quiet return examination of the root causes of profiling, discrimination, unequal justice, lack of equal schooling and a host of other issues must be addressed and I applaud the non-violent protesters for focusing on that. It was 1968 when the Koener Commission said we were heading for two societies: one black, one white, and unequal. They were right. We don't need another commission to repeat that and taking year or two but we need to address this in tangible meaningful ways starting with education in poor neighborhoods and those police who need to be weeded out. And we need it now.

commentBody:
Watching the military police Trump had called to DC simply open up "fire" on peaceful protestors was chilling.  Sure it was tear gas and rubber bullets but it simply came without warning.  Then we come to find all this was a show of force by the president so he could cross the street and pose by a church, waving a bible.

This is more than surreal.  Those images will burn in my brain for a long time.  How did things get so bad so quickly, that the world is watching the United States melt into chaos, a war zone?

US democracy, so long admired by the world, is dissolving right before our eyes.  Meanwhile, the president is "activating Bill Barr (whatever that means) and putting General Milly "In charge"of things.  

Donald Trump is exploiting America's right to protest so he can look tough during his upcoming campaign.  How did one man bring this country to its knees in such a short time?

commentBody:
...but also, organized protesting with continue because so many people have lost their jobs. Why?  Because  back in January, Trump listened to the advice of money mongers in power rather than scientists.  Why?  He has two goals, 1) keep himself and friends rich by 2) inciting a culture war that will keep him in power.  Check and check.  Krugman in his article today said he didn't think there'd be an all out race war anytime soon.  I'd say that is a failure of imagination.  

Actually, for Trump, things are going pretty well.  As he said on Sunday he feels "very safe."  This all seems like a Putin playbook which makes sense since, according to a Kremlin readout, they talked yesterday and have been chatting regularly all spring. 

These past few months, trapped in my house watching my children not get educated (distance learning?  please.)  watching what is happening to this country.  This is why I vomited the night Trump got elected.  But I could never imagine it could get this bad.

The tear gas prevented the 'peaceful protest' to potentially turn into mayhem and destruction, as seen elsewhere in the past few days. Restoring and maintaining order against an unruly, bent-on-destruction mob requires forceful measures, commensurate with the level of threat.
That is any and all governments' primary responsibility.
Period.

Trump supporters are the minority.

commentBody:
We lament the toadies surrounding the White House would-be Putin, but what is The New York Times  doing to combat this menace.

Sure, The Times cannot offend its GOP advertisers, by making editorial effective comments, that is understood, that is obvious. But why is The Times muffling the voices of the readership?

The Times AI algorythms are blacklisting more and more reader comments. Voices that were regularly printed months ago have been disappearing from these pages. Whether that is the work of White House moles embedded in  The Times staff, or the editorial board, something must be done before our Putin wannabee destroys  our nation AND the failing New York Times, failing to do the courageous thing.

commentBody: At curfew you MUST disperse.   What the last few days have unfortunately taught us is that EVERY protest is peaceful until IT’s NOT!

I've been telling you for a year or two here that the fix is in for a military takeover after Trump was heavily aided in his rise to power by many established authorities and media. Just as I had predicted, he was trying to spark outrage and violence as an excuse to justify the conspiracy to military domination. It happened! And now everyone demonstrating must retreat so he has no excuse for his coup, and everyone must reinforce their defenses for what might be a lingering trouble Trump will capitalize on. The murder of Floyd was deliberate as you all saw. Don't let the Trump coup occur taking advantage of your anger. Compose yourselves and get smart, not wild.
