commentBody:
The Armful
Robert Frost

For every parcel I stoop down to seize
I lose some other off my arms and knees,
And the whole pile is slipping, bottles, buns-
Extremes too hard to comprehend at once,
Yet nothing I should care to leave behind.
With all I have to hold with hand and mind
And heart, if need be, I will do my best
To keep their building balanced at my breast.
I crouch down to prevent them as they fall;
Then sit down in the middle of them all.
I had to drop the armful in the road
And try to stack them in a better load.

Brilliant propaganda by 45 and his enablers.  Stride through the unwashed to hold the good book.  It will work wonders in flyover country.  

In the real world, at the edges, people are out of work.  It is summer.  Not much better to do for kids out of work than rage against the machine, they have nothing to lose.

The president poses in front of a burned out church.
That's symbolism.
Why is he holding a Bible?
That's the next thing he's going to want burned.  
It's the last thing that prevents people from worshiping him.

Is there anything more fraudulent than a Bible salesman publicly hawking his snake oil minutes after raining down violence on peaceful protesters ?

More evidence that there is no bottom for the occupant of the Oval Office.

Jesus would be utterly appalled at the expropriation of his good name and good words by the Bible salesman in the White House.

Never forget Trump's goals to win the election and stay in power.  A  man void of emotion and humanity with a narcissistic focus is not going to have any leadership qualities. You lead when you   have basic human empathy and understanding for others and a wish to improve the conditions for all.  Perhaps we are lucky that Trump did not order the protesters shot instead of gassed so he could get to St Johns Church for a photo op. It can always get worse, but I don't see how. He is pulling this country down to his level.

Good. Enough is enough. This cannot continue indefinitely.

At the end of the day, the citizens of our cities want law and order and their streets back.

Nobody said people couldn't protest. But where are the protest leaders? What specifically do the protesters want, other than to vent their anger (rightfully so) over the killing of George Floyd and the treatnent of people of color by the police?
I haven't seen any speeches setting an agenda for cause (at least none on TV), no direction - just anger. Its enough. Go home and work to change the "system" if you don't like it. Get involved...just yelling and marching around can only go so far and if continued, I fear will end very badly for many of these protesters as the government (local, state and federal) will do what is necessary to restore peace and order.

Marching in the streets, giving cover (I'm going to say - unintentionally) for antifa and criminals who cause chaos and destruction, cannot continue.

And so much for all the big concern about "stopping the spread" of coronavirus...what about all the innocent citizens who these protesters are going to infect, potentially causing their deaths? I thought ALL "lives matter"? Guess not.

commentBody:
Military Police from the National Guard in combat camouflage surged in front of law enforcement officers, using shields to push back peaceful protesters from the mouth of Lafayette Square. Then the police used tear gas and flash grenades to clear out the crowd so Trump, Barr, and the rest of their despotic clan, could visit the nearby St. John’s Church. Trump then stood in front of the church posing for photographs. No prayer issued from Trump's lips; instead he posed for photos, holding a Bible like it was a brick he was about to toss.

Trump walked back to the White House after a few minutes: his photo-op done.

Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington was "outraged" that Trump went to the church "after he threatened to rain down military force."

I've lived through many terrible things and seen many terrible things. I always expect the worst of Trump, but I never thought I'd see this in America. 

Every president from James Madison attended St. John's until Richard Nixon refused. The most devoted presidential attendee was Abraham Lincoln who regularly joined in prayer from an inconspicuous pew at the rear of the church.

This was Trump declaring war on a peaceful protest. This was Trump declaring war on America and Americans. How can anyone who claims to believe in God support Trump? How can anyone who claims to believe in the Bible support Trump? How can anyone who claims to believe in justice support Trump? How can any American support Trump?

I'd imagine the U.S. Military doesn't like the idea using violence against it's own citizens. That could bring a calamity I doubt they would have the ability to deal with. Something tells me that they're probably making contingency plans to deal with an unhinged President and a transition to normalcy with an effective leader in place if things go horribly wrong. King Trump probably feels he has sole control of the hearts and minds of those he's asking to protect his twisted vision, but I'm sure there are plenty of critical thinkers in our armed forces that serve the country first and not the president.
Why was Trump on the phone with Putin prior to the conversation with governors? What was that about?

Yes  agree

  My worry is - what are Trump and his advisors like S Miller, truly capable of after he loses the Presidential election in November.?   154 days plus or minus...if it is mail in vote due to COVID...  

As Trump would say -"what do you// I have to lose?!"
..It is a valid problem for our Country.  He has absolutely nothing to lose those 2 tenuous months before the January Inauguration of Candidate Biden. 

 Except to bring "another"(***already a potential case= in the Southern District of NY)  lawsuit against himself, when he is a public citizen after 12pm January 20th.

commentBody:
The reality television president strikes again.  Dismayed that he was accurately portrayed as an elderly, obese, effete, physical coward cringing in a basement, fearing for his safety, he summoned his hired goons paid for with our taxpayer dollars, Bill Barr and Joint Chiefs of Staff General Milley for his photo op.  The three portly men ordered tear gas and rubber bullets shot into a peacefully assembled crowd so that Donald could mince down the cleared path, crossing the street to a church.  He has never set foot into a church, but there’s no business like show business, so he stood glowering for the cameras, gingerly holding the Bible up as though it were a Roman candle about to explode.  His enablers swooned, singing the requisite praises.  The world watched, aghast.

On November 3, vote.  Your life depends on it.  Democracy depends on it.

commentBody:
“After Mr. Trump’s aides spent much of Monday expressing outrage over the burning of a place of worship, Hope Hicks, a presidential adviser, eventually hatched a plan with others at the White House to have the president walk over to the building, according to an official familiar with the events.”

““He did not pray,” said Mariann E. Budde, the Episcopal bishop of Washington. “He did not mention George Floyd, he did not mention the agony of people who have been subjected to this kind of horrific expression of racism and white supremacy for hundreds of years.””

Basically all we need to know about our Commander-in-Chief. A man who does not pray. A man who has the vaguest concept of God. A man who has absolutely no empathy for others. A man who will step over people in order to secure a photo-op of him in some flattering light.

Not only the worst President America has ever had, but probably the shallowest human being on Earth.

God help us.

How can anyone support this madness?

commentBody:
George Floyd was publicly murdered by police on May 25, Memorial Day.

The entire nation watched the video within a day or two of the murder.

The Minnesota protests and riots started on Tuesday May 26.

The protests and riots started to spread nationwide on Wednesday May 27.

On Friday May 29, the best 'leadership' that Trump could offer a wounded nation was a Tweet that said “when the looting starts, the shooting starts.”

Today is Tuesday June 2, a week after the protests and civil unrest over police and racial injustice began and still the leader of our nation has failed to give a prime time national address to the nation acknowledging the pain, injustice and need for racial reconciliation and systemic reform to our broken country.

What was needed six or seven days ago was a President to go on TV and address the nation in a very human, consoling, empathetic and problem-solving way.

What we got instead was Twitter and Rose Garden threats to Americans, zero empathy, Donald hiding in the White House basement and no attempt to heal and reconcile the nation's racial wounds.

Like the coronavirus response management failure that preceded it, Trump has failed to respond to yet another major American crisis by ignoring all the clues that disaster was unfolding and failed to take any serious adult steps at acknowledging, preventing or managing this disaster.

Yet again, Trump has presided over disaster with exceptional incompetence and failure.

He needs to go.

November 3 2020.

Trump and the Bible....and his base. 

A sleepy, out-dated and fraudulent trio. 

Trump looked like the loser he is yesterday — tear-gassing people on the way to church to hold a bible for a sleepy photo op. 

...and the evangelicals find this acceptable; the Bible as a prop and the tear-gassing of course. 

They’re all frauds in a pod.

commentBody: My wife was incandescent with rage when she saw a President engaging is such a shallow photo op at the expense of unleashing the American military on Americans. I was just disgusted. Is there a third option? Oh, yeah, get rid of this abomination a.s.a.p.

Well, in a way Trump, ignorant though he is of all things Christian, and vile though his action was in using religion as a political prop, has one thing right in holding up the Bible.  These peaceful protests concerning the death of George Floyd (and other African-Americans) certainly violate a clear biblical mandate:  Thou.  Shalt.  Not.  Kill.

I agree with those who said the photo op was not Trump with the Bible; the photo op was the dispersal of peaceful protests with tear gas and flashbangs and force on Trump’s order.   Trump supporters are thrilled to see Trump in command  and besting his political opponents by force.  This taste will motivate them to call for more and more violent suppression of free speech.

“They’re not with us!” shouted Steevo Anthony, 33, a supervisor at Whole Foods from Brooklyn, as he moved away from the looting. “Keep walking!”

Trembling with emotion, he added: “It’s giving a bad name to us people who are out here trying to do the right thing, the people who walked away.”
______________________

It bothered me when, during the first eruption of looting, some people -- too many people -- were trying to dignify the thievery with specious explanations that the thieves were enacting rage against injustice. 

I've seen rage. Cackling, as the criminals on Fifth Avenue did while stealing armfuls of merchandise, isn't a symptom of rage. 

Perhaps if so many hadn't draped larceny in a mantle of legitimacy from the outset, wave after wave of these criminals wouldn't have been emboldened to use demonstrations as an excuse and an opportunity for their criminality.

I get it: peaceful marchers don't want to risk their own health by confronting thugs. But the sincere, law-abiding marchers do have a weapon at their disposal to fight back against the criminals. They have phones with cameras.

Every marcher who'd rather that these demonstrations be legitimate expressions of outrage should have phones ready to film the thieving punks the minute they start breaking glass. Then, if they're not willing to send the evidence to the local police (I wouldn't trust Trump's DOJ for a second), they should post the evidence on social media with a disclaimer like Mr. Anthony's.

Trump is losing. 

The more he pushes, the larger his defeat. 

He will take the republicans down with him.

commentBody: I get wanting to blame racists or selfish presidents.  However, I think the real problem is unions, unions that protect police allowing them to terrorize communities and people with impunity.  It does not matter who the president is, unless it changes so that the workers loyalty is to their employers (state governments) and to the people that they serve (us) instead of their unions, not much will change.  Maybe at best the police will be just brutal and careful to not kill people during their brutality.

commentBody: Shutdown Twitter, Facebook and other social media globally for a one week cooling off period. If Dorsey, Zuckerberg et al won’t do it voluntarily then the US government should order it the exact same way as they ordered the shutting down of bricks and mortar shops. Social media is certainly contributing to the spread of hatred, outrage and violence the same way that barbershops  were contributing to the spread of the coronavirus. SHUT THEM DOWN!

commentBody:
Last night Retired Lt. General Honore' was interviewed shortly after President Trumps offensive and staged spectacle at St Johns Church.  Listening to him was somehow comforting.

Honore' stated many things based on his vast experience, including- the General Counsel for the Pentagon should immediately file something Tuesday morning, with The Senate and Congress.   To initiate a check and balance on Trumps " threat" to illegally send Military troops into the States the President believes are not dominating the protesters effectively.   I might not have the exact formal terms highlighted correctly, but that was his stated intention.    I hope this formality happens today.   Some kind of hope.

Check and balance?   Our Atty General = Barr was all in on the spectacle last night and is in effect co-signing Trumps rogue actions.   Walking along with Trump and with the group to the Church.   Supposedly the WH intended the staged event  to be a "solemn photo op"  and Attorney General Barr couldn't even put on a tie to pretend it was.   The whole image felt like an attempted coup.

commentBody: I am a long time subscriber and daily reader of the NYT.  In a time of turmoil and charges of “fake news” proliferating, I am deeply troubled when I see careless and inaccurate reporting in this paper.  This article has a photo caption which claims protesters in Minnesota, my home state, are outside the governor’s mansion in Minneapolis.  The building is in Saint Paul.  In an accompanying article your reporter describes St. John’s church in DC as “graffiti-laden,” a somewhat socially charged term to use when a photo then depicts Trump, bible in hand, standing before a graffiti free St. John’s.  Please, editors, if there was ever a time you needed to ensure accuracy, it is now.  More care and less unsupported florid language would be welcome, especially from the NYT.

commentBody:
Trump is losing the election. He has already shown he will do anything to win. Fomenting unrest and declaring martial law are not beyond him. They are part of his plan! Wake up America. This is happening. 

Dispersing peaceful protesters with teargas to pose with a Bible? Young white men causing mayhem in cities with peaceful protests to discredit them to whip people into a frenzy only to step in claiming insurrection? Attorney General Barr standing by as police follow Trump’s command to disperse peaceful protesters amid declarations of domestic terrorism?

The threat to our democracy has never been more real. Authoritarian rule, here we come.

commentBody:
“There’s a lot of privileged white women, and I’m one of them,” Ms. Muffett said. “I’ve never had a cop treat me like that.” Then, perhaps, the tide is beginning to turn in America. Maybe white Americans are beginning to see that policing isn't about protection; it's about power--theirs. 

Bad cops thrive under bad administrations; they are the Petri dishes from which the violence originates. Desk commanders and street cops know that the civil authorities who fund them granted them the authority to refuse to exercise restraint and tact. Badges are shields against accountability.

So it was hardly a surprise that, last evening, the president of the United States gave orders for a peaceful demonstration to be destroyed. His addition to the spotlight and attention is so complete that he failed to recognize the incongruity of his actions. He could stroll across Pennsylvania Avenue, through Lafayette Park, to stand in front of a church to hold up a Bible and smile. Nothing else. Oh; he wore no mask in another shout-out to his armed, Confederate flag-waving civil libertarian protestors throughout the land. "Watch me," he said. "Do as I do."

The president's actions told us is that power is his right and his might is unquestioned. That's the same mindset that ended George Floyd's life a week ago. The president made no mention of the murdered man or his family. His position and posture were those of a carnival barker at a reality television show.

Ask him if he cares.

[{'commentID': 107375487, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107375487, 'userID': 68523045, 'userDisplayName': 'Stephen Csiszar', 'userLocation': 'Carthage NC', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Red Sox, ‘04, ‘07, ‘13, ‘18 

Yes, a theatric gesture that said: I do as I please.
Clumsy as always, but effective. Maybe not the way he wants.

Lost in this melee is the fact that the officer and George Floyd knew each other.

They both were employed at the same Latin Club.
Not a lot of emphasis on this, wonder why?', 'createDate': '1591096360', 'updateDate': '1591122590', 'approveDate': '1591099255', 'recommendations': 5, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375111, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Red Sox, ‘04, ‘07, ‘13, ‘18', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107375487', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107376697, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107376697, 'userID': 47269236, 'userDisplayName': 'Chip', 'userLocation': 'Wheelwell, Indiana', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/pimage.timespeople.nytimes.com/avatars/cropped-abad1f39fff0f0ee8b07075e1f4f1979fdbd4cb6277fc81e8ceccf64d0342b90.jpg', 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Stephen Csiszar it may add to the motive, but the act was still murder one.', 'createDate': '1591100031', 'updateDate': '1591150731', 'approveDate': '1591101388', 'recommendations': 2, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375487, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Red Sox, ‘04, ‘07, ‘13, ‘18', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107376697', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107376868, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107376868, 'userID': 57543070, 'userDisplayName': 'sharon', 'userLocation': 'worcester county, ma', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Red Sox, ‘04, ‘07, ‘13, ‘18 
Police are out of control in everywhere. Rural and urban. Our daughter, her husband and their two friends, all white, were followed home one night by our local police; lights flashing, sirens blaring. For what? Our son-in-law had lights on his windshield washer jets which were legal, he having checked with the registry prior to installing them. The cop told him he didn't care if they were legal. He didn't want them in "his" town. All in the car were asked for ID's like we lived in Nazi Germany. My daughter was denigrated by this cop for not having a license and demanded why she lost it. (She has never driven since she is legally blind in one eye). This in liberal Massachusetts.

Her younger brother started walking home from his McD's job at 7 a.m. when he was sent home from work until I could pick him up. A cop stopped him and asked him what he was doing in the neighborhood. It's a major road and he was in his McD's uniform! He was harassed another time for being a truant from school, asked to show ID, even though he had graduated years back. He had no ID and was harassed for not having a license to show as ID. Since he had no car a license, we wrongly thought, was unnecessary. Not so in Nazi America.

I know this in no way compares to what is happening in the African American communities but it does demonstrate the "above the law" attitude our local police have, even in rural, affluent communities. We need to rein this in before it's too late.', 'createDate': '1591100511', 'updateDate': '1591144964', 'approveDate': '1591101916', 'recommendations': 17, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375111, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Red Sox, ‘04, ‘07, ‘13, ‘18', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107376868', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: August 1934 is here

I watched that church photo op develop in real time and felt viscerally ill. With Bill Barr, the DNI, and a representative from the Pentagon standing with him, it looked very much like a coup of our democracy was taking place. 

While that may have been Bill Barr’s motive, it came to light almost immediately that Donald Trump was just embarrassed by the worldwide reaction to his cowardly bunker hiding and felt he needed to show himself in public. Of course the coward was surrounded by acres and acres of security and mobs of White House personnel as he paraded out of the White House, unlike the shocked protesters who were violently shoved back to clear the way.

I have never felt such fear and anger in my life. Where is the leadership in this country? Why aren’t Nancy Pelosi and Mitch McConnell stepping into the void to calm this nation? Where is Joe Biden? Where is ANYONE?!

Since last evening, I am realizing that I felt for just moments what black people and people of color have been feeling for years.  Last night and this morning, I continue to ask, just like you - where are our leaders?  what can we do?  we must separate the looting from the protesting, we must Vote out this administration and we must make a change(s) to move forward.  I pray it is not too late.', 'createDate': '1591095678', 'updateDate': '1591192822', 'approveDate': '1591095834', 'recommendations': 255, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375014, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Frau Greta', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107375339', 'isAnonymous': False}]

Election Day cannot come soon enough.', 'createDate': '1591101279', 'updateDate': '1591143001', 'approveDate': '1591101927', 'recommendations': 7, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375010, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'BA', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107377179', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 107377545, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 107377545, 'userID': 66383951, 'userDisplayName': 'TLee', 'userLocation': 'Jersey City', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Independent Observer This is at least the second comment of yours that highlights the "injuries" of the Secret Service. In fact, only 11 were treated at the hospital, all for non-serious wounds. 

Your observations sure don't seem independent at all: your support of water cannons, tear gas, rubber bullets, and jail time for protesters is deeply authoritarian. It isn't rooted in justice at all. Especially considering the percentage of rioters among the protesters.  Surely, you cannot be in support of a country that shoots its citizens for throwing water bottles. 

These protesters are hundreds of thousands of your fellow citizens over 75 major US cities: the rioters are relatively few. For every protester, there are hundreds that believe in their right to peaceful protest, who believe as fervently in the first amendment as you do the second. 

No life lost is acceptable, but I sincerely hope your righteous indignation has been stirred by the over 103k Americans who died of COVID-19, choking and breathless due to the incompetence and lack of Federal preparation and leadership.', 'createDate': '1591102146', 'updateDate': '1591143059', 'approveDate': '1591103279', 'recommendations': 16, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 107375577, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'BA', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '107377545', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: Ironically the consequence of Trump invoking martial law is that he will contrivet to maintain the emergency until past November and he will abrogate the presidential elections and remain in office Indefinitely.  Tha is precisely what he has threatened already many times and these protests have been a golden opportunity for him to see is imperial powers.  Certainly Congress is not going to say anything as they have remained acquiescent and silent throughout, though the spontaneous irrepressible outbreak of riots is a referendum on Trump’s misrule.
